story:
How it played out:

  • Aalto University had a space that was empty;
  • People from varying backgrounds filled said space;
  • Someone suggested taking 30 Aalto people to meet the 70,000 at Burning Man festival Nevada USA;
  • Nobody laughed at the idea;
  • Burning Man organisation loved the idea!;
  • We got a green light for an Art Installation;
  • Ideas were born, sparks flew and things got crazy;
  • Crazy turned to impossible, impossible turned into a project;
  • Filming of this insane journey began;
  • The folk lore legend: Väinämöinen (The original Gandalf) awoke from his slumber and requested an instrument worthy of him to play!
  • A Giant Pike Head Kantele (National Finnish Instrument) was born and we joined forces with Koistinen Kantele family (The Stradivarius of kantele's);
  • Our documentary permit was accepted by Burning Man;
  • We realised we had run out of funds and time;
  • Go go Indiegogo :-)

Lets start with our beautiful fish head art/instrument:

We have built a prototype Pike head structure in Finland and will now have to recreate and rebuild this beast in Reno USA to be ready to ship to the desert.  This piece is our answer to the art application we successful made with Burning Man.  

Now why a giant Pike head?

Finland's national folk law which inspired the Lord of the rings mythology, speaks of a god by the name of Väinämöinen.  This bad ass wizard character fashioned a musical instrument from a giant Pike's jaw bone, the Kantele.  So to remember our storytelling roots and heritage we are bringing back the Pike with a modern twist.

Currently all our funds have gone into the supplies, transportation and manufacturing of the Pike head.  

The Pike head is made up of a precision cut plywood skeleton and a braided plywood veneer as its scales.  Our pike will be illuminated and contain solar technology to bring it to life.  Then finally the most unique part of the piece... the one of a kind hand crafted tongue instrument (Kantele).


So now we should probably explain what we need this money for right :-)

First off we have raised 6,000€ from Aalto University's Design Factory to get the project started, this was coupled with a lot of volunteers and endless nights.

This project has been and continues to be a minefield of unknowns and unexpected  challenges.  We have to arrange transportation to and from multiple destinations with a few tonnes of material and supplies with each step of the way threatening to derail the whole project. 

The costs so far for logistics and materials is just over 10,000€ However we were lucky to receive a grant of 7,500€ from TTER (Technical Student's support foundation), leaving us a current deficit of 2,500€

Our Camp/Theme camp

Keeping the Kalevala (Finnish folk lore) theme we named our Finnish + friends, Camp: Tuonela, this means the Underworld. 

At the camp we will have around 35 people sleeping and living, we must setup everything we need to survive in the desert for just over a week.  Including power, lighting, toilet facilities, cooking facilities and shade from the intense heat of the sun.

Our camp will be another destination for our activities and interactions with the other desert dwellers know as Burners.  We are holding workshops, talks and musical performances there.  Aalto University's teachings and learning's can be present in the most unlikely of places :-)

The camp creation, running and cleaning costs are currently at 8,000€


Tickets, Travel, Accommodation and stuff to keep us alive

Each member of Aalto on Fire has personally invested an average of 3,000€, this is something we are not asking to be funded nor reimbursed as this project is one of commitment and dedication. 


The Documentary!

The most epic of journeys deserves to be shared to our student body but additionally to a wider audience.  We started filming on a budget of next to zero with the aim of editing a 10 - 20 min trailer type documentary for the likes of Youtube.  We successful had our application to film at Burning Man approved and then things got crazy big...

YLE (Finland's national broadcast network) caught wind of our idea and suggested we join forces with Documentary film maker Oskari Pastila.  Oskari and recently joined our project and we are now going to film the entire journey in a feature length film aimed for distribution by YLE!!!!!!!!

Oskari's previous work speaks for its self:

http://www.knucklebonehead.com

http://basketcase-film.com/

http://www.taynnatarmoa.fi

https://vimeo.com/63230173

This now gives us the ability to tell our story and hopefully inspire our students and all those out there that believe learning and development should be fun, adventurous, challenging and not without risk.

Costs involved with the documentary, excluding post production are at 18,300€
This leaves us with a current funding goal of 28,800€
We have aimed at 25,001€ before some costs blew out however we hope we can exceed our goal and receive additional funding through grants.

More updates to soon follow and we appreciate all the help and support!

Some Perky pics:

*Please note: we have put the english translation at the bottom of the spanish text.

LA HISTORIA 

Mi hija se llama Valentina, tiene siete años y va entrar a la primaria. Ella nació con atrofia de nervio óptico y parálisis cerebral tipo hemiparesia espástica izquierda.

Yo diseño, produzco y adapto materiales y libros de texto para que Valentina asista a una escuela que no sea exclusiva para discapacitados desde hace 4 años.  Lo hago con la ayuda de profesionales de la educación y de la educación especial, a su vez orientados por  médicos especialistas que observan el desarrollo de Valentina.

Algunas personas tienen una impresión equivocada ante el concepto de discapacidad ya que lo relacionan con retraso mental, y esto no es así. 

Dentro de una sociedad que culturalmente discrimina y excluye la llegada de Valentina a la escuela significa la oportunidad de ampliar nuestra conciencia sobre la diversidad. 

Médicos, especialistas en la educación, padres de familia, y compañeros de estudio de Valentina han estado cerca de nuestro proceso y coinciden en que Valentina tiene capacidad para estar en un ambiente escolar, además conocen nuestra realidad económica.

Quienes han estado presentes son testigos de que una situación como la de Valentina requiere mayor trabajo y menor ingreso económico. He trabajado en horarios extraordinarios para poder llevar acabo su proceso de rehabilitación y habilitación por siete años. Fisioterapia, medicamentos controlados, uso de ortesis, y la constancia en su tratamiento desde su nacimiento nos ha llevado a ambas a obtener estos resultados, Valentina en primaria!!! Nadie lo hubiera creído nunca.  El proyecto en indiegogo surge ante la imposibilidad de continuar solas.

La rehabilitación física  sirve de mucho si  se acompaña de la participación social efectiva. Si se propician los ambientes adecuados para desarrollar capacidades y no discapacidades. 

La realidad es que nadie le entra porque es costoso y la mayoría no podemos costearlo.

Valentina no encaja en las escuelas tradicionales públicas porque la aceptan y la pasan de grado sin importarles si aprende. En las escuelas para discapacitados tampoco, ya que es capaz de socializar, ser independiente y aprender cuestiones académicas, ella no tiene un compromiso motor que empeore su condición educativa.

La escuela para la que estoy pidiendo su apoyo cuenta con un ambiente escolar preparado, con un método educativo que hemos comprobado, donde Valentina logra el aprendizaje y su inclusión social. Por ser una escuela nueva le ha otorgado el  25% de descuento en la colegiatura, pero nos ha solicitado un monitor que acompañe a Valentina mientras la conocen y eso tiene un costo independientemente de la colegiatura,  adicional es la creación y adaptación de materiales que yo realizo. 

Pido un voto de confianza de parte de todos a los que pueda llegar este proyecto, apoyo para lograr que Valentina ingrese. Con nuestro trabajo podemos  obtener lo que en nuestro país no existe: "Otorgar a una persona con discapacidad una beca por aprovechamiento y no por discapacidad".

Valentina ha demostrado que aprovecha al máximo las oportunidades. Podemos eliminar el prejuicio en nuestro país de que las personas con discapacidad no estudian.

Valentina no tendría porqué no estar en la escuela primaria, la cuestión económica podría no ser un impedimento para lograrlo.

Lo importante es buscar soluciones. 

Yo soy Mary, la mamá de Valentina. 


EL PROYECTO

El proyecto de Valentina es llegar al primer año de primaria teniendo acceso a la misma escuela y aula que el resto de los niños que estudian. 

Si Valentina recibe la confianza y los estímulos adecuados va a llegar hasta donde los adultos se lo permitamos.


Cómo lo vamos a realizar 

– Diseñando y produciendo materiales de estudio con el asesoramiento de profesionales.  Materiales de estudio que faciliten la comprensión de Valentina y le permitan el acceso a la información.

– Proveyéndole acompañamiento adulto especializado durante las horas de clase, llamado sombra o monitor dentro de la escuela. 

– Adaptando los libros de texto en versión accesible.

– Ofreciendo talleres de sensibilización en la escuela para favorecer la tolerancia a las  diferencias.

– Compartiendo nuestros logros y descubrimientos en un blog que permita registrar y comunicar la experiencia, como un punto de encuentro e inspiración para otras familias que se encuentren en una situación similar, con el objetivo de hacer mejoras educativas concretas al actual sistema educativo.

Valentina es una niña con su propia manera de aprender, razón por la cual necesita un ambiente escolar apropiado, las instituciones educativas de nuestro país atraviesan un muy mal momento a nivel público. Las pequeñas acciones hacen grandes cambios. Por eso es importante que tenga una oportunidad de acudir a una escuela. Ella puede no ser una carga social cuando adulta. Ha demostrado capacidades más que discapacidades.



EL PRESUPUESTO 

Inscripción ..................................................................................................................5500MXN

Materiales ................................................................................................................23400MXN

Colegiatura x 10 meses con beca del 25% ...........................................31500MXN 

Monitor/acompañante x 10 meses.................................................................... 41500MXN

TOTAL......................................................................................................................101900MXN

CÓMO PUEDES PARTICIPAR

Tu presencia en éste proyecto es clave para alcanzar la meta de Valentina. Participaras en el proceso en el que no sólo los logros son importantes, sino las infinitas posibilidades de una niña que al nacer no tenía ninguna, debido a su condición visual y neurológica. 

Puedes apoyar el proyecto aportando dinero en la plataforma de Indiegogo, siendo parte del equipo de difusión, compartiendo materiales, ideas o donando recompensas a quienes contribuyan económicamente.


CÓMO FUNCIONA LA PLATAFORMA DE INDIEGOGO

Indiegogo es una plataforma de recaudación de fondos en línea. 

Si quieres colaborar por éste medio, del lado derecho de la página encontrarás un botón rosa que dice "Contribuir Ahora". Tendrás la opción de hacerlo utilizando tu Tarjeta de Crédito o Débito. 

Es importante que sepas que los contribuyentes internacionales pueden tener que pagar un cargo del 3%. Indiegogo no hace ningún cargo a los contribuyentes, pero dependiendo del tipo de moneda de la campaña, quizás tengan que pagar tarifas de cambio de moneda por parte de su tarjeta de crédito/débito.

MUCHAS GRACIAS

...
*ENGLISH TRANSLATION*

A SHADOW FOR VALENTINA

THE STORY

I have a daughter, her name is Valentina. She is 7 years-old and is going to start the Primary school. She was born with optic nerve atrophy (ONA). This doesn't mean she is blind, the ONA is like if we had two tunnels in our eyes darkening our vision.
I design, produce and adapt materials and text books for her to attend to the appropriate school, one that is non exclusive for disabled children. We have the support of a group of educational specialists guided by Valentina's doctors, who are aware of her process of development.
Some people have the wrong impression about the concept of disability, they relate it with mental retardation. There are not different people, we are all very different.
Within this racist, discriminatory and class-based society, Valentina's presence in the Primary school is a valuable opportunity for everyone to gain counciosness about diversity.
After a long search  for the right school we finally found a Primary School that is prepared to include Valentina, the problem is that we cannot afford their prices. I felt very happy for the great discovery, but very hopeless about the possibility of my daughter continuing her education. 
Valentina has made such a tremendous effort, that I feel I can't put an ending to her story before it begins. She has proved herself capable of going to a school that is non exclusive for disabled. This has helped her to take a step forward in her development. With this project I'm determined to build that opportunity for her.
Valentina is an independent, brilliant girl whose body and motor condition is not going to affect her learning in a negative way, there is no reason why she shouldn't start the Primary school this year. The money should be the last of her concernings.
The most important thing is to start looking for solutions.
I'm Mary, Valentina's mother.


THE PROJECT

Valentina's project is to have the opportunity to attend the same school and classroom that the rest of the children.

If Valentina recieves  trust and the proper incitement she can get as far as we, the adults, allow her.

The project we present is to cover a year of Valentina's education.

How are we going to make it

-Designing and producing studying materials assesed by medical and educational professionals. This materials must facilitate Valentina to deeply understand and have access to all the information. 

-Providing her with an specialized adult to help her integrate the contents during the class-time (in spanish they call this person "a shadow").

-Organizing sensibilization workshops in the school about the inclusion  of all our differencies and individualities.

-Sharing our discoverings and achievements in a blog like a starting point to register and communicate our experience. We want to create a gathering space for other families in similar situations, with the goal of making tangible and inclusive changes to the current educational system.

Valentina is great example that small actions make big changes. She can set an important precedent to start building a school that reflects an inclusive society that values our little individualities.

 

THE BUDGET

Subscription ...............................................................................................................5500MXN

Materials ..................................................................................................................23400MXN

Tuition x 10 months (25% scholarship)..............................................................31500MXN 

Companion x 10 months........................................................................................ 41500MXN

TOTAL......................................................................................................................101900MXN




HOW TO CONTRIBUTE TO THIS PROJECT?
Your presence in this project is of a great importance to  reach the goal of Valentina but is also fundamental as part of a project that searches to expand and generate a new vision of concrete posibilities of Education being a place of  blossoming of our unique esences, in the end, that is the biggest present we bring to our world.
You can support this project by donating money in this fondraising plataform (Indiegogo), or being part of the difusion team, sharing materials and experience, ideas or simply being present in this process.


HOW IDIEGOGO WORKS
Indiegogo is a fondraising online platform.
If you wish to contribute using it, you'll find a pink button in the right side of this project saying "Contribute Now". You can make it using your Credit or Debit Card .
Please consider that international contributors may have a 3% charge. Indiegogo doesn't charge any money to contributors but depending on the currency of the campaing, you may be charged an exchange rate from your credit/debit card.
THANK YOU!

If you wish to contribute using it, you'll find a pink button in the right side of this project saying "Contribute Now". You can make it using your Credit or Debit Card .
Please consider that international contributors may have a 3% charge. Indiegogo doesn't charge any money to contributors but depending on the currency of the campaing, you may be charged an exchange rate from your credit/debit card.

THANK YOU!

story:
Operation Get Out

© 2015 OGO Mangum & Associates, LLC. All Rights Reserved. Patent Pending.

Operation Get Out (OGO) was dreamed up in a Marine Corps barracks with the hope to help end child trafficking once and for all, but the idea quickly became so much more!

        We want to bring security into every home in America. We know this can't be done with a gadget, because gadgets cost too much. Instead we're working to create an app that is detailed enough to actually provide the service, while simultaneously being priced so that everyone can afford it. That's what OGO is.

        By providing for our campaign you're making sure no corners are being cut. You're enabling us to create an app that will transform how we communicate. 

        The app isn't just safety. It's also a location service that uses push notifications so that we know our messages are getting through. It's not just knowing where your loved ones are, it's knowing how they are.

It's customized security. It's personal peace-of-mind.   

OGO is safety and communication for the whole family ! 


                                                   

                                          

What We Need & What You Get


We're not coders here. We're just people with an idea.

        That being said, the cash we raise here is going to an application development team in the Silicon Valley called Appster. [Check out what people say about them on their website!] 

                                                      

        We are working with one of the world's most experienced and respected app development companies, Appster. Having spent time workshopping the idea with the talented crew there, we have come up with an amazing set of functionalities that will truly make the lives of families easier and therefore safer. Appster has developed and participated in the launch of hundreds of successful mobile and web app startups as well as enterprise projects and has strong influence in the innovation and startup communities. We have invested our money into this great endeavor and need your help to continue to bring our gift of safety and communication efficiency to the world.

       We are working with the best to ensure that we don't risk the safety of people's families, children and livelihood taking shortcuts and trying to throw together code with outsourced and shady development at low cost. We would love your support to ensure we can bring the best product to life and let the world know about it as soon as we can! This is just the beginning. We can't wait for OGO to grow so that in the future we can all say we have contributed to the safety of thousands of children, teenagers and families in the United States and beyond!  We can get to our goal with your help! Check out our perks and see for yourself how you can make a difference for the future of safety.

Here's two of them:


Every penny counts, but every person who shares this page helps even more! 




The APP


OGO is more than just a security app. It's personal peace-of-mind. (At least, that's what we're calling it.) We don't have pictures of the app itself quite yet, but we will definitely upload them when they become available! 

When you first get the app the most work you'll ever do is in setting up your profile. We've tried to make this step easier by enabling you to use a social login so that you can upload your contacts automatically. 

        Next, you'll need to prioritize and assign either a red, yellow, or green tag to your contacts. It's a bit like having emergency numbers on speed-dial except they don't need to be for an emergency.

        Using the red, yellow, and green system is important, because we want kids to be able to use their devices too. Even they know what those colors mean and so does grandma and grandpa! ;)

Let me break it down a little more for you:

  • The app is free and comes with the color green. This lets you send your location to any contact with just one button!
        We have to cover our expenses so we've had to charge a little. (I'm being upfront guys, hear me out!) When you pay $1.99 to unlock the colors red and yellow we will donate 10% of that to a charity of your choice. We'll also give you a code so that two of your family members or friends can unlock their red and yellow for free. We really do want to do good things here. There's no way we were going to make you subscribe!

  • With the color yellow we wanted to provide you with an option. (Plus, it keeps our logo from looking Christmas-y.) It'll send your location to your first pre-selected contact or the contact of your choice. Then it shows them 'yellow', whatever that means, according to your situation. Why wait for something bad to happen before you call for help? Just send a yellow OGO when that gut feeling starts to happen, if you know what I mean! 
  • When you press that red button you're sending an alert (and an alarm if you want) to your first red assigned contact. They'll immediately know you're in trouble, and with the integrated GPS system they'll know where you are. If there isn't a reply the alert will go to the next red contact once it's pre-set timer hits zero.



Risks and Challenges

As Marines we are accustomed to working against tremendous odds. That's why we're taking this leap. Because the rewards are worth it.

        We hope to be able to give our communities a way of interacting that is simple, sleek, and easy. We know it won't be without problems, but, with your contributions, we are more than capable of overcoming them.


Other Ways You Can Help


If you're a little tight for funds, don't worry, you can still help us! If enough people spread the word we are bound to get the help we need! If just 10,000 people hear about us and think we're worth 10$ we've already made it. [That's probably less than 1% of the clicks that cat video you just watched had.]

        Spread the word and help put safety into the pockets of everyone!

                        

                       

                          





                                          

      




© 2015 OGO Mangum & Associates, LLC. All Rights Reserved. Patent Pending.

story:
Short Summary

Our goal with this campaign is simple. To show as much financial support as we can for each family directly affected as a result of the act of domestic terrorism in Chattanooga. Should a family not wish for the financial support we will make a donation in the fallen Hero's honor to a charity of the families choosing. Our goal is to raise enough money so that the victims families can each receive $25,000.
The names of the Men and Woman we are focusing on helping:
The Marines killed were Carson Holmquist, David Wyatt, Skip Wells and Thomas J. Sullivan. There is also a female Seaman alive but in critical condition we intend to donate to as well.

The following taken from FoxNews.com:

"It is a heartbreaking circumstance for these individuals who have served our country with great valor to be killed in this fashion," Obama said.

The gunman first shot up a recruiting center before driving to the Navy Operational Support Center and Marine Corps Reserve Center and killing four Marines before he was shot, authorities said. Sources told Fox News police chased the gunman from the recruiting center to the Center, where the killings took place.

A well-placed source in Chattanooga told Fox News that one of the Marines who was killed was a "decorated war hero with two Purple Hearts." The youngest was 19 years old, the source said.

The U.S. Navy said late Thursday a wounded female sailor was in surgery after being shot.

The Impact

  • The family of a fallen Hero often find themselves caught in a financial bind. The DOD does a lot to attempt to alleviate as much of the pressure as they can, but often cannot release funds quickly enough, or the compensation is not enough. Beyond this the family is shouldered with a lasting burden of not having a loved one there on a day to day basis. They will have to see their pictures on the mantle, and remember every day they can no longer be with them. Can we help them? Only a little. But sometimes doing what you 'can' is all you can do. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • You can spread this far and wide throughout social media. What we raise together that the families do not need, we will donate to charities of their choosing. If you are a family member of a fallen Hero from this act of domestic terrorism, please contact me.

story:
Short Summary

Teboho Trust is a child and teen empowerment non-profit organisation.  Most of our 400 children and teens (age 4-18) are orphan, vulnerable and at-risk. We have been operational now for the last 15 years; moving 4,000 children out of poverty into sustainable adult lives.  We recently had a break in where our kitchen equipment and supplies were stolen.  We don't have cooking equipment and supplies to prepare nutritious hot meals for our children.  Most of our children lack food security at home and depend on us to provide them a nutritious and hot meal.  

What We Need 

While we are all heart broken that thugs would still from orphan, vulnerable and at-risk children, we don't have the financial resources to replace everything stolen and our community is demoralised by such actions, we are looking for help with the following:

  • Stove
  • Refigerator
  • Deep freezer
  • Large Catering pots and pans
  • Cooking utensils (e.g., knives, spoons, chopping boards, etc.)
  • Eating Crockery and cutlery (e.g., bowels, plates, cups, spoons, forks, knives)
  • Large Urn for boiling water
  • Food warmers
All of the funding ($5,000) received will go towards the purchase of the above items.  Teboho Trust is a community driven organisation that has been around for the last 15 years with a proven track record of empowering the children, good corporate governance and a brand of goodwill in Soweto.  We are hopeful to reach our target, however, whatever is mobilised will go towards our wish list above.

The Impact

Most of our children (98%) lack food security at home.  Most go hungry unless they attend school or participate in our programmes.  It is very difficult for the children to concentrate on their studies as well as sports & recreational activities on an empty stomach.  It's inhumane for us to operate our Saturday Academy and After School Classes without feeding the children. By motiving the children to stay in school and do well in school, we have a track record of producing medical doctors, accountants, engineers, teachers, social workers, managers, entrepreneurs, attorneys, and a host of other professionals over the years.  Teboho Trust has become a symbol of hope in Soweto and nearby townships.  The demand continues for us to take on more children.  We have visitors to come near and far where we have developed relationships with others across the globe (e.g., pen pals with schools in America, learner exchange programmes, virtual classes, strategic partnerships with local and international universities and volunteer opportunities for others across the globe to come to apply theory and gain practical experience).

Risks & Challenges

We have used the little funds available to beef up our security (e.g., stronger pad locks and burglar bars on windows).  For the last month, we haven't experienced another break in and feel confident that our measures to strengthen security as assisted us.  Also, we have asked the community to play a more vigilant role in helping us to monitor the facilities after hours.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this appeal with your family, friends and work colleagues.  Please make noise about our campaign to others that can help us to reach our goal - feeding the most vulnerable of children.  Do use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread our appeal.


Siyabonga! (Thank you all, in Zulu)

story:
Short Summary

The Class of 2015 at the American Repertory Theater Institute for Advanced Theater Training at Harvard University is a group of talented actors about to burst on the scene and make their mark as artists - But we need your help to do it!!

  • We have nine women and nine men comprising this group of talented performers who are from Norway to Boston, South Africa to the deep South, and Brazil to Connecticut.  
  • We need your help in getting our hard work out there!  It is our responsibility to fund our trips to New York and LA to present our showcase scenes to Casting Directors, Agents, and Managers.
  • This showcase is our opportunity to meet people who may make a monumental change in our careers and could lead to our having Agents help us make our big break in New York or Los Angeles!!

What We Need & What You Get


  • We have to cover the costs for travel to New York and Los Angeles, housing while we are in town, printing costs for headshots and resumes... the list can get quite daunting...
  • Get ready for fun videos and incentives to donate!  We're a creative shameless bunch!
  • If we don't reach our goal, each class member will get a portion of what we do earn, every single cent helps on a Grad School budget!!

Challenges

  • This group of unique performers has invested two years of training at the American Repertory Theater and the Moscow Art Theatre.  Having spent 6 days a week in class, countless hours in rehearsal, and performing everything from Shakespeare to Musicals, they are ready to take New York and LA by storm and have done the hard work to make their mark!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

  • If you can't contribute, spreading the word means so much!  
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools and help us get our campaign out there!

story:
Who am I?

My names Becky Larney and I'm 17 years old. I first heard about UWC when my two cousins attended the schools and from then  on I worked towards it! UWC schools spoke to me as I agreed with everything they wished to teach.

I attend the local stables. Horses are a passion of mine and I find horse riding a very enjoyable hobby; it is a good way to stay active and healthy. I enjoy public speaking and am part of the school's debate team. As well as this I am a member of The National Women’s council of Ireland.
I was a member of  MAD Youth Theatre in Dundalk for over a year before joining The Gaiety School of Acting which I attend every Saturday for acting workshops, and am now in my second term. I am a member of the local gym, and a member of the school's literacy promotion group, which works towards encouraging students in the school to read more. I am also a member of my schools Young Social Innovators, for which I was elected as chairperson and we are now working towards raising awareness of Fair Trade, sexism, and slave labour in Ghana.

In addition to this I am Chairperson of the school's Student Council, and have upcoming projects regarding renovation of the school library and toilets. Finally, I am the Youth Representative for ShoutOut. ShoutOut works towards a more tolerant environment in Irish secondary schools for the LGBTQ+ community.

I think UWC will teach and effect me in ways I would never think possible. I know that with UWC's experience and teachings it will help me achieve my dream of changing the world. 

What's UWC?

UWC was founded in 1962 with the vision of bringing together young people whose experience was of the political conflict of the cold war era, offering an educational experience based on shared learning, collaboration and understanding so that the students would act as champions of peace. We remain committed to this goal today but have expanded our reach to embrace the tensions and conflicts that exist within as well as between societies. 

What am I going to do after my two years in UWC?

After my two years in Costa Rica I plan to study third level education hopefully in Ireland. I hope to apply what I learn to help me bring Ireland into a brighter future for everyone. 

Selection Process 

UWC Ireland invites applications from students who are committed to UWC ideals, in particular that intercultural boundaries can be overcome though a shared education. Candidates must be adventurous, adaptable and willing to live in a multicultural environment. Although academic strength is required for the International Baacalaureate programme, students must show that they have engaged in extra-curricular activities and service to their communities.

UWC Ireland will also have regard to the following personal characteristics

  • Integrity and honesty
  • Compassion and a commitment to social justice
  • Service to the community
  • Tolerance and mutual respect

After applying and attending an interview I was awarded a 50% scholarship to UWC Costa Rica. I am very grateful for the offer, but I still have to make up the other 50%. I hope to do this with your help.

Other Ways You Can Help

 Feel free to attend any Fund raising events I'll have. As well as this sharing my page would be very helpful! Thank you.

After applying and attending an interview I was awarded a 50% scholarship to UWC Costa Rica. I am very grateful for the offer, but I still have to make up the other 50%. I hope to do this with your help.

    Other Ways You Can Help  Feel free to attend any Fund raising events I'll have. As well as this sharing my page would be very helpful! Thank you.

story: Payton, Bennett and Jillian traveling to Nicaragua in August to spend a week in kinship and solidarity with children living in an NPH orphanage. We are actively working with the Saint James Youth Ministry in partnership with NPH, a system of orphanage homes, to engage in a unique mission devoted to closeness, mutuality, and kinship with the poor. Pope Francis has told us that "...we have much to learn form the poor." Our team of 26 youth and adult leaders desire to do just that. We will be developing understanding and friendship with those who would otherwise be marginalized, and hope to become a Church both for and with the poor. We hope you can help them in this exciting opportunity!

story:
http://www.oneworldstudio.org/

We all love music! It is undeniably powerful; it is a universal language that needs to be accessible to learn!

Hello my name is Eric Fine and I am the founder of One World Studio.

 

Funds for music education have been cut in more than 80% of U.S. schools since 2008. With this disappearance of music programs and the high cost of private lessons, students everywhere need an alternative way to learn music.  

That's where we come in.

One World Studio is a learning collective that provides online piano lessons. Created by professional musicians and educators who are skilled in simplifying the learning process, the program eliminates the stress of lessons so that learning piano is fun, easy, and rewarding.

The program consists of approximately 40 hours worth of lessons and over five hours of video that walk the student through the learning material. As each lesson naturally progresses, the student is given practice suggestions and links that provide them with online educational games and resources to make the learning experience more pleasurable. 

One World Studio is set up to be a learning collective. Students will not be left alone to learn on their own, but will have the ability to connect and communicate with students from around the world via our social media platforms. We will also involve their comments and suggestions as we add lessons and evolve the program. 

Our main priority at One World Studio is making our program accessible and affordable for everyone who wants to learn how to play piano.

Because we know that learning piano can be an expensive investment, the price is open; students set their own price and pay what they can afford. But we need to get the word out about our amazing program.

That's where you come in! We want to reach and teach as many people as possible.

With your help and support, funds will be allocated to both digital and print advertising, including Facebook and Google ads. These digital ads will allow us to maximize the effectiveness of our advertising dollars by targeting a specific audience of people already interested in music, piano, and online lessons. Banner ads will be placed on YouTube pages specifically geared towards our target audience. Our print advertising will use a more traditional format in order to appeal to those seeking music lessons at an affordable price. At a cost of approximately $10 per 1000 circulated copies, we can affordably reach a wider audience in music education and trade publications. 

We believe that One World Studio is set up for success and is now ready to take the next step towards reaching and teaching as many people as possible. With your help we can come closer to accomplishing that goal. Take a look at our website at the link below and see all that we are trying to provide, from the videos, to a sample of the E-book, to a forum for students to come together and learn from each other. Also, be sure to take a look at all of the exciting perks we're offering for the various levels of donations. 

Thank you for your time and consideration, and please feel free to pass along our campaign to others in any way that you can. 

Sample E-book:

http://media.wix.com/ugd/861503_ce125b06614c4dd2abc7946729a1eea4.pdf

Website:

http://www.oneworldstudio.org/

story:
UPDATE 12th August: Total donations across all platforms to date $28,750 /€25,835 

Hope Dies Last has been serving through media and missions to counteract human trafficking in Europe for the last 3+ years. We're incredibly passionate about giving grassroots organisations the quality media they need for fundraising, prevention and education. 

Over the years we've spent time talking to men and women working in the sex industry in Europe. This industry involves over a million people from a vast array of nations and brings in billions of euro to governments and organised crime.

Many of the people in this industry have been forced or coerced to work in prostitution and don't see a way out.



In early 2014 we realised there was a need for quality printed material for field workers to give to those involved in the sex industry. 
We decided we could make a small pocket sized book and we called it the Book of Love!
Over the last year we've connected with dozens of organisations to work out how we can make this book both engaging and useful. We've collaborated with like-minded artists all over the world to make this book absolutely beautiful!




It will be applicable to men, women and transgendered people, while communicating to those with limited literacy through art and comics.

  • Full Gospel of John in a modern translation
  • Letters and testimonies from survivors of human trafficking 
  • Contributions by pastors and field-workers 
  • Life-affirming photography and illustration
  • Hotline numbers
  • Human rights information



  • Equip field workers with an appropriate tool to deepen conversations and build friendships with people in the sex industry. 
  • Encourage the Church to step boldly into ministry and become more resourceful, responsive and relevant to all who need God's love.
  • Reach both men and women involved in the sex industry with the Gospel in addition to stories of hope and redemption.



For more information on our basic multi-year budget check out www.hopedieslast.org/thebookoflove 

Our goal doesn't end with a pile of books sitting in our office! This year we want to distribute a large portion of these books - getting them into the hands of the people who most need them. We'll be doing that by donating books in bulk to organisations and ministries and by giving them out ourselves. 

                      




If you're able to give, GREAT but it doesn't have to end there! 

  • Recommend this campaign to people you know would love to be involved.
  • Share this campaign on social media.
  • Make a personal commitment to a certain number of books and fundraise for that amount (and let us know how're doing it).
  • Pray for this book, pray for us and pray for the people who it will reach.
Thank you so much for being a part of this project, we could not do it without you!!

                       

 #thebookoflove

                       

Do you need books for your ministry?                               

If you are a part of a ministry or you reach out to people involved in the sex industry in Europe and would like copies of the book for distribution feel free to donate but please reach out to us directly via email info@hopedieslast.com. Please specify what languages you need. 

While we strongly recommend you give through Indiegogo if you would prefer to donate via PayPal you can do so on our webpage Please note this is not tax-deductible.

story:
Gorán Petrovics pre-schooling 

I am Gorán Petrovics, 2 and a half years old. I read fluently, speak in full sentences, I can write and count to over 1000 and my English vocabulary is almost on elementary level. I also read maps. I recognize over 150 car branding, I assamble memory flash cards in no time. Experts say I am a genius. My pre-schooling is not solved yet after all. Unfortunately the state can not provide me the proper care I need. My Mom found me a private kindergarden which we can not afford so with this we ask for your help. I'm not sure what I will be when I grow up, but I am asking you to help so I can recive the proper care for my abilities to improve and develope.

1 month: 300 Euro

3 year: 9000 Euro


Gorán Petrovics Ungarn,

Ich heiße Gorán Petrovics, bin 2 Jahre alt unund lebe mit meinen Eltern in einer kleinen Stadt in der Nähe von Budapest.

Ich kann schon Lesen, schreiben, zählen bis 1000 und das auch in englischer Sprache.

Die Länder auf der Landkarte kenne ich von Italien bis Polen. Mein großes Hobby sind Autos. An die 150 Typen erkenne ich sofort am Firmenlogo.

Mit den Memory Cards bin ich in ein paar Minuten fertig.

Nach Meinung von Psychologen bin ich ein seltenes Genie, war schon mehrere Male zu Gast im ungarischen Fernsehen und  man nennt mich bei uns Wunderkind.

In einen normalen Kindergarten kann ich nicht gehen, das ist nicht gut für mich und die anderen Kinder. Die Kindergärtnerinnen sind mit mir einfach überfordert.

Meine Mutter hat einen Kindergarten gefunden, der aber sehr teuer ist und den müssen wir selber bezahlen.

Vielleicht könnt Ihr uns helfen, damit ich meine Fähigkeiten ausbauen kann und meine Intelligenz gefördert wird.

Noch weiß ich nicht was ich werden möchte wenn ich groß bin, aber ich brauche jetzt Eure Hilfe.

Bitte bitte helft mir!!! 

Danke Euer Gorán

PS.: Mein Opa hat von 1969 – 1972 in der damaligen DDR in Brandenburg gearbeitet. Er pflegt schon eine 45-jährige Freundschaft mit auch jetzt meinem deutschen Freund Günter.

  Er war erst vor einigen Wochen bei uns zu Besuch und hat uns geholfen diesen Brief zu verfassen.

  Bitte denkt nicht, daß wir uns persönlich bereichern wollen, es geht einfach nur um mich.



Petrovics Gorán óvodáztatás

Petrovics Gorán vagyok, 2 és fél éves. Folyékonyan olvasok, tudok írni, több ezerig elszámolok, angol szókincsem már majdnem alapfokú. Térképeket olvasok. 150 autó logóját felismerem, a memória kártyákat pillanatok alatt kirakom. Szakértők szerint, zseni vagyok. Mégsem megoldott az óvodáztatásom. Sajnos államilag nem tudják megoldani, hogy a megfelelő ellátást kapjak. Édesanyám talált nekem egy magánóvodát, de nem tudjuk megfizetni, ebben kérnénk a segítséget. Még nem tudom mi leszek, ha nagy leszek, de kérlek segíts,hogy a képességeimnek és adottságaimnak megfelelő ellátást megkaphassam.

story:
Naismith Legacy Giving

Naismith Legacy Giving is a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization dedicated to telling the Naismith story and reaching young people through the game of basketball. There are countless stories we have heard from people telling us how basketball changed their lives and in many cases actually saved their lives. We want to continue to impact young people’s lives in a positive way by teaching the positive life principles that Dr. Naismith taught. In doing so, we can carry on his legacy of leaving the world a better place for those who follow us.

We at Naismith Legacy Giving believe the best platform for this movement is through youth sports. It is unfortunate, but there are many messages coming through youth sports that are the wrong message. The win at all cost mentality is not the right approach.  We should pursue victory with honor.  There is a lack of respect and sportsmanship in youth sports today that must change. Adults sometimes fall into this trap and lose focus of what youth sports should really be about.  Parents, coaches and officials, have a responsibility to young players to make sure that we have the proper view and perspective of youth sports so we can teach them the right way to approach their life and competition. How do we do this? We believe it is a grass roots movement as it was back in 1936, when pennies were collected to help pay Dr. Naismith's way to the Olympics, where basketball would be played for the first time. Naismith Legacy Giving is asking for donations for our Charitable Giving organization that will enable us to produce the materials and fund operations for the two programs listed below.

Naismith Legacy Way

Dr. Naismith was a teacher for most of his life, therefore he believed education was important. In addition to teaching topical subjects like Physical Education, he also taught the life skills of good character by consistently using words to make his point.  Words like Respect, Integrity, Family, Generosity, Service, Discernment, Honor and 14 others that he based his life on.  He not only said the words, he lived by their definition. He modeled them.

                                            


We have taken those words and created a small, easy to use booklet that coaches can use with their young players as a teaching tool. The booklets are interactive, asking the players to answer questions, view YouTube videos and engage in discussions that will help them think how to make decisions that will have a positive impact on their lives and others around them.

There are three separate booklets each featuring seven words for a total of 21 words. This provides three years of learning material that coaches and players can use.  We are looking for donations to help us produce these booklets so we can give them to basketball coaches in city recreation programs, YMCA league programs and other youth basketball organizations.

The Naismith Tour - Basketball: Its Origin and Development

This is a traveling exhibit showing historical pictures and memorabilia telling the story of Dr. Naismith’s game of basketball.  Copies of the Original 13 Rules, pictures of the original gym at the YMCA Training Center where the first game was played, and other interesting displays about the development of the game.

We get requests to bring this Tour to special events ranging from the ACC Conference Championships to local Parks & Recreation and YMCA events. At YMCA’s and local recreation programs we have a program called Naismith Days using the Naismith Legacy Tour as the basis for presenting the story of basketball to players, coaches, officials and parents.  As an additional part of the day, we also offer free workshops for Parents, Coaches and Officials to learn how to view youth sports in the 21st century.

This integrates with the Naismith Legacy Way to reach young people, their parents and coaches and try to change the way they view youth sports today.  The mixed messages that youth sports is sending today are confusing and we believe we can offer a clear prospective to all of the participants, but we need help to get that done.

The next generation of Naismith's want to carry on the Legacy of Dr. Naismith by reaching out through youth sports to make our young people aware of the man who invented basketball, but more importantly the life he lived to make our world a better place. Our young people are at risk today and our goal is to lessen that risk by offering a solid platform for them to learn. We know that basketball has changed people in a positive way. We want to be proactive rather than reactive. We are not a program that helps kids after they have gotten into trouble. We are a group of people who want to prevent kids from getting into trouble in the first place.

                                

                                                 The Naismith Tour Display

Dr. Naismith did his part during his lifetime to invent a wonderful game and give it as a gift to the world. Now it is our opportunity to make sure that we carry on his legacy by being custodians of his great game and using it as a platform to make this a better place by teaching our young people the great values that are being challenged today.

If not us, who? If not now, when? Grassroots is how this will get accomplished. Will you join us with your support of a gift in any amount?

story:
Introduction

The paragraph below, mostly incomprehensible to us, is how the world might look to someone unable to read:

Retpoanig tuo of Aoisdnm Ocuytn, Tenkucky, Jotrcpe Aerd si a onn-itropf oioiarngztan ciedaetdd ot virponidg tipru9isontope rfo dtlaus to evimrpo thrie draiegn dan/or sipakgne slskil. Ew reevs nyaone owh is at laest 16 yaser dlo and is tno lnoreled ni a oafrml lrca6ososm rpargmo.

Did you catch all that? Need us to repeat? It’s a world of misunderstandings, confusion, and chaos.

Imagine not being able to read grocery labels. Medications. Street signs. Menus. Bills. Even job applications. Hard to fathom, and yet this is the reality for 14 percent of working-age Kentuckians.

This is exactly what those of us at Project Read spend our days striving to fight and ultimately fix. Improving adult literacy in central Kentucky, one student at a time. 

Who We Are

We are Project Read and our goal is to improve adult literacy in Madison County, Kentucky. This year, we celebrate our 30th anniversary of teaching adults to read and/or improve their reading levels, free of charge. In addition, we offer tutoring to improve English-speaking skills for those for whom English is not their first language. Project Read is the only significant organization in Madison County to provide these individualized services to adult learners, many of whom are at the lowest literacy levels. All of our tutors are unpaid, trained volunteers who enjoy making a contribution to the community by donating their time and expertise. In addition to our dedicated Executive Director, our Governing Board is comprised of local educators, business people, and well-known members of the community, working for a worthy and vital cause.

How You Can Help

Project Read is totally dependent on contributions. Our budget would probably be considered modest by most standards, but one of our main sources of funding, United Way of the Bluegrass, changed its focus this year to support only K through 12 educational programs. While many foundations provide grants that support K-12 literacy projects, few support adult literacy programs. Rather than see this as a major setback, we instead embrace this as a unique opportunity to reach out, show the world the good we're doing and hope to continue to do, and involve the community in ways we'd only dreamt of before. This is where we need your help.

Our goal this year is to obtain $15,000 to maintain our current programs and to meet increasing needs and numbers of students. The money raised will be used to keep our doors open and lights on—to buy books and materials as well as to pay the rent and utilities.

Our door is the only significant one open to adults in Madison County who want to improve their basic literacy skills. Your contribution will make a difference in someone's life—a small price for a great difference.

How We - And You - Make a Difference

Recently two sisters in their 20s earned their GEDs. Now, for the first time in their lives, they have well paying jobs and are more engaged citizens of Madison County. One woman in her 40s who was told she would never learn to read is now at the fourth-grade level and is still improving. These are just a few of the success stories from Project Read. Project Read truly does make a difference in improving literacy in Kentucky.

Our local supporters and contributors are finding it difficult to keep up with the growing needs of Project Read. The population in Madison County is growing faster than Kentucky as a whole (3.2% vs. 1.3%), and Project Read needs to expand its vital literacy services to meet the growing demand. Currently, we serve only a small fraction of the 3,000 people who speak another language at home. And those who do not complete high school (about 30 percent) are finding us, one by one, asking for help.

Your contribution goes toward many things:

  • Keeping the lights on and doors open by paying our rent and utilities
  • Growing our client base and advertising our services
  • Replacing out-of-date equipment, such as our aging copy machine
  • Adding to and replenishing our collection of textbooks, dictionaries, and learning software programs

Conclusion

Ensuring that all adults have the opportunity to become literate is good for everyone—you, me, and the person improving his/her skills. Higher levels of literacy help us be better employees and open up new job opportunities. Because literacy helps us stay informed, it makes us valuable as citizens of our communities. Literacy lowers unemployment and crime rates. Literacy makes life endlessly more enjoyable and ultimately opens the door to a whole new world. Help us continue to make this new world possible for the many eager individuals in central Kentucky by contributing today.

story:
We are pleading with you to consider a donation in support of the 2015 College Youth Tour.

Mouth2Mouth Ministries International is celebrating its 3rd year in Central Calofornia and the Bay Area. This year 100 young people, 60 from Fresno, 40 from the Bay Area, ages 13-17, are planning to attend the United We Stand Divided We Fall Youth Leadership Tour on August 14-16, 2015. Youth will visit Southern California, USC and UCLA, where they will attend numerous workshops and seminars with topics including: education, self-esteem, life skills, anti-bullying, and spiritual training. Past experience has shown that although these learning activities are important for the students, the most valuable part of the trip is the relationships the students develop with their peers, mentors and their adult sponsors. We are proud that 100% of the seniors that have participated in the previous Youth Tours have graduated with their high school diplomas.

We are asking you to help us by choosing to support this opportunity to train our local youth. You can:

·  Provide goods or services

·  Scholarship support to finance housing, food, and transportation

This year’s events will help M2M Ministries International continue to raise funds towards various projects including:

·  The United We Stand Youth Leadership Tour & Conference - $25,000

story:
In this competition everyone wins

Hoquiamites like to beat Aberdeen and this is a win-win opportunity to do so:

  • We are collecting as much money as possible by August 2nd to beat Aberdeen and help feed as many people in need as we can.
  • Aberdeen believes they were beat out unfairly by the HHS Class of 1995 in Foodball twenty years ago and this is Hoquiam's chance to prove we beat them fair and square and will again!
  • Hoquiamites are loyal, competitive and never give up. Any donation will help, please give what you can!

Your donation will go to Coastal Harvest

Coastal Harvest delivers, at no charge, food to over 50 food banks, senior centers, tribal centers and feeding programs in Grays Harbor, Pacific, Lewis, Thurston, Mason, Jefferson and and Wahkiakum Counties.

                                                                                                               

Other Ways You Can Donate

If you prefer to send a check, it should be made out to Coastal Harvest and include "For Hoquiam Foodball" in the memo line. You can mail it directly to Coastal Harvest at P.O. Box 616, Hoquiam, WA 98550.

You may also donate through Coastal Harvest's website, http://www.coastalharvestwa.org/donate.html, and remember to write "For Hoquiam Foodball" in the message field.


THANK YOU!  Every donation makes a difference!

story:
Hello, my name is George and I am 24 years old. 

I was born and raised in Greece, a very beautiful country, which until 5 years ago the business sector was in a good condition, the banks were granting start up loans and were assisting young people make their business ideas come true. As a result, business growth was uprising not only in Greece but also in the European Union. Unfortunately, all these changed. 


On April 2010 my country entered into the IMF mechanism to be able to preserve its financial stability. From this moment the condition in my country changed dramatically.  Month after month things were becoming worse, banks stopped granting loans, even temporary short term credit through the issuance of credit cards ceased and businesses started shutting down the one after the other. 

Commercially famous streets, such as the equivalent Fifth Avenue in New York, that were fully leased, are now almost 60% vacant.  Unemployment tripled and young entrepreneurs with new business ideas do not longer have access to the traditional financing channels, such as banks, venture capitals etc.This also resulted to a lot of young people, as well as family men, to leave their families behind and emigrate abroad.  The people that stayed behind tried with any available means left, including the financial support from family and friends to start implementing their ideas.  

However, once again, recent events, the bank holiday and the dramatic capital control on Greek banks caused a dramatic I have been fortunate to cooperate with founders of new technology businesses, entrepreneurs characterized by their strength, firm decision taking and the love for Greece. It is not a matter of luck that these people were able to progress and grow through the crisis, but it is due to their determination, passion and skill. 

These people are now left shocked, angry and disappointed. For the first time through these hardships, they are considering having to shut everything down, leave their beloved country, possibly take along their trusted associates and start from zero. If this takes place a new type of immigration will be born, which will include people that are not just looking for work, but are looking to establish new businesses. 

The resulting effects on the economy will be indescribable.Based on my experience on the financial sector and having lived in the USA for the past two years I have transpired that crowdfunding is a huge success. I thought of creating a platform with the name Easystarter, which offers assistance to local young entrepreneurs, who have thought of incredible ideas but cannot realize them.With collective assistance, through the platform, these ideas could become reality. 

Easystarter is destined to be an online crowdfunding platform where local young entrepreneurs will upload their projects to be seen by the world. I have proceeded to the first steps for the platform’s creation with own and family funds, which was not enough however to complete the entire structure.  

The reason why Easystarter needs a minimum funding of $120,000 is to complete the platform and support its infrastructure and staff. Any additional funding will be used towards the finance and promotion of the new projects.

 Supporting Easystarter means supporting Greek young entrepreneurs and Greek businesses in this difficult situation my country is in.

story:
PRESIDENT COOL WORLD BELIEVES “POSITIVE ACTIVITY = COOL POINTS”

                                                     

     

      He needs your assistance in bringing this impactful belief to young people.

COOLCLUBWORLD is a faith based interactive nonprofit organization that RECOGNIZES & REWARDS POSITIVE YOUNG PEOPLE with the world famous COOL POINTS account. 

The COOL POINTS account features young people around the world getting  rewards with tons of benefits and  prizes.  Our mission is to make a powerful, optimistic impact to millions of young people around the world. We are committed to promoting positive activity in order to reach elementary, middle, high school, and college students.  

                                     "Stay Cool" and "Stay Positive" is our motto.    


This is a COOLCHRISTWORLD production and we utilize the acronym CCW for both entities.  Our board includes teachers, firemen, military, law enforcement, ministers, parents and other professionals.

COOLCLUBWORLD is launching its first fundraiser to recognize and reward positive young people in the 2015-2016 school year.  We need your help raising funds to make this launch successful!

                  100% of all contributions will go to our three initiatives:

READING ENCOURAGEMENT:Young people will inform CCW about what they are reading and share the cool parts. (COOL POINTS!!!)

POSITIVE ACTIVITY: Young will tell CCW about the cool, positive, action-packed things they have going on. (COOL POINTS!!!)

COOL POINTS COLLEGE TEXT BOOK SCHOLARSHIPS:  Young people can earn COOL POINTS for Higher Education. (COOL POINTS)

COOLCLUBWORLD needs you to provide this free service to young people across the world.

•  PLEASE SHARE this campaign with your family, friends, and community!

•  Would you like to donate other resources that could be used as prizes or rewards for positive young people? Please contact us at coolclub@coolclubworld.com. We'd love to discuss it with you!   


We are currently enrolling schools and *organizations to COOLCLUBWORLD.  Please contact us (coolclub@coolclubworld.com) for details on this outstanding COOL CLUB.

                                               


*Organizations formed will need to fall under CCW COOL POINTS entities that includes: FAMILY, FRIENDS, SCHOOL, EMPLOYMENT, MILITARY, AND CHURCH.
                                        STAY COOL...  STAY POSITIVE...

story:
Short Summary

Grays Harbor Historical Seaport Authority is a municipal non-profit that owns and operates two tall ships, Lady Washington, the official ship of the State of Washington, and Hawaiian Chieftain.  We are currently working on a major upgrade to one of our vessels the Hawaiian Chieftain that will allow her to take thousands of school children on educational field trips, and will allow her to keep training the future of our maritime-based work force.


What We Need

This project is our first stepping stone into making the Hawaiian Chieftain a 21st century sailing vessel and will lead to a complete electrical and engineering system overhaul over the next several years.  As always, we are looking to improve safety and sustain the Hawaiian Chieftain for many more years to come.  This project includes:

  • Re-ballast: Acquire and install lead ingots to give us a smoother ride through ocean swells
  • Fly-by-wire: Replace our aging hynautic system with electronic engine controls
  • Heat exchangers
  • Wet exhaust
  • New generators
  • Water tank upgrade
  • AIS system 

Impact

In the past five years we have had over 42,000 school children participate in our education program up and down the entire West Coast.  We hope to have ten times that amount in the upcoming years and continue training individuals who want to sail a tall ship.  Your support of our programs and our vessels makes all of this possible.  

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Can't donate?? No problem! Please help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!!  Feel free to use the share buttons! 

Disclaimer

The video depicting what "could" go wrong on our boat is a work of fiction.  It is meant to be a light-hearted look at the things that can go wrong if we don't properly maintain our vessels or train our crew properly.  Our vessels are Coast Guard inspected and operate safely and efficiently.  Please regard the video as the comedy it was meant to be.

story:
About this project

Indigenous community reaching out for help

Project Ceiba is a mobile learning initiative to empower local indigenous students in the Amazon Basin to tell their own story. With your help we will provide each community with mobile creation devices and a series of creative, hands on, experiential workshops. This initiative came at their own request and need to utilize their existing computers and develop digital literacy whilst embracing new mobile technologies.

Providing rich learning experiences, that utilize amazing tools such as tablets, student will create original works and share their creations, connecting with other parts of the planet. Through dynamic storytelling and media rich creation, these communities will capture life, memories and the past, to create the future and...

...sustain the Amazon Rainforest


Our Goal: $15000 to provide with the new technologies and workshops in the Amazonian villages of La Chorrera and Puerto Nariño.

the space - when and where


Project Ceiba will take place with your help in August 2015 in "La Chorrera" and "Puerto Nariño", two small villages in the Colombian Amazon basin. These local public schools from the communities are seeking new approaches to education to provide new opportunities for future generations.

Mobile creation in the heart of the rainforest, with wi-fi!


the journey


We have three main milestones to reach, to accomplish this project.


one: agreement from the local indigenous communities - reached

The consent from the local indigenous communities is always a must before starting any new project. This has been achieved, thanks to the action of many years of trust between the Amassunu-NGO and the local community. This NGO is the mediator between us and them. The communities asked them for this kind of support and they contacted Juan Felipe directly to know if he could provide that… and the story began!

two: the community has asked us to come and they will buy our tickets.- reached

Amassunu NGO has asked the communities to invest in the project by providing this amount and they have agreed.

three: resources. THIS IS WHERE WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT AND DONATION.
TO PURCHASE AND DELIVER THESE TECHNOLOGIES TO THE COMMUNITY.

Funds to purchase the 40 new iPad mini 16GB, sturdy iPad cases, 2 MacBooks, Apple TV, 2 Lacie Fuel and iOS Applications curated by the team….


four: the course & learning process

We intend to facilitate an iTunes U course  “Making Thinking Visible”, a concept initially developed by Apple Distinguished Educators, Mark Shillitoe and Caroline Haebig and currently being implemented in Switzerland (by Mark & Juan Felipe) and in North America.

The course provides rich, creative storytelling experiences with mobile technologies.

Due to the unique nature of the iTunes U course and it’s embedded, creative use of iPad technologies, Project Ceiba will use iPads for this initial first stage in the Amazon basin.

This powerful tool will allow the project to be sustainable for at least four years allowing students to manage their content, create their stories, teach other children, build their knowledge… and share it with the world!

iTunes U will allow students to access fresh, stimulating content remotely.

The technologies will remain with the communities in their schools.


the team

mark shillitoe

...technology has the power to redefine how we remember the past, to help us to create the future

Mark Shillitoe is an artist, educator and innovator. He is excited about providing opportunities for learners to discover and explore the potential of mobile learning technologies through the arts. Infusing digital learning across school, he empowers students, teachers and parents to create and share their learning experiences.

His story began as a young teacher where he developed the use of animation in the language arts receiving recognition nationally, being short-listed for the Unilever International Schools Art Competition with a film short, ‘The Apartment’.

He introduced blogging to his students to promote inquiry and extend learning beyond classroom, beginning his journey into digital literacy.

Finding a set of iPads, locked in a cupboard, he initiated an iPad learning landscape whilst coordinating the International Baccalaureate Primary Years Programme.

He has been instrumental in introducing both iPad technologies and Google Apps for Education across the school, ensuring the community maximizes the potential to create and collaborate by designing learning experiences that embody inquiry and focus on authentic, engaging, student centred learning. He established social media channels in school to share successes globally. Recent bright spots include pioneering Genius Hour, leading European Code Week initiatives with Hopscotch developers and facilitating the sound pedagogy project, ‘The City Rings’. He has recently presented at the European Council of International Schools technology conference on topics of MakerSpaces and Making Thinking Visible with Mobile Technologies.

His work has been published as part of the Apple Distinguished Educator community collection 'One Best Thing' entitled, 'Urban Orchestration-Environmental Sound Making with iPad.’

He co-designed an iTunes U course to develop visual literacy which will drive project Ceiba.


juan felipe pardo

...Sentir las fuerzas de la Tierra nos llevan a crear e innovar. Sólo somos cantos y flores.

Juan Felipe Pardo is an educator, documentary filmmaker and music manager, and above all passionate about the traditions of the world.

From an international school to the developing world,  he provides opportunities and digital experiences for children, giving them a voice, enabling them to tell their story and find their place in the world.

Juan Felipe led workshops with indigenous communities introducing AudioVisual, hands on experiences and music with technologies available such as handycams, miniDVs, tape, audio recorders and MiniDiscs.

His journey begun in Colombia where he graduated from University with national honors with his thesis, a documentary named "Música en el paraiso del tucán" a soundscape inside the southern indigenous communities made in 2004. From that moment on, he jumped into production: making documentaries, art and running a record label named Reef Records with two partners, where he produced and managed many traditional artists, albums and tours.

A few years ago he arrived into Switzerland, where he is now a happy dad and where he joined the international school staff team where he met Mark. His attachment to the rainforest is undeniable, as is his personal time dedicated to his passions and to serving causes he believes in.

Together, with new innovations they have reshaped learning experiences, empowering students to become storytellers with one device, seeing the benefits for education, learning and future generations.
story_txt:
About this project

Indigenous community reaching out for help
Project Ceiba is a mobile learning initiative to empower local indigenous students in the Amazon Basin to tell their own story. With your help we will provide each community with mobile creation devices and a series of creative, hands on, experiential workshops. This initiative came at their own request and need to utilize their existing computers and develop digital literacy whilst embracing new mobile technologies. Providing rich learning experiences, that utilize amazing tools such as tablets, student will create original works and share their creations, connecting with other parts of the planet. Through dynamic storytelling and media rich creation, these communities will capture life, memories and the past, to create the future and...
...sustain the Amazon Rainforest


Our Goal: $15000 to provide with the new technologies and workshops in the Amazonian villages of La Chorrera and Puerto Nariño.


the space - when and where
Project Ceiba will take place with your help in August 2015 in "La Chorrera" and "Puerto Nariño", two small villages in the Colombian Amazon basin. These local public schools from the communities are seeking new approaches to education to provide new opportunities for future generations.
Mobile creation in the heart of the rainforest, with wi-fi!




the journey
We have three main milestones to reach, to accomplish this project.

one: agreement from the local indigenous communities - reached
The consent from the local indigenous communities is always a must before starting any new project. This has been achieved, thanks to the action of many years of trust between the Amassunu-NGO and the local community. This NGO is the mediator between us and them. The communities asked them for this kind of support and they contacted Juan Felipe directly to know if he could provide that… and the story began!

two: the community has asked us to come and they will buy our tickets.- reachedAmassunu NGO has asked the communities to invest in the project by providing this amount and they have agreed.


three: resources. THIS IS WHERE WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT AND DONATION.TO PURCHASE AND DELIVER THESE TECHNOLOGIES TO THE COMMUNITY.
Funds to purchase the 40 new iPad mini 16GB, sturdy iPad cases, 2 MacBooks, Apple TV, 2 Lacie Fuel and iOS Applications curated by the team….


four: the course & learning process

story:
Background

ArtWorks for Youth was founded in 2000 in New York City and has run exclusively in South Africa since 2003.
Our mission is to provide free visual art instruction, academic support, and mentoring to under-served students in Port Elizabeth, South Africa.
We believe in the transformative power of the arts and provide our students with means to express themselves. We teach them first to look deeply at themselves, then others, and the wider community while considering their place in this world. We give them the tools they will need to succeed in this new South Africa.
(Please watch our ten-minute films included here to gain more information about our work and it's impact on our students and the communities where we work.)
Since 2003 we have served over two thousand students through these programs and services:
Art Education
Academic Support (with after school classes in reading, writing, and math.)
Library
Visiting Artists Series
Sister's Keeper Girls' Group
Young Learner's Reading Group
Feeding Program
Parent Contact
Counseling

Fundraising Blitz to Jump Start our New Program and Fiscal Year!

We want to start the year strong so that our many plans this program year may be realised.  

$25,000 will give us a great push our many plans this program year!

This year's plans include:

Large-scale Matisse Project

Student Volunteer Project

Story Procession

High School Student Placement

More Visiting Artists

Perks!!!

We've got some lovely perks for you that include student artwork, Duck (from "Duck and Goose, by Tad Hills,) and an Italian meal prepared in your own home! 

Our Films

Please take the time to view our films, which are about ten minutes each. They speak volumes about our work and you can meet some of our students and hear from them what our program has meant to them.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to give, but can help in other ways, here are some things we could use:

Frequent Flier miles (any airline that flies to South Africa will be fine!)

Pro Bono printing of our newsletters, appeals, and invites as well as student photographs for our exhibitions.

Volunteers to host more intimate gatherings in their homes that will benefit our work.

story:
Hello I'd like to ask a few moments of your time, to read my appeal for the Orphaned Children of the Nepal Earthquakes.

If you follow the news then you'll know that my country has faced a devastating tragedy.

An Earthquake that has so far claimed the life of more than 8000 people with countless others left homeless left hungry with no place to call home and they need your help.

Many estimated it will take 100's of millions if not billions, to try to rebuild in the wake of this tragedy!

This is a peaceful country of people who fought against the monarchy and the caste system to build our own democracy, while at the same time fighting insurgency.

We've managed on our own, but our situation is so bad that now we must ask you to help us!

You know the phrase “He'll give you the shirt of his back” Nepali people truly typify that phrase. If there is anything you can do to help? a donation no matter how big or small you'll be making a difference between life or death for my people.

Waiting around and trying to figure out the scale of disaster means life's lost that might have saved.

Which is why I am asking you to please donate.

NSU (Nepal Student Union) have years of experience in education in Nepal, they have been focusing on providing scholarships to the children who have lost their parents in this disaster, and have been working very closely with the International Aid Organisations to insure that every time you donate, your donation is shared where it is needed the most! Please if you have even a small amount to give please donate.

Children are being sold as slave labour, or are being trafficked in to prostitution. And I in conjunction with the Nepalese Student Union, need your donations to make sure this won't happen to as many Nepalese Children as possible

During the running of this campaign, we intend to raise £8000 with the aim of using the monies raised to help rebuild schools damaged during the Earthquakes and to provide scholarships for 1000 orphaned children in Nepal.

Thank you for your time, and thank you for donating.

God bless and as it is said in Nepali "Namaste"
