story:
Our Mock Trial Team Needs Your Help to Compete at Nationals

At the start of November, two teams of students at Community High School in Ann Arbor, Michigan began working to formulate a compelling case on both the plaintiff and defense sides of a fictional trial. Mock Trial is a demanding activity that requires students to develop their skills in public speaking, critical thinking and thinking on their feet. 

The students put in countless hours--coming into school on days off and staying well past their bedtimes--to develop, memorize, and practice their roles as lawyers, witnesses, and sometimes both. As witnesses, students play sympathetic defendants, slighted plaintiffs and unbiased third parties. Lawyers deliver openings and closings and object to hearsay and testimony that is more prejudicial than probative. They find out just before the trial which side they will be presenting and must be prepared to think on their feet in order to respond to everything the opposing team delivers. The skills learned and the confidence gained is hard to quantify. 

All that effort paid off in March at the Ann Arbor Regional Tournament when both A Team and B Team moved on to compete in Lansing later that month at the state competition. There, at the end of a very long day and after going head-to-head with the best teams from around Michigan four separate times (including the semifinal round where our teams faced off with one another!), the students on B Team took Fourth Place and A Team brought the State Championship trophy home to Community. 

What We Need 

Now we face the challenge of the National High School Mock Trial Championship in Raleigh, North Carolina.  We have just over a month to prepare a case that is longer and more complicated than the last and get ready to compete against the best teams there are. At the same time, we face a large fundraising obstacle. 


The estimated costs of participating in this four day tournament, including lodging and transportation, is more than $12,000. 

We are fundraising in many ways: direct donations, special events, and this Indiegogo campaign. We are looking to raise at least 20% of our larger goal through Indiegogo. Your donation of any size helps our hardworking kids perform their best in North Carolina and we would love to have your support. If you can't make a donation at this time you can still help!  Please share our Indiegogo page with anyone who you think might be interested in helping these hard working high school students attend the competition.

On behalf of the CHS Mock Trial Team, thank you.

Photography by Sophia Camp and Brian Chambers.

As a public school, we are a nonprofit organization and would be happy provide a receipt for tax purposes.

story:
Short Summary

The Freedom Center for Social Justice will be kicking off our Job Readiness Program for Spring 2015. We will be hosting a total of five sessions between April 6th and June 1st to assist the LGBTQ community (specifically trans* people) in connecting with employment opportunities and preparing for entry or re-entry into the job force.

This series is open to the public, but with special regard to the LGBTQ community and more specifically for *trans/gender variant people.

The Freedom Center is proud to be partnered with Time Out Youth, RAIN and the Power House Project, who will serve as facilitators for four of our sessions.


What We Need & What You Get

We need a total of $3650 to provide scholarships to our 25 local participants which will cover the cost of weekly bus transportation via CATS in Charlotte NC, and the required fee needed to take ACT.org's WorkKeys Assessment Test in order to receive the National Career Readiness Certificate.

  • For a donation of $25 dollars we will add you or your organization's name to the website as an official contributor to the Freedom Center for Social Justice and send you an invitation to attend our end-of-program celebration.
  • For a donation of $50 dollars we will send you an invitation to attend a special "Meet the Staff" LUNCH at our office. 
  • For a donation of $100 dollars we will send you an invitation and 6 FREE tickets to attend a special Carolinas Pride Theatre Ensemble performance.

The Impact

The Freedom Center for Social Justice introduced the Trans* Employment Program initially as an opportunity for members of the transgender and gender variant community to connect with affirming employers and also explore unconventional career options that might not otherwise be discussed. 

In conjunction with the *Trans Employment Program, launching the Job Readiness Program was a natural progression, and as allies of the *trans community, providing resources for sustainability is at the top of our list.

What impact will you make?

  • You will be helping to combat homelessness, an issue that plagues the *trans community by assisting them in finding gainful employment.
  • You will be helping us provide support to an extremely marginalized group that has great financial difficulty and hardship as a result of not being able to find employment.
  • You will be able to give in a way that serves in the area of economic empowerment, one of the highest needs of the *trans community.

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't have the money to give? You can still help by posting the link to our IndieGoGo campaign, and also sharing our Job Readiness Program registration link via social media.

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/the-freedom-center...

story:
The annual Immigrant Youth Empowerment Conference (IYECon) is an all day conference which aims to empower all youths and their families, regardless of their immigration status, by providing access to concrete resources and tools to organize within their communities.

Last year we launched IYECon as an experiment in collaborative community organizing and youth empowerment. The first of its kind on the East Coast, IYECon featured high profile speakers like Ju Hong and Immortal Technique, dozens of incredible local community organizers, and reached over one hundred immigrant youth and educators. 

Can we count on your support this year to help make IYECon a reality?


Our theme for this year’s conference, Redefining Success, challenges conventional perceptions of success: what does it mean to be undocumented and successful? Can we re-imagine success as a collective concept, to re-define success as engaging and uplifting our communities?

This year’s conference will bring together hundreds of youth, family members, and educators to meet with high school and college students, community organizers, lawyers, and professional development leaders. IYECon will include workshops for undocumented youth about the college process, as well as creative ways to organize in one’s own community both within academic spaces and on the street. 

To make this conference possible, we need to raise $5,000 to go towards:

  • Food and drinks for participants
  • Travel stipend for attendees
  • Honoraria for facilitators and keynote speaker
  • Printing flyers, programs, and resource packets

Here is a breakdown of what your donation will do:

  • $5 donation would help provide breakfast and lunch for one conference participant. 
  • $11 donation would help provide all of the above and Metrocard fare ($5.5 round-trip) for one conference participant.
  • $25 donation would help provide all of the above as well as notebooks and a hard copy of our resource packet for 1 conference participant.
  • $50 donation would help provide all of the above for 1 conference participant and 1 parent.
  • $100 donation would help provide an honorarium to 1 workshop facilitator.

Help us build power in our communities by donating and sharing this campaign with families and friends!

Register for IYECon (Sunday, May 9th, 2015): goo.gl/forms/NbcmKl4G4j

IYECon is collaboratively developed and presented by the following organizations: 

Anakbayan, CAAAV: Organizing Asian Communities, GAPIMNY (Gay Pacific Islander Men of New York), Lehman Dream Team, NYU Dream Team, The New School Dream Team, Hostos Dream Team, IUME (Institute for Urban and Minority Education), DRUM (Desis Rising Up and Moving), NYSYLC (New York State Youth Leadership Council), RAISE (Revolutionizing Asian American Immigrant Stories on the East Coast), and The Ya-Ya Network. 

Thank you to our organizational co-sponsors: 

Asian/Pacific/American Institute at NYU, Coalition for Latina/o Scholars at Teachers College, Hostos Community College, Institute for Urban and Minority Education, Kelly Drye & Warren LLP, New York City Asian American Student Conference (NYCAASC), Teachers College Student Senate, University Student Senate of The New School.

Asian/Pacific/American Institute at NYU, Coalition for Latina/o Scholars at Teachers College, Hostos Community College, Institute for Urban and Minority Education, Kelly Drye & Warren LLP, New York City Asian American Student Conference (NYCAASC), Teachers College Student Senate, University Student Senate of The New School.

story:
Short Summary

I am JAMILA MAJESTY.
I am an professional actress and I am also the founder and director of the non-profit organization S.O.U.L. Save Our Universe with Love.  S.O.U.L. is having a Spelling Bee  for children ages 15 and under.  This campaign is to raise funds to make this day as memorable as it can be for the kids in the Los Angeles area who believe that WORD POWER is of great importance.  All Elementary Schools and Junior High Schools are to be informed of this event.  The SPELLING BEE is to encourage and reward young minds for their efforts toward word perfection.  We need you to contribute any amount RIGHT NOW to make this Spelling Bee ultra fun and memorable for all.


What We Need & What You Get

The best part of this event is that it does not cost much.  For this very little amount, children all over Los Angeles will feed their minds and make it a priority to take spelling words as a priority and apply it to their lives forever.  Reading the dictionary is POWER!  To be rewarded for your talent with words is so very gratifying to the children who have the gift.  They deserve to be recognized for it.  These young individuals are the same individuals who are going to become our Einsteins' and empower our world as we grow and take care of our world.  We want them to be as efficient and educated for spelling and writing words so that they continue good foundational habits for their lifetime and teach their children the same.  Only $2,000 is needed to make this day a day the participants will church for life.  The registration for every child is 100% FREE.  This is a free event for our kids of Los Angeles.  All participants will be rewarded with a S.O.U.L. Save Our Universe with Love Certificate and the Grand Prize Winner will receive a S.O.U.L. trophy, as will Second Place and Third Place.


The Impact

Every S.O.U.L. Event is meant to be a red carpet event so for every penny over $2,000 it will go to making our red carpet dynamite with photographers and media present.  You can read more about S.O.U.L. Save Our Universe with Love at www.SOUL-Save-Our-Universe-with-Love.org.  Any serious sponsor can request an Official Sponsor Proposal at SaveOurUniversewithLove@gmail.com.


Risks & Challenges

The best part of this SOUL SPELLING BEE is that regardless if we make our goal or not the event is going to take place funded by Jamila Majesty.  Our location, venue and date is already secured.  The house seats up to 800 plus.  Its just that with a boost from you we can reach more children and have the very best turn-out, including Celebrity appearances.  Our SOUL Spelling Bee is taking place June 20, 2015 from 11am-3pm in Hollywood, California rain or shine.

Other Ways You Can Help

Other ways corporations can be a part of us and this day:
1.  Catering
2.  Fun Give-Aways
3.  Talented Poetess and Poets
4.  Piano Players who Sing
5.  Choreographers who can have a dance troop of 20 dance to Michael Jackson's JAM and The Overture from the Annie Soundtrack #1  starring Jamie Foxx and Quvenzhane Wallis.
6.  Any volunteers who just want to be a part of us for the day.
7.  Promotion
8.  Media

story:
Hi I'm Sue Craney. I'm profoundly deaf- but unlike many of my peers, I had access to the right support, an excellent education & amazing life opportunities. This has enabled me to be the Director of Deaf Access and more importantly, take an active part in the community, where I do a lot of voluntary work, deaf awareness and Mental Health 1st Aid training. I know I'm lucky.


Over the last 20 years I can honestly say Deaf Access have made a real difference to deaf people's lives. However, finding the funding we need is a BIG challenge because deafness is not cute or life threatening.  We desperately need to meet the real underlying needs of deaf people who have low literacy, poor social skills and who are often dependent on others- lacking the ability to have a voice. We need to change this- and I'm hoping you will support us so we can!

Our Sign Me project is about deaf people's basic human right of access, to services, information and to have a voice- often for the first time! To achieve this we need to build layers of empowerment and skills bit by bit. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • £78,000 over 2 years.  
  • Funds for BSL fluent trainers to engage Sign Language users
  • Hiring of venues, deaf friendly resources and Volunteer costs.
  • 'Sign me' can go ahead as and when each support module is funded!                  So we can start asap!
  • BSL friendly FUN events- where we teach you some BSL!
  • Updates; deaf people's stories! (www.deaf-access.co.uk)

The Impact

In March 2014 Sign Health research revealed a shocking story of unintentional neglect, shortened lives and wasted money. It revealed that potentially life-threatening health conditions are being missed, and poor treatment is offered when a diagnosis is made. It’s unfair and unjust that its due to being Deaf.  Reference; www.signhealth.org.uk/health-information/sick-of-it-report/

Being cut off socially often contributes to strong feelings of isolation. Hearing loss means a higher risk of mental illnesses such as depression or dementia.

Deaf Access have run  successful Comic relief and lottery projects. We've done cross borough working contributing to the development of deaf parenting materials used nationally today. 
Imagine having no voice. No access to services or support because nobody can understand you or sign to include you. Many cannot even communicate with their own families. This project will offer empowerment & independence.
Risks & Challenges

Deaf people are isolated by barriers to communication, sometimes even by their families- who seek to protect them. Many feel angry - feeling society has failed them, written them off.  Getting their trust and reaching those in minority groups is a huge challenge. 

  •  We need to produce more deaf friendly signed information clips.
  • Leaflets and information that include different minority groups 
  • Go to ethnic & minotity communities raising awareness to reach doubly isolated deaf people.

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please can you get the word out and make some noise about our work?
  • Can you use the Indiegogo share tools?

You have a voice. Deaf people still don't.

story:
Support The Free School!

Who We Are

For 45 years The Free School, the oldest democratic school in the United States, has provided students with a unique, self-directed education, removed from the stress and pressure of standardized testing.  At our inner-city school, where diversity is a hallmark, no families are denied admission due to lack of funds.  Students not only study traditional academic subjects but they also learn valuable life lessons about responsibility, critical thinking, social awareness, diversity and most importantly how to build relationships and care about each other.  It is our focus on community building that encourages students to follow their dreams, contribute positively to society, and become voices for change.

Why We Need Your Support

The Free School is an internationally recognized model of child-centered, community based education and has inspired others to start their own democratic schools around the world.   Despite this distinction, we have struggled financially, yet remain committed to never turning away families due to financial reasons. Over the past 4 years our operating costs have risen dramatically and more and more families are in need of tuition assistance. 

In order to stay true to our mission of helping families in need, we have decided to launch our first ever Indiegogo campaign to jump start our scholarship fund and make necessary capital improvements.   70% of all funds raised through this campaign will go directly to our scholarship fund which will help support families of all socioeconomic backgrounds in sending their kids to The Free School.  30% of the funds will go towards our capital fund which will support upgrades to our facilities and school capacity.

With your support, The Free School will be able to continue its mission, for another 45 years.  Please be a part of our bright future, as we honor our vibrant past!

Our History

Throughout the 45 years that The Free School has been open it has attracted educators, college students, artists, activists, and so many others from all over the world to visit and learn all that the school has to offer. Some find it such an amazing community to be a part of that they stay for several years, and some stay to learn what they need so they can build their own school community in other parts of the country and world. The students who graduate from The Free School continue to be driven to explore the world around them and shape their education based on what they love. Because they spend their fundamental years in the Free School environment, they are aware of their own inner strength and have the tools to create the education they want with the resources around them.

The Impact

By contributing to The Free School's campaign you will be supporting:

  • A unique and important model of true community based education.
  • A school that believes that kids should be kids.  We do not give standardized tests and homework.  At The Free School kids to learn through play, exploration and our approach fosters creative-minded thinkers
  • An incubator for innovative schools and child-centered educational practices.  Over the past decade The Free School has directly inspired and helped to start more than a dozen schools and alternative learning spaces across the country and around the world.
  • A new model of education that is responsive to a world that is full of learning experiences and styles.
  • A legacy of democratic free schools like ours including: Brooklyn Free School, Espacio A, Chicago Free School, Three Rivers Free School, Shikshantar, Village Free School, Patchwork School, Agile Learning Center and many others!

Risks & Challenges

For 45 years The Free School has been offering a truly unique education to children who live in Albany and surrounding areas.  Maintaining an independent, non-profit school that ensures racial, economic, and cultural diversity amongst its student body and staff is becoming increasingly difficult in these challenging economic times.  Keeping The Free School as an option for all families who want to see their child educated in a caring, empowering, respectful school community is a priority, and we need your help.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Please share this campaign with others and let us know if you have friends or networks that we should reach out to.

story: Fundacion Amigos del Nuevo Mundo or Fundamundo, is a special ed school in El Salvador that takes care of kids and adults with the down syndrome and provides them with lots of care and the best education they can get. Fundamundo takes absolutely no profit from the families of the students. The school has been struggling to pay rent, the teachers' salaries, electricity and water bills, educational materials and food. They receive no help from the government or other charities and depend solely on volunteers and donors. The school almost closed less than two years ago due to a robbery which left them without computers and without many materials. The cost of buying it all again to keep the school going is still being payed. Because of these costs, they had to move the school to a small two-story house in an area which is in a very bad and dangerous state. They also have to pay every month for private security and insurance. My purpose in helping them is to not only help keep the school up, but also help the families of the students pay for treatments and therapies they cannot afford, since they are very low-income. The school tries to provide them with different experiences such as cooking and art classes, or even simple things such as helping some students put up a birthday party for one of their friends. This is not only their school but also their second home, since the parents of some students work full-time to try to mantain their families. Even the smallest donation can help make a difference in the students' lives and we thank you deeply for it.

story:
THE MISSION:

To save a valued piece of American History! At 88 years, The Delta Queen is the oldest authentic overnight steamboat in America. She steamed through America's Waterways for 80 years until overnight cruise service was suspended in 2008. In 2009, she docked in Chattanooga, TN where she served as a dockside hotel until January 2014. For just over a year, the Delta Queen has remained vacant in Chattanooga while awaiting new ownership that would determine the next chapter in her majestic life. During her time in Chattanooga some parts of the vessel have deteriorated and are in desperate need of repair. The new owners of the Delta Queen Steamboat Company aim to preserve, protect and restore the Delta Queen to her former grandeur and return her to overnight cruise service on America's inland rivers. The Delta Queen has been towed from Chattanooga, Tennessee to Houma, Louisiana where she will undergo a complete restoration. But we need your help!

The Iconic Paddlewheel of The Delta Queen


THE HISTORY:

The Delta Queen is an overnight cruise vessel that first entered service in 1927 carrying passengers, cargo and automobiles between Sacramento and San Francisco, CA. In 1940 she was pressed into military service, painted battleship grey, and carried soldiers from the docks in San Francisco to Navy ships anchored in San Francisco Bay. It is said that the Delta Queen carried the first wounded soldiers returning from Pearl Harbor from arriving ships anchored in San Francisco Bay to the docks. Also, the first meeting of what eventually became the United Nations was held on board the Delta Queen while she was still in military service. After WWII, the Delta Queen was sold as war surplus to Capt. Tom Greene, owner of the Greene Line Steamers from Cincinnati, OH. Capt. Greene had the Delta Queen towed from San Francisco through the Panama Canal to New Orleans. From New Orleans, she steamed under her own power to Pittsburgh, PA where she was fully restored as an overnight cruise vessel. The Delta Queen returned to overnight cruise service in 1947 carrying passengers on the Ohio, Mississippi, Illinois, Tennessee, Cumberland, Arkansas and other Rivers and Waterways throughout America's Heartland and Deep South until 2008.


The Delta Queen

In 2009, the Delta Queen steamed up to Chattanooga, TN and became a dockside hotel. She operated as a hotel until January of 2014. On February 17, 2015 a group of loyal supporters and long time fans of the Delta Queen purchased the vessel and recreated the Delta Queen Steamboat Company. The mission of the Delta Queen Steamboat Company is to protect, preserve and restore the legendary Steamboat and to return her to overnight cruise service. 

The Delta Queen is a National Historic Landmark, is listed on the National Register of Historic Places, is in the National Maritime Hall of Fame, and in September of 2013 was designated by the National Trust for Historic Preservation as a National Treasure, an honor given to the most elite of our National Historic Landmarks. The Delta Queen has carried Presidents, Royalty and celebrities on America’s inland waterways over the decades, but more importantly, she has given hundreds of thousands of Americans and international visitors alike an opportunity to see much of our great country from the decks of an authentic 1927 steam driven paddlewheeler. Passengers on board the Delta Queen literally step back in time and relive the era of Mark Twain and his famous characters of river lore. The Delta Queen is an important part of our national history and cannot be lost.

       

President Jimmy Carter on board the Delta Queen & The National Historic Landmark Plaque Proudly Displayed on The Delta Queen


THE ROYAL VISION:

The first goal of the Delta Queen Steamboat Company and the many fans and supporters of the Delta Queen is to protect, preserve and restore this National Treasure. We need your help to save the Legendary Delta Queen. This first campaign is intended to raise money to repair and renovate her 88 cabins and public spaces which have fallen into disrepair during the last 15 months since the Delta Queen Hotel was shut down in Chattanooga, TN. The monies will be used to repair the roof on the sun deck which has numerous leaks which have caused rain damage in a number of cabins. The decks will be redone to eliminate leaks on each level. Wood damaged by those leaks will be repaired. Her air conditioning and heating systems will be repaired or replaced as needed. Her rails will be fully restored. Carpeting will be replaced and furnishings either replaced or reupholstered returning her cabins and public spaces to the elegance and glory of her earlier years.

This restoration will take place in two phases. This first campaign is intended to fund the restoration of the hotel side of the vessel and is expected to cost 1.5 million dollars. Phase two, a complete restoration of the marine side of the vessel is expected to cost nearly 4 million dollars. If we were to be fortunate enough to exceed our goal in phase one, any additional monies raised will be used to begin funding phase two.


THE IMPACT:

With each donation, we are one step closer to giving this invaluable piece of American History the restoration she deserves. Your contributions will be used to protect and restore the vessel in an effort to bring the Delta Queen back to life and preserve her for generations to come. The million dollars raised during this campaign will be used s follows:

Exterior caulking, wood repair & Paint--$212,500

Exterior deck repair and coating--$43,750

Repair/Replace Heating, Air Conditioning and Exhaust Fans--$175,000

Interior Plumbing Leak Repairs and Wood repairs--$50,000

Repaint Interior--$112,500

Repair & Refurbish Passenger Bathrooms--$43,750

Repair & Replace as needed Carpet and Fittings--$125,000

Repair/replace as needed fire detection and fire fighting systems--$112,500

Repair/replace as needed Electrical Panels and cables--$125,000



THE DAMAGE:

After sitting idle for seven years, the iconic Paddlewheel needs to be completely rebuilt

Mild - Moderate Leaks and roof damage can be found throughout the vessel


Leaks and roof damage had been patched for several years, but now needs immediate and total repair to preserve the vessel

The Delta Queen in Houma, Louisiana where she will undergo a complete restoration


THE CHALLENGE:

Prior to 1966, there were several disasters resulting from fires on wooden cruise ships far out in the ocean.  In response, Congress passed the Safety at Sea Act which prohibited vessels carrying more than 49 overnight passengers from operating in US waters unless they were made completely of non-combustible materials.  The intent of the law was to prohibit ocean going cruise ships made of wood from entering US ports. Unfortunately, the 1966 law also affected the Delta Queen which was the only overnight cruise vessel operating on the inland rivers of America at that time. While the Delta Queen has a steel hull, the hotel part of the vessel is made mostly of wood, but unlike ocean going cruise ships far out at sea, the Delta Queen is never more than a few 100 yards from shore. Recognizing the error, Congress immediately passed a law exempting the Delta Queen from the Safety at Sea Act. That exemption was renewed 9 times over the next 40 years. During her more than 80 years of overnight cruise service the Delta Queen carried hundreds of thousands of passengers safely.  In spite of her safety record, in 2008 the owners of the Delta Queen were unable to secure a renewal of the exemption which led to the Delta Queen leaving the overnight cruise service at the end of October 2008.

While the restoration of the hotel side of the Delta Queen is getting underway the new leaders of the Delta Queen Steamboat Company will also focus on securing  a new Congressional exemption to allow the Delta Queen to return to overnight cruise service. While we remain confident in our ability to secure a new Congressional Exemption, if we are unable to get Congress to pass the exemption, it is still important that we protect and preserve the Delta Queen. Unfortunately, no commercial financing will be available to fund our preservation effort until the Congressional Exemption is approved.  Until then, we must rely solely on contributions from those of you who want to help to save a our Queen.  


THE CREW: 

Cornel Martin, President and CEO of the Delta Queen Steamboat Company is leading the effort to preserve, protect and restore this National Historic Landmark. He worked for the original Delta Queen Steamboat Company from 1993 to 2004 and was responsible for all community and government relations. He spearheaded the last Congressional exemption which allowed the Delta Queen to operate as an overnight passenger vessel from 1998-2008.

Leah Ann Ingram, Vice President and COO, has been associated with the Delta Queen Steamboat Company since 1993.  She and her husband Randy were caretakers and operated the Delta Queen as a dockside hotel in Chattanooga, TN from 2010-2014. They are credited with keeping the Delta Queen alive so that returning her to overnight river cruise service is still a viable option. 

Phillip Johnson, Director of Marine Operations has been dedicated to preserving the marine side of the Delta Queen for years and has developed a unique experience and understanding of the Delta Queen's marine machinery.

Captain Mike Williams, Sr. Captain, started out as the ships carpenter on the Delta Queen in 1980 and worked his way up to Captain.  Captain Williams has more than 30 years of experience operating, preserving, caring for and tending to the unique needs of the Delta Queen.

"The Delta Queen is an important part of our history. She's the last authentic steam-driven overnight paddlewheeler in America. Restoring the Delta Queen and returning her to overnight cruise service is the only opportunity for Americans to see our country from the decks of a 1927 steamboat and relive the era of Mark Twain and his cast of river characters." -- Cornel Martin
story_txt:
THE MISSION: 

To save a valued piece of American History! At 88 years, The Delta Queen is the oldest authentic overnight steamboat in America. She steamed through America's Waterways for 80 years until overnight cruise service was suspended in 2008. In 2009, she docked in Chattanooga, TN where she served as a dockside hotel until January 2014. For just over a year, the Delta Queen has remained vacant in Chattanooga while awaiting new ownership that would determine the next chapter in her majestic life. During her time in Chattanooga some parts of the vessel have deteriorated and are in desperate need of repair. The new owners of the Delta Queen Steamboat Company aim to preserve, protect and restore the Delta Queen to her former grandeur and return her to overnight cruise service on America's inland rivers. The Delta Queen has been towed from Chattanooga, Tennessee to Houma, Louisiana where she will undergo a complete restoration. But we need your help!


The Iconic Paddlewheel of The Delta Queen 

THE HISTORY: 


The Delta Queen is an overnight cruise vessel that first entered
service in 1927 carrying passengers, cargo and automobiles between Sacramento
and San Francisco, CA. In 1940 she was pressed into military service, painted
battleship grey, and carried soldiers from the docks in San Francisco to Navy ships
anchored in San Francisco Bay. It is said that the Delta Queen carried the first
wounded soldiers returning from Pearl Harbor from arriving ships anchored in San Francisco Bay to the docks. Also, the first meeting of what eventually became the United Nations was
held on board the Delta Queen while she was still in military service. After WWII, the Delta Queen was sold as war
surplus to Capt. Tom Greene, owner of the Greene Line Steamers from Cincinnati,
OH. Capt. Greene had the Delta Queen towed from San Francisco through the Panama
Canal to New Orleans. From New Orleans, she steamed under her own power to
Pittsburgh, PA where she was fully restored as an overnight cruise vessel. The
Delta Queen returned to overnight cruise service in 1947 carrying passengers on the Ohio, Mississippi, Illinois, Tennessee, Cumberland, Arkansas and other Rivers and Waterways throughout America's Heartland and Deep South until 2008.


The Delta Queen 

In 2009, the Delta Queen steamed up to Chattanooga, TN and became a
dockside hotel. She operated as a hotel until January of 2014. On February 17,
2015 a group of loyal supporters and long time fans of the Delta Queen
purchased the vessel and recreated the Delta Queen Steamboat Company. The
mission of the Delta Queen Steamboat Company is to protect, preserve and
restore the legendary Steamboat and to return her to overnight cruise service. 
The Delta Queen is a
National Historic Landmark, is listed on the National Register of Historic
Places, is in the National Maritime Hall of Fame, and in September of 2013 was
designated by the National Trust for Historic Preservation as a National Treasure,
an honor given to the most elite of our National Historic Landmarks. The Delta
Queen has carried Presidents, Royalty and celebrities on America’s inland
waterways over the decades, but more importantly, she has given hundreds of
thousands of Americans and international visitors alike an opportunity to see much of our great country from the decks of an authentic 1927 steam driven paddlewheeler.
Passengers on board the Delta Queen literally step back in time and relive the
era of Mark Twain and his famous characters of river lore. The Delta Queen is
an important part of our national history and cannot be lost. 

        
President Jimmy Carter on board the Delta Queen & The National Historic Landmark Plaque Proudly Displayed on The Delta Queen


THE ROYAL VISION:
The first goal
of the Delta Queen Steamboat Company and the many fans and supporters of the
Delta Queen is to protect, preserve and restore this National Treasure. We need
your help to save the Legendary Delta Queen. This first campaign is intended to
raise money to repair and renovate her 88 cabins and public spaces which have
fallen into disrepair during the last 15 months since the Delta Queen Hotel was
shut down in Chattanooga, TN. The
monies will be used to repair the roof on the sun deck which has numerous leaks which have caused rain damage in a number of cabins. The decks will be redone to
eliminate leaks on each level. Wood damaged by those leaks will be repaired. Her
air conditioning and heating systems will be repaired or replaced as needed.
Her rails will be fully restored. Carpeting will be replaced and furnishings
either replaced or reupholstered returning her cabins and public spaces to the
elegance and glory of her earlier years. 
This restoration will take place in two phases. This first
campaign is intended to fund the restoration of the hotel side of the vessel
and is expected to cost 1.5 million dollars. Phase two, a complete restoration
of the marine side of the vessel is expected to cost nearly 4 million dollars.
If we were to be fortunate enough to exceed our goal in phase one, any
additional monies raised will be used to begin funding phase two. 


 
 THE IMPACT: 

With each donation, we are one step closer to giving this invaluable piece of American History the restoration she deserves. Your contributions will be used to protect and restore the vessel in an effort to bring the Delta Queen back to life and preserve her for generations to come. The million dollars raised during this campaign will be used s follows:
Exterior caulking, wood repair & Paint--$212,500
Exterior deck repair and coating--$43,750
Repair/Replace Heating, Air Conditioning and Exhaust
Fans--$175,000
Interior Plumbing Leak Repairs and Wood repairs--$50,000
Repaint Interior--$112,500
Repair & Refurbish Passenger Bathrooms--$43,750
Repair & Replace as needed Carpet and Fittings--$125,000
Repair/replace as needed fire detection and fire fighting
systems--$112,500
Repair/replace as needed Electrical Panels and
cables--$125,000

  THE DAMAGE:


After sitting idle for seven years, the iconic Paddlewheel needs to be completely rebuilt

Mild - Moderate Leaks and roof damage can be found throughout the vessel 


Leaks and roof damage had been patched for several years, but now needs immediate and total repair to preserve the vessel 

The Delta Queen in Houma, Louisiana where she will undergo a complete restoration
THE CHALLENGE:
Prior to 1966, there were several disasters resulting from fires on wooden cruise ships far out in the ocean.  In response, Congress passed the Safety at Sea Act which
prohibited vessels carrying more than 49 overnight passengers from operating in
US waters unless they were made completely of non-combustible materials.  The intent of the law was to prohibit ocean going cruise ships made of wood from entering US ports. Unfortunately, the 1966
law also affected the Delta Queen which was the only overnight cruise vessel
operating on the inland rivers of America at that time. While the Delta Queen has a steel hull, the hotel part of the vessel is made mostly of wood, but unlike ocean going cruise ships far out at sea, the Delta Queen is never more than a few 100 yards from shore. Recognizing the error, Congress immediately
passed a law exempting the Delta Queen from the Safety at Sea Act. That
exemption was renewed 9 times over the next 40 years. During her more than 80
years of overnight cruise service the Delta Queen carried hundreds of thousands
of passengers safely.  In spite of her safety record, in 2008 the owners of
the Delta Queen were unable to secure a renewal of the exemption which led to
the Delta Queen leaving the overnight cruise service at the end of October
2008.
While the restoration of the hotel side of the Delta Queen
is getting underway the new leaders of the Delta Queen Steamboat Company will also
focus on securing  a new
Congressional exemption to allow the Delta Queen to return to overnight cruise
service. While we remain confident in our ability to secure a new Congressional
Exemption, if we are unable to get Congress to pass the exemption, it is still important that we protect and preserve the Delta Queen. Unfortunately, no commercial financing will be available to fund our preservation effort until the Congressional Exemption is approved.  Until then, we must rely solely on contributions from those of you who want to help to save a our Queen.  

THE CREW: 
Cornel Martin, President and 
CEO of the Delta Queen Steamboat Company is leading the effort to 
preserve, protect and restore this National Historic Landmark. He worked
 for the original Delta Queen Steamboat Company from 1993 to 2004 and 
was responsible for all community and government relations. He 
spearheaded the last Congressional exemption which allowed the Delta 
Queen to operate as an overnight passenger vessel from 1998-2008. 

Leah Ann Ingram, Vice President and COO, has been associated with the Delta Queen Steamboat Company since 1993.  She and her husband Randy were 
caretakers and operated the Delta Queen as a dockside hotel in 
Chattanooga, TN from 2010-2014. They are credited with keeping the Delta
 Queen alive so that returning her to overnight river cruise service is 
still a viable option. 
Phillip Johnson, Director of Marine Operations has been dedicated to 
preserving the marine side of the Delta Queen for years and has 
developed a unique experience and understanding of the Delta Queen's 
marine machinery. Captain Mike Williams, Sr. Captain, started out as the ships carpenter on the Delta Queen in 1980 and worked his way up to Captain.  Captain Williams has more than 30 years of experience operating, preserving, caring for and tending to the unique needs of the Delta Queen.
"The Delta Queen is an important part of our history. She's the last 
authentic steam-driven overnight paddlewheeler in America. Restoring the Delta Queen and returning her 
to overnight cruise service is the only opportunity for Americans to see
 our country from the decks of a 1927 steamboat and relive the era of 
Mark Twain and his cast of river characters." -- Cornel Martin

story:
Short Summary

In a small rural village in Ghana, Offinso, there is a open and free school for orphans, disabled children and kids whose parents don't have the money to pay for their education. This school was built thanks to the grand effort of Zacchaeus Nderango Donkor, a local, with the help of a now deceased European philanthropist.
The school offers both English and Math class, together with 3 meals a day and accommodation to those without a home to go to. It currently has about 250 children and even more families profit from it. The many ways in which this community profits from the school are uncountable, but sadly, it still struggles to find funds for new projects.
Therefore, I am helping Zacchaeus expand his positive impact on the community by building a library. Currently, there are no libraries, bookshops nor reading rooms within the community, making the children only have access to the few schoolbooks in class. Our plan is to build a room which we will fill with books in English to provide these children, and the whole community, a space where they can take and read any book they want.
This library is part of the Bookfeeding Projects, a young organization which builds free and public libraries in communities in need. This organization has already built libraries in India, Madagascar, Kenya and Malaysia, and they have all been a success. You can read more about these projects and see more pictures in our website:  http://bookfeeding.org/projects/. 

What We Need

To proceed with this project we need two main things: books and funds.
BOOKS: We collect unwanted, unused or old books in English and will bring and send them to Ghana. They are collected in libraries and collection points and can also be sent directly to Ghana. You can find the locations on our website. 
FUNDS: We need the funds to build a room and furnish it with shelves and tables, so that we can fill it with all the books we have collected. We also need money to help send the boxes from the collection points to Offinso.

The Impact

The good thing about this project is that it will be as big as the funds are. There is no minimum and no maximum. It's easy: The more money we raise, the more boxes full of books that we will send, the more people we will reach.

With 5 euros, we will be able to build a shelf to place the books, With 20 euros, a wall can be painted in colors and drawings. With 50 euros, a box full of books gets sent to Offinso. Every single donation helps bring the books closer to the children.

 All the volunteers, including myself, pay for our own flight and accommodation, so you can be sure that 100% of your donations go directly to the library.


Other Ways You Can Help

Contributing economically is not the only possible way to help. One other option is to donate unwanted books at our different collecting points all over Europe. Additionally, you can share this with your friends and family. 

Please visit our site and Facebook page to learn more.

www.bookfeeding.org

www.facebook.com/bookfeeding

Thank you from the bottom of my heart!

story:
On Saturday, April 25th, Nepal was rocked by a 7.8 magnitude earthquake. Timing is critical in emergencies such as these. Please donate to help relief victims! All donations to Namlo are tax-deductible, and will go directly to relief efforts.

Thousands have been killed, and more injured. As time goes by, the fatalities will inevitably increase.  We know most of our staff our safe, but still haven’t heard from a couple in Kathmandu or our board members.  It will be a while before we hear of how the earthquake has impacted our communities, families, schools and students.  As we get details we will formulate our response, regardless of its through a Namlo-organized relief effort, or us passing resources on to other relief organizations.

One thing is clear:  urgent help is needed.  Your contribution will help save lives!


A letter from Namlo's Executive Director, Keith Frausto:

By now, you have probably heard about the devastating earthquake in Nepal, the tragic loss of life, the destruction of homes, roads, infrastructure and historical sites.  This is the type of tragedy from which it will take Nepal years to recover...and the disaster is still unfolding.

As the hours, days and weeks pass by, the number of dead and injured will continue to rise, and there are countless communities outside of Kathmandu with which there has been no contact, communities that for all intents and purposes are cut off from help that is critically needed; communities such as Dhuskun, Yarmasing, and Sabhung, where Namlo has had a presence, building schools and sustainable communities over the years since 1999.  Or in communities such as Mankha or Arunodaya where Namlo has just started to begin to work.

Reports from the field, while very limited, indicate that there has been significant destruction in Dhuskun, Mankha and possibly Yarmasing.  While information from the field is very spotty, one thing is clear to me:  the only help some of these communities will receive will be the help we can bring, and what we can mobilize from supporters like you, working to provide resources to our field staff on the ground.

As I write this, our first priority is the safety and security of our staff, who thankfully have all survived the earthquake.  It may be that they too are in need of assistance before they can mobilize support for others.  In any case, our staff are resourceful, resilient and very capable, and will do whatever they can to save lives and help begin the rebuilding process.  

When the landslide hit the Mankha area in Sindhupalchowk last year, we received donations to help Namlo mobilize the 33 members of the Dhuskun Women’s Cooperative to play a direct role in delivering urgent relief supplies in the affected communities that were literally down the road from them.  Now they are the ones in need, and with your support, we can begin delivering relief supplies so they can help their community survive this ordeal.

In disasters such as these, the communities that are far from the center of action are frequently the last to receive help -- sometimes not at all.  We can’t let that happen. You, too, can be directly involved in the rebuilding process by helping us launch re-construction programs in our remote communities. Namlo will be in these communities long after the relief operations in Kathmandu are finished, continuing to help with eduation, economic development, women's empowerment, and infrastructure building.  Thanks for your support -- and don't forget to forward this to anyone who you think might want to donate too!

Yours in a Time of Need,

Keith Frausto

Executive Director

story:
Support for DARKA Village

Dhading district is one the the seventy-five districts of Nepal, covers an area of 1,926 Square kilometers with 336,067 population. The mountain ragne "Ganesh" is the predominate mountain range located within Dhading. Some of the peaks are over 7,000 meters. The 8,000 meters plus mountain "Manaslu" is clearly visible from much of Dhading, although it is located within the bounds of another distirict "Gorkha".

The transnational "King Prithivi Highway" connecting Kathmandu Pokhara runs through the southern portion of the district making an easy access to the Kathmandu valley. Dhading disctrict is bounded by seven other district :

  • East: Kathmandu, Rasuwa, Nuwakot
  • West: Gorkha
  • North: Rasuwa and Tibet
  • South : Makwanpur and Chitwan

We are raising funds for the northern part of the district - a small vilalge DARKHA, which has aboundray with Tibet as well. There are 7 VDC, village or Village Development Council and 7300 households. Recent devastiting 7.8 richter scale earthquake had hit very  badly to all VDs. Table below are the actual loss of this devastiting natural disaster.

After recent massive earthquake, the village lost everything, people, houses, schools, heathpost, you just name it. Requirement for this particular village when providing relife aid are enoromous, however we can do very basic needs things such as healthcare supplies and provide temporary shelter i.e tent, matress etc.

story:
Konnichiwa!

As of this post, I am a 16 year, 6 month, 23 day old caucasian male from the United States, born and raised in... Well, really every corner of the country (California, Oregon, New Hampshire, and Tennessee).  I have always had a strong wanderlust and a desire for travel, and love the Japanese culture.  I plan to travel with the company AFS, however, coming from a lower-middle class family, while I live quite well, I don't have the funds to pay for this trip.  I do have a job, however, do to current time constraints, still need quite a lot of cushion from others to be enough to raise it  --at least not at minimum wage-- and with school, can't hope to amass such a dragon's horde in so short of a time frame.  It has always been my passion to be a writer and a world traveler, and I hope for this trip to kick-start that dream.  On top of all this sob-story, they have some darn good food (and I've already invested quite a bit of time in teaching myself the language).
What I Need
Here goes:  maybe it is a bit bold to go for the entire pot through crowd funding, but that is a risk I am willing to take *thumps fist over heart with tear rolling down cheek*.  I need $15,000 dollars just to participate in the program, and I need an additional $1,000-$2,000 to spend while in the country on things like phone, metro, pocket, and lunch (things that my host family will not provide).  
**The goal is set to $19,000 due to the fact that Indiegogo will remove 5% wether I reach my goal or not, take 3% +30 cents/transaction for credit card processing, and 3-5% for Paypal transactions.  At the end of all that, I will be left with around $16,500, assuming that the goal is reached.  This is the total, as I do not know how much I will be able to make on my own.
Every Little Bit Counts

Maybe it is hard to see, but any contribution is a god-send for me.  5 bucks or fifty, both will be majorly appreciated.

Not All Riches Are Monetary

Even if you can't donate right now for whatever reason, that is OK!  In fact, you can still do one of the most important things that anybody can do:  you can share this page and spread the word.  Whether you donate or not, I implore you to share the link to this site with as many people as you can, because the more people I get, the more people I have to help me out.

story:
The Kavadades Kindergarten - Short Summary

Its simple. Economic crisis is rampant on a global scale, and local education usually suffers. Our Kindergarten needs funds for basic upgrades that are necessary for child safety and a conducive learning environment.

Additionally, under the current capital controls it is very difficult for Greeks in Greece to donate cash through credit card systems and limited availability of funds, so we need the support of Greeks abroad.

My name is Bill Tsolakidis and with the help of my cousin George Patrikis lets help my daughter and her classmates who attend this school, make their school safer and improved. Lets give them basic tools, they don't have. Although this is her last year there, I feel the need to show those around us that everything is possible. Lets show the "nay-sayers" what we can do. A small donation can go a large way. The future is in our hands and in our Kindergartens!

Say you lost a pack of cigarettes, so you forgot that coupon at the market last week, so you gave your change from your ash bin in your car, say what you want, but your extra change can go a long way for these little minds of the future.

Lets put together some cash, so we can materialize the upgrades and improvements that this school so direly needs. We have received quotes and from locals that will basically be volunteering their services in an work to improve the Kindergarten. We need to raise the funds for the materials. 

Ohh..all art will be hand created by the kids themselves!

What We Need & What You Get

We need to add basic learning tools: cost 1407 Euros

We need new interior floors: cost 2300 Euros

We need new exterior Tartan: cost 3970 Euros

We need a new roof (it leaks) cost: 4850 Euros

We need to upgrade old and damaged school equipment (chairs, shelves, etc.): 1450 Euros

We need to upgrade the exterior play ground toys to safe and conducive devices: cost estimated at 6500 Euros

As you can see our total is 20,477 (Euro) far greater that what we are asking for. But we are humble and anything will help.

If we don't reach our goal we will keep campaigning until we do! (and the kids can always study on the floor...:)

The Impact

These little children should learn to love school, learning and growing. Giving this gift to them will ensure a better future for all of us. They say what doesn't kill you makes you stronger, but I'm not sure about construction gravel and rusted pipes in their yard. 

Risks & Challenges

If we don't raise enough money through this site, then we will put more of our personal work and effort in to this goal. We won't stop and we have not stopped. We need to make our school safe and favorable to the kids learning experience.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Folks, get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
The Kavadades Kindergarten - Short Summary
 Its simple. Economic crisis is rampant on a global scale, and local education usually suffers. Our Kindergarten needs funds for basic upgrades that are necessary for child safety and a conducive learning environment.
Additionally, under the current capital controls it is very difficult for Greeks in Greece to donate cash through credit card systems and limited availability of funds, so we need the support of Greeks abroad.
My name is Bill Tsolakidis and with the help of my cousin George Patrikis lets help my daughter and her classmates who attend this school, make their school safer and improved. Lets give them basic tools, they don't have. Although this is her last year there, I feel the need to show those around us that everything is possible. Lets show the "nay-sayers" what we can do. A small donation can go a large way. The future is in our hands and in our Kindergartens!
Say you lost a pack of cigarettes, so you forgot that coupon at the market last week, so you gave your change from your ash bin in your car, say what you want, but your extra change can go a long way for these little minds of the future.
Lets put together some cash, so we can materialize the upgrades and improvements that this school so direly needs. We have received quotes and from locals that will basically be volunteering their services in an work to improve the Kindergarten. We need to raise the funds for the materials. 
Ohh..all art will be hand created by the kids themselves!   What We Need & What You Get We need to add basic learning tools: cost 1407 Euros
We need new interior floors: cost 2300 Euros
We need new exterior Tartan: cost 3970 Euros
We need a new roof (it leaks) cost: 4850 Euros
We need to upgrade old and damaged school equipment (chairs, shelves, etc.): 1450 Euros
We need to upgrade the exterior play ground toys to safe and conducive devices: cost estimated at 6500 Euros
As you can see our total is 20,477 (Euro) far greater that what we are asking for. But we are humble and anything will help.
If we don't reach our goal we will keep campaigning until we do! (and the kids can always study on the floor...:)
    The Impact These little children should learn to love school, learning and growing. Giving this gift to them will ensure a better future for all of us. They say what doesn't kill you makes you stronger, but I'm not sure about construction gravel and rusted pipes in their yard. 
    Risks & Challenges If we don't raise enough money through this site, then we will put more of our personal work and effort in to this goal. We won't stop and we have not stopped. We need to make our school safe and favorable to the kids learning experience.
    Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  Folks, get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools!   And that's all there is to it.

story:
Who We Are & What We Do

A non-profit organization with the mission to leverage technology to effect change within the African community and empower youth of African descent.

As part of our mission to empower African youth, we are embarking on a project to renovate an ICT lab for the bright students of Mamponteng SDA School in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. 


The Challenge Of A Poorly Resourced ICT Lab

Presently, the school of over 400 students has only one small ICT lab without an adequate number of computers, internet access and modern curriculum.

Your support will play a tremendous role in helping us give these students better access to better learning opportunities through a modern computer lab.

Currently the students learn in an IT lab that is falling apart with many challenges such as:

* Outdated computers

* Lack of study material

* Dilapidated class room infrastructure

This makes effective teaching and learning, a herculean task.


What We Need

The total cost of renovating the ICT lab is $6,000 (Note: Figures below are estimated). The money will go towards : 

We invite you to join us in making this dream a reality. 

The Impact

A modern ICT lab will bring about positive change in many ways: 

• A modern learning space

• Improved I.T instruction and learning

• Positive progress made towards bridging technology skills gap.

• Continuous partnership with the school to develop a strong technology curriculum that can be extended to the surrounding community. 

• Future tech hub for people in the community to learn and access the internet.


Risks & Challenges

Like every great effort to make the world a better place, our project is fraught with challenges such as: 

• Adequate funding - We need to raise $6,000 to successfully complete the project. 

Other Ways You Can Help

No gift is too small. Any way you can help will be greatly appreciated:

  • Spread the word to get other people involved.
  • Contribute resources to the project (computers, learning materials, etc)
  • Share the campaign with your networks on FaceBook, Twitter, etc

story:
ONLY 5$ TO RECEIVE SMILES !

Since 2013, Casque Noir (Nonprofits Organisation) and the Organising Committee and Central Management (COGEC) from Jalousie have been working extremely hard to develop an expertise in the conception and creation of playgrounds in limited spaces. 

One of our first studies carried out on site shows that a majority of children '' play '' in some unhealthy and unsecure areas and lack recreation resources. Currently, only the teenagers from the neighbourhood can benefit from a soccer field, which was laid in 2013 under the program Jalousie Color, a program set up by the Haitian government in collaboration with the United Nations. 

The two schools located close to the playgrounds spaces, lack proper infrastructure. During recess, many children end up playing on the sidewalks and the main road, finding themselves dangerously stock in hectic traffic, and trade stands. Not only are a child’s well-being and development questioned in this context, but so is a child’s safety. 

As part of our program to create playground areas, we have mandated Casque Noir’s architects as well as two engineers, including a member of COGEC. 

Since 2013, we have been helping the youth of Jalousie and students from the College Regina Assumpta in Montreal cooperate in order to work on the creative process of these playground. 

Cooperation is essential to our project for our organization is based primarily on learning through educational exchange, which develops through concrete skills transfer. 

Our exhibitions at La TOHU and our television interviews demonstrate our interest in education, based on the values of integrity, transparency, humility, and mutual support : http://ici.radio-canada.ca/emissions/rdi_week_end/2014-2015/entrevue.asp?idDoc=359977

We have now reached the end of our development plan. These proposals are concrete and measurable. That’s why we wish to implement, in collaboration with the COGEC, the construction of a first playground. 

Our estimated budget is 7000 dollars USD including the cost of materials on site, labor, the painting of the ground and the final design. 

As part of this project, dedicated to the children of Jalousie, we would like to ask your financial support.

Again, I wish to thank you !

Nathalie Claude

Chairwoman of the board & founder

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

SEULEMENT 5$ POUR RECEVOIR PLEIN DE SOURIRES !

Dans le but d’améliorer les conditions de vie des enfants quotidiennement exposés à des espaces réduits et qui n’ont accès à aucun loisir, l'Organisation Casque noir (OSBL - NEQ : 1170192992) basée sur Montréal se donne comme mission de travailler sur l’absence de jeux ludiques ou d’espaces récréatifs aménagés et adaptés aux plus jeunes dans le quartierJalousie à Port-au-Prince (Haïti).

Tous les membres de l'équipe sont des professionnels bénévoles (architectes, enseignants, gestionnaire) et aucun frais administratif n'est déduit des financement reçus. 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

LA PARTICULARITÉ DU QUARTIER JALOUSIE À PORT-AU-PRINCE (HAÏTI)

Quartier informel construit sur les hauteurs de le commune de Pétion-Ville (Port-au-Prince) / 80 000 habitants / considéré comme le 3e plus grand bidonville de Port-au-Prince

Les enfants représentent plus de 60% de la population dans Jalousie.

L’appropriation par la réoccupation ludique de l’espace, non prévue à cet effet, est le signe majeur au départ de la méconnaissance par les habitants du quartier d’une réalité sociale profonde. 

Prendre possession d'un lien de rassemblement et occuper une aire de jeux, permettra à ces enfants de ne pas suivre le pas des plus vieux, le plus souvent confrontés à la délinquance juvénile, la mendicité et la prostitution. 

COMMENT CONSTRUIRONS-NOUS L'AIRE DE JEUX PIROULI ?

La participation citoyenne est un processus au cours duquel les acteurs du quartier sont  sollicités dans la prise de décisions. Aujourd'hui, l'appareil décisionnel est consolidé depuis plus d'un an. Les autorisations de construire ont été validées par la mairie de Pétion-Ville (Port-au-Prince) et par le Comité des Organisations et de Gestion du quartier Jalousie (COGEC). La zone d'intégration de l'aire de jeux Pirouli a déjà fait l'objet d'un revêtement ludique sur le sol. Les mesures de l'espace ont été prises par un architecte et un ingénieur. Des propositions d'aménagement ont vu le jour en 2014, celles-ci enrichies et documentées par une centaine de jeunes montréalais et de Jalousie. 

Une école professionnelle du quartier a été mandatée pour construire la structure de l'aire de jeux et une équipe de jeunes avec le soutien des habitants de la zone est prête à investir le ''design'' de l'espace de jeux. 

L'espace Pirouli se situe en plein coeur d'une zone familiale, à l'abris du vandalisme ou de la flânerie. 

Afin de démarrer ce projet de participation citoyenne, nous avons besoin de couvrir les coûts en termes de matériaux, de bétonnage, de design urbain et tous les frais relatifs qui sont liés aux salaires à verser aux étudiants de l'école professionnelle. 

7 000 dollars est une somme tout à fait honorable pour aménager l'espace Pirouli car nous estimons qu'un montant supplémentaire serait pris en charge par le gouvernement du Canada. 

Évidemment, votre investissement fera l'objet d'un suivi, par courriel ou simplement en suivant nos activités sur le blogue de casque noir : http://casquenoir.tumblr.com/.

Longue vie à tous ces sourires ! 

Nathalie Claude, enseignante en arts, présidente et fondatrice de l'Organisation Casque noir

casquenoir2013@gmail.com

(514) 815-6682

story:
Al ver que en España y en el mundo en general la violencia y la incomprensión impera en las comunicaciones, en las relaciones de pareja, sociales, familiares, en la política, etc. y que podemos transformar esta situación en nuestra vida y en el mundo sencillamente aprendiendo esta actitud de escuchar y percibir con empatía lo que sienten las personas. Me siento comprometido y con energía para formar y dar a conocer la Comunicación No Violenta que el psicólogo y mediador Marshall Rosenberg enseño, en pro de realizar este cambio en el mundo y en nosotros.

  • Esta campaña es para apoyar que las personas interesadas en formarse y promover la CNV tengan la oportunidad de asistir al IIT de Mexico.

  • El IIT Mexico es una oportunidad única por que es en Español. Nunca antes ha habido un IIT en español y no sabemos si habrá otro, ni cuando será éste.

Entrenamiento Intensivo en Comunicación No Violenta

Este Entrenamiento Intensivo Internacional (IIT por sus siglas en inglés: International Intensive Training) es una experiencia de "inmersión" en comunicación no violenta. Es un retiro residencial dirigido por un experimentado equipo de instructores certificados por el Center for Non Violent Communication (CNVC).

El propósito de este entrenamiento IIT es ofrecer a los participantes la oportunidad de vivir el proceso de la comunicación no violenta en un contexto de comunidad durante un período relativamente largo, donde puedan desarrollar óptimamente el conocimiento, las habilidades y la conciencia de la comunicación no violenta.

Con esto estaremos formando y ayudando a aprender a relacionarnos teniendo en cuenta las necesidades del otro y las propias, compasiva y con empatía, donde la conexión entre las personas sea de corazón a corazón. 

Como el coste del IIT y el viaje a Mexico excede ampliamente la capacidad económica de muchos de los interesados en participar, esta campaña de recolección de fondos pone los medios para que entre todos voluntariamente apoyemos esta causa y los interesados puedan continuar formándose en el IIT Mexico y así después formar y propagar la comunicación con empatía.

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Nuestro objetivo es que todos los interesados en participar en el IIT Mexico lo hagan pero no sabemos los fondos que recaudaremos, así que según la cantidad que recaudemos podremos becar a mas o menos participantes. 

Los costes son:

      -Pensión completa en dormitorio compartido = 278 euros

     -Inscripción en IIT Mexico= 2112 euros

      Total: 2390 euros / persona.

      -Beca para 2 participantes con inscripción IIT Mexico mas pensión completa en dormitorio compartido pero sin billete de avión = 4780 euros.

      -Beca para 3 participantes con inscripción IIT Mexico mas pensión completa en dormitorio compartido pero sin billete de avión = 7170 euros.

     -Vuelo de avión i/v Madrid-Mexico D.C.: 800 euros (a pagar por el propio participante, o si no tuviera recursos suficientes y hubieran fondos suficientes se puede considerar ofrecer beca para que asista al IIT)

Lo que obtienes son menciones en nuestra web, descuentos o exención total de pago en talleres, sesiones de empatía y de escucha que los participantes impartan posteriormente.

Toda persona que apoye esta campaña con 30 euros o mas puede ser candidata a obtener la beca y puede votar entre todos los candidatos. A los mas votados se les asignara la beca. Los votantes no pueden votarse a sí mismos.

Para ser candidato envía el currículo o la presentación hablando de tus intenciones, documentación que pruebe tu experiencia, horas de formación, estudios afines y todo lo que consideres oportuno al e-mail: iitespanol@gmail.com

Currículum de los candidatos en: https://sites.google.com/site/iitespanol

Información del Entrenamiento Intensivo de Mexico:

http://comunicacionnoviolenta.com/cursos/122-IIT_MeXICO_en_castellano/449-ENCUENTRO_INTERNACIONAL_en_castellano.html

A parte de esta campaña para recaudar fondos los interesados en participar en el IIT Mexico también tienen la posibilidad de solicitar la beca directamente en,

The Center for NoViolent Communication:

https://www.cnvc.org/es/IIT/Mex-Sept-2015

El impacto

  • Apoyar esta campaña es valioso para los colaboradores por que recibirán una contra-prestación: aprendizaje y crecimiento, escucha y empatía, participar en talleres con descuentos o exención de precios, el reflejo en la web de que ellos han contribuido con este proyecto, si así lo desean. Además de, el sentimiento de contribuir al cambio social ayudando a formarse y propagar la empatía.

  • En Indiegogo han habido otras campañas relacionadas con la CNV. Para mi es la primera vez que inicio una campaña de recaudación de fondos.

  • Lance la idea de recaudación de fondos al grupo de la Asociación para la Comunicación NoViolenta. Entonces, propusieron que fuera a través de una plataforma de crowdfunding. Después de estudiar su funcionamiento y viendo que finalmente el proyecto fue aceptado por la junta me volqué totalmente en realizar la campaña. Esta campaña es para todos. Y especialmente para los que simpatizan con la comunicación No violenta, de empatía, asertiva y positiva.

Riesgos y desafíos

Las personas que apoyan la campaña si finalmente no se alcanzara el objetivo inicial la cantidad aportada puede ser devuelta a elección del mecenas. Entendiendo bien que la devolución sería por la cantidad aportada menos las comisiones de Indiegogo y PayPal. Pues Indiegogo no nos deja reembolsar a nuestros colaboradores una vez que se reciba la primera colaboración. Entonces esta devolución tendría que efectuarse en una transacción independiente.

O dichas cantidades pueden ser dirigidas a un fondo de becas en favor de las personas que quieren hacer cursos organizados por la Asociación para la Comunicación NoViolenta y no disponen de recursos para pagarlos.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Sabemos que muchos de nosotros no podemos colaborar economicamente y que si lo desean pueden ayudar difundiendo la campaña entre amigos, familiares, etc.

O en internet, en la plataforma de Indiegogo, facebook, twitter, etc.

Y ante todo, muchas gracias por leer y considerar esta propuesta-campaña.

Un fuerte abrazo.

David Devesa

completa en dormitorio compartido pero sin billete de avión = 7170
euros.

     -Vuelo
de avión i/v Madrid-Mexico D.C.: 800 euros (a pagar por el propio
participante, o si no tuviera recursos suficientes y hubieran fondos
suficientes se puede considerar ofrecer beca para que asista al IIT)

Lo
que obtienes son menciones en nuestra web, descuentos o exención total de pago en talleres,
sesiones de empatía y de escucha que los participantes impartan posteriormente.

Toda
persona que apoye esta campaña con 30 euros o mas puede ser
candidata a obtener la beca y puede votar entre todos los candidatos.
A los mas votados se les asignara la beca. Los votantes no pueden votarse a sí mismos.

Para
ser candidato envía el currículo o la presentación hablando
de tus intenciones, documentación que pruebe tu experiencia, horas
de formación, estudios afines y todo lo que consideres oportuno al
e-mail: iitespanol@gmail.com
Currículum de los
candidatos en: https://sites.google.com/site/iitespanolInformación
del Entrenamiento Intensivo de Mexico:

http://comunicacionnoviolenta.com/cursos/122-IIT_MeXICO_en_castellano/449-ENCUENTRO_INTERNACIONAL_en_castellano.html

A
parte de esta campaña para recaudar fondos los
interesados en participar en el IIT Mexico también tienen la
posibilidad de solicitar la beca directamente en,

The
Center for NoViolent Communication:

https://www.cnvc.org/es/IIT/Mex-Sept-2015

El
impacto




	Apoyar
	esta campaña es valioso para los colaboradores por que recibirán
	una contra-prestación: aprendizaje y crecimiento, escucha y
	empatía, participar en talleres con descuentos o exención de
	precios, el reflejo en la web de que ellos han contribuido con este
	proyecto, si así lo desean. Además de, el sentimiento de
	contribuir al cambio social ayudando a formarse y propagar la
	empatía.



	En
	Indiegogo han habido otras campañas relacionadas con la CNV. Para
	mi es la primera vez que inicio una campaña de recaudación de
	fondos.



	Lance
	la idea de recaudación de fondos al grupo de la Asociación para la
	Comunicación NoViolenta. Entonces, propusieron que fuera a través
	de una plataforma de crowdfunding. Después de estudiar su
	funcionamiento y viendo que finalmente el proyecto fue aceptado por
	la junta me volqué totalmente en realizar la campaña. Esta campaña
	es para todos. Y especialmente para los que simpatizan con la
	comunicación No violenta, de empatía, asertiva y positiva.



Riesgos
y desafíos


Las
personas que apoyan la campaña si finalmente no se alcanzara el
objetivo inicial la cantidad aportada puede ser devuelta a
elección del mecenas. Entendiendo bien que la devolución sería
por la cantidad aportada menos las comisiones de Indiegogo y PayPal. Pues Indiegogo no nos deja reembolsar a nuestros colaboradores una vez que se reciba la primera colaboración. Entonces esta devolución tendría que efectuarse en una transacción independiente.

O dichas cantidades pueden ser dirigidas a un fondo de becas en favor de las
personas que quieren hacer cursos organizados por la Asociación para
la Comunicación NoViolenta y no disponen de recursos para
pagarlos.
Otras
formas en las que puedes ayudar

Sabemos
que muchos de nosotros no podemos colaborar economicamente y que si
lo desean pueden ayudar difundiendo la campaña entre amigos,
familiares, etc.

O
en internet, en la plataforma de Indiegogo, facebook, twitter,
etc.

Y
ante todo, muchas gracias por leer y considerar esta
propuesta-campaña.

Un
fuerte abrazo.

David
Devesa

story:
Our Story

The Shang Shung Institute Australia is a branch of the International Shang Shung Institute and is a non-profit organisation dedicated to the preservation and study of Tibetan culture including Tibetan Medicine. 

The School of Tibetan Medicine within Shang Shung Institute Australia is planning to run a 4 year Tibetan Medicine course starting in 2016. This course will link into the four-year curriculum through the International SSI School of Tibetan Medicine with further study and intensives in Australia and we are simultaneously in the process of making this the first Tibetan Medicine Advanced Diploma recognised in the West.

To help get the course up and running, we are launching a crowd funding campaign to raise much needed funds to cover the costs of accreditation and administration. The crowd funding campaign will launch in August and we need lots of support to help make this happen. If you are interested, you might also consider joining our mailing list so we can keep you informed of the campaign progress, updates on course developments and news about upcoming Tibetan medicine and other Tibetan cultural events.


What We Need & What You Get 

We are seeking to raise $20,000 for the Project in order to cover costs for: 
1)  Payment for the creation of the first fully accredited qualification of Tibetan medicine in the western world: An Advanced Diploma of Tibetan Medicine. 
This is an incredible step in the history of Tibetan Medicine in Australia and the West in general. 
2) Any remaining funds to be put towards successful running, administration and development of the first course to be offered in Australia, including two intensives  in year one. 
The Perks offered for your kind support of this project include the below:


The Impact

Tibetan Medicine is an ancient and unique healing modality which has much to offer the world. In helping this project get off the ground you will not only be helping ensure the future of this wonderful healing tradition in Australia, but also creating the causes for future fully qualified Tibetan doctors to be trained and made available in this country; therefore directly helping increase the health and well being of Australians too!  
Core members  of our team have also been involved in the creation of the Australian Tibetan Medicine Association (ATMA) which founded in 2010.  Since that time it has run introductory courses in Tibetan Medicine with resident Dr Ani Nyidon, gained recognition and insurance cover for the practice of Tibetan Medicine, as well as beginning the creation of standards of practice for future practitioners. By supporting this campaign you will be directly helping the creation of the first ever fully accredited Tibetan Medicine course in the Western world.
 

Risks & Challenges

There are definite challenges in this process, including the slight chance that the accreditation process will not be successful or that we will not have enough interest for the course to go ahead in 2016. 

However, the ground work we have done, including the formation of ATMA, the establishment of insurance for qualified practitioners, the global support and interest as well as the very experienced team putting the accreditation together, means we can be confident of success. 
Your contributions and interest in Tibetan Medicine as well as the creation of accredited training here, will also make all the difference in this process. Working together we will be in the best possible position to grow the planted seeds of authentic and in-depth training of Tibetan Medicine in Australia.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please feel free to share this information using the Indiegogo share tools and any other networks you are able to Thank you so much for your help!
