story:
Grecia en crisis, 

Tras 4 años de aplicación del plan de "austeridad" propuesto por el FMI para rescatar a Grecia de la crisis, los resultados son:

1) Su PIB es inferior en 26% a aquel que registró en el 2007,
2) Las inversiones han caído en un 67%
3) La tasa de desempleo alcanza el 26%
4) 46% de la población vive en estado de pobreza según los estándares griegos de 2009, contra 19.9% en el 2009.
5) La mortalidad infantil aumento en un 43%
6) Mientras Bruselas anunciaba la recuperación económica griega para el 2013, ese año el PIB griego cayo 4.7%..

Del sistema económico mundial, el Consenso de Washington,  

De Término inicialmente acuñado por John Williamson para referirse a un conjunto de 10 políticas económicas que el consideró como el paquete "estándar" generalmente recetado a las "Naciones en desarrollo en situación de crisis" por parte de instituciones bajo gran influencia de Washington D.C. Si bien la segunda de estas 10 políticas sugería el gasto publico en subsidios en puntos clave para el desarrollo, servicios favorables para los pobres, educación, salud e infraestructura^1; la práctica histórica de dichas instituciones y su constante insistencia en tres ejes fundamentales, "privatización", "austeridad" y "desregulación", han conducido al uso general de la frase para referirse a políticas de libre mercado, de fundamentalismo de mercado, o simplemente de carácter neoliberal.

Joseph Stiglitz^2, explica: "Es un consenso formado entre calle 15 y la calle 19 en Washington entre miembros del Fondo Monetario Internacional (FMI), el Banco Mundial y el Departamento del Tesoro de los Estados Unidos. Argumentaba que las claves para el éxito en los países en vías de desarrollo eran 3 cosas: estabilidad-macro-económica, liberalización (reducción de las tarifas barrera^3 y regulación del mercado) y privatización"^4.

Por su parte la enciclopedia "bitannica"^5 explica el termino de la siguiente manera:  "un conjunto de prescripciones de políticas defendidas por economistas neoliberales para que los países en vías de desarrollo alcancen el crecimiento económico" y continua con la observación siguiente, "criticos del consenso de Whashington han argumentado que en la práctica tales políticas están siendo utilizadas por corporaciones de los países más ricos como los Estados Unidos para explotar a los trabajadores de países mas pobres. Esto no es de menor importancia - ya que activistas e investigadores por igual han remarcado- los mercados no son en realidad ni libres, ni justos. Por ejemplo, generosos subsidios pagados a los productores de algodón en los Estados Unidos y en la Unión Europea artificialmente conducen los precios a la baja, amenazando el sustento de campesinos africanos dedicados al algodón" para concluir de la forma siguiente: "Para muchos críticos el problema no es por lo tanto la liberación de los mercados per se, sino que los países más ricos están haciendo trampa en el juego que exportan al resto del mundo"^6.

Podemos entonces decir que el termino "consenso de Washington" hace referencia a un conjunto de prácticas y recomendaciones de carácter neoliberal, generalmente criticadas por ser consideradas por académicos y activistas como al útiles para la explotación de los trabajadores por parte de las grandes corporaciones e incluso, irrespetuosas del propio modelo económico que las impulsa y en el cual se respaldan y dirigidas a los países en vías de desarrollo; cuyos principales impulsores son el Banco Mundial, El Fondo Monetario Internacional y Departamento del Tesoro de los Estados Unidos, quienes suelen aparecer en la escena de los países en momentos de crisis...

*nexo

*nexo

*nexo

En los años 80s México fue el primer país en caer en la crisis de la deuda que llevó consecuentemente a la "crisis de la deuda latinoamericana", en aquel entonces y hasta hoy México ha adoptado las medicinas del FMI "privatización", "austeridad" y "reformas estructurales", con los excelentísimos resultados que ya todos conocemos, digo, quien no esta supuer, hiper, mega contento con la realidad económica de nuestro país tras casi 40 años de neoliberalismo?  Mismas politicas que se han impuesto a Grecia desde hace ya 4 años y cuya profundización rechazó el 5/07/2015 el pueblo soberano griego.

Objetivo real y llamado a la solidaridad Internacional “no condicionada” y libre de intereses.

En respuesta a la difícil situación del país heleno y a la lentitud de las negociaciones, "Thom Feeney" (ciudadano inglés), lanzó una campaña a través del sitio de Internet "Indiegogo" para juntar fondos ciudadanos para rescatar la cuna de la democracia, bajo una argumentación muy simple, "En Europa hay 503 millones de habitantes, bastaría con que cada uno donase 3 euros para rescatar al país". La campaña tuvo gran éxito (si se compara, en términos de fondos, con cualquier otra), logró juntar 1 930 577 euros. Desgraciadamente esta cantidad no representa mas que el 0.115% de requerido por Grecia para acceder al resto de los fondos ya acordados por el FMI sin tener que aceptar su intensificación de la austeridad.  

La idea de Feeney me pareció absolutamente genial y he decidido trabajar por un movimiento solidario internacional que permita la creación de una alternativa de financiamiento para los países que caen en crisis. El principio es muy, muy sencillo, para multiplicar los fondos es necesario multiplicar las campañas y los idiomas, propongo pues una campaña por país.

El impacto:

El objetivo no es pagar la deuda griega, sino crear un movimiento solidario internacional, que en caso de ser adoptado y volverse practica común podría convertirse en una alternativa ciudadana, solidaria, no-condicionada, libre intereses (donación) de financiamiento para os países que enfrenten la crisis. Esto podría revelarse verdaderamente útil tanto para México como para todos  aquellos países que mantengan relaciones con el fondo o que sean susceptibles de una crisis económica, recordemos pues la crisis latinoamericana de la deuda y consideremos el nivel de endeudamiento actual de los países latinoamericanos.

En ese sentido, quisiera invitar a mis conciudadanos mexicanos a colaborar con la promoción y difusión de esta campaña y solicitar de aquellos ciudadanos provenientes de otros países que lean este mensaje la creación de la campaña correspondiente en sus respectivos países y el compromiso de entregar los fondos recolectados al gobierno de Grecia.

Lo que obtienes:

El sistema que propongo es muy simple, a cambio de una donación pequeña se entregará a cada donador: copia en PDF del documento que será entregado al gobierno de Grecia (mensaje dirigido al pueblo heleno y de agradecimiento a los colaboradores solidarios) y que incluirá mención escrita de todos y cada uno de los donadores + Vídeo del momento de la entrega de los fondos y pronunciación del mensaje al pueblo heleno y del mensaje de agradecimiento con mención de nombre y apellido de todos los solidarios + anexos indicando la pagina y el minuto en el que el nombre de cada solidario es mencionado. 

Identificación del movimiento
En cuanto a la imagen que identifique el movimiento, propongo una mano extendiendo un billete en moneda nacional (dependerá del país de la campaña) con una bandera griega de fondo. Obviamente ya he comenzado a trabajar para tratar de multiplicar el fenómeno, considero que una rara combinación de nacionalismo y competencia podría incentivar las donaciones en todos los países.  

Quien propone?

Antes que nada, permitan-me agradecerles el tiempo que se han tomado para visitar y leer todo o parte de mi mensaje.

Mi nombre es Ricardo Castellanos Chávez, soy mexicano, tengo 27 años y he tenido la suerte de ser aceptado en el IEDES (Institut d'étude du développement économique et social) o "Instituto de Estudio del Desarrollo Económico y Social" de la universidad París 1 Panthéon Sorbonne, donde actualmente curso la maestría en "Expertise économique des politiques et projets de développement" o "Expertise económico en políticas y proyectos de desarrollo".

N.B. Traducciones propias.

story:
We are Huong Nguyen and Cuong Nguyen from Vietnam. We are currently second-year-students at Asian University for Women (AUW), Chittagong, Bangladesh.

Last year, we and other 5 students of AUW had come back Vietnam and did a summer project named “Promoting Well-being of Vietnamese Orphans: Changing Attitudes of Domestic Adoption and Initiating Mentorship Program in Vietnam,” which is advised by Associate Professor Dr. Sharon M. Flicker and sponsored by AUW.

The mentorship program is one of the important parts of our project. It has taken place on 12 blind children with 8 mentors at Huynh De Nhu Nghia Gratitude House from August 2014 till now, and it is going to officially end in August 2015. On 29th May, we had done an evaluation among all of our mentees to assess how the program has benefited them, and the result is very positive, you may click on this link: http://bit.ly/1UF8Q2u to see our summary from the evaluation.

P.1. Group activity of our mentors and mentees

Receiving those very positive results, we are strongly motivated to continue the mentorship program to help more disabled, abandoned and orphan children in Vietnam. To know more about the details of our mentorship program (background, aim, resources and training, activities and schedule), please click here: http://bit.ly/1Uk8y0E

This year, we are going to conduct our mentorship program at Ward 25 Binh Thanh District Gratitude Universal School at L3A, Lot J, Tan Cang Residential, Ward 25, Binh Thanh District, Hochiminh City, Vietnam. After our visit to the school and having a conversation with Mrs. Doan, who is the founder of this school, we realized that most of the students there are abandoned and orphan children. They are seriously lack of love, concern, and support from their family. Due to the lack of nurturing and educating, they have to frequently cope with many accumulative difficulties, and also face many risks and abuses in their own community. Therefore, we would like to continuously conduct the mentorship program this year at this school in order to connect those so-called vulnerable children with our mentors, who have positive perspectives and lifestyles, excellent social skills and also are full of humanity. Through the program, we want to enhance their psychosocial well-being, empower them, help to form their trust in community and develop their capabilities. Moreover, conducting this program we aim to raise awareness among the Vietnamese youth of effectively dealing with social issue existing within their own community.

P.2. Some students at the Ward 25 Binh Thanh District Gratitude Universal School (From: http://tuoitre.vn/tin/giao-duc/20090114/ngoi-truong-tu-can-nha-bo-hoang/297516.html )

Why should you donate?

- As a volunteering program, your support will definitely help us to maintain the program, which will benefit community in general and the children at Ward 25 Binh Thanh District Gratitude Universal School in particular. Therefore, your donation will allow you to indirectly contribute to the community.

- Most of our volunteers are university students, who still depend on the economic support from their own family, thus your donation not only helps to support them in term of economics but also plays a role as a motivation for our volunteers to keep their commitment with the program during an entire year.

- Your contribution enables us to organize more activities among mentors and mentees, which will contribute to the strong connection among all the members and decide the effectiveness of the program.  

Our goal is 3548$, to know more about how we are going to use this money, please kindly click here: http://bit.ly/1NRbJrF

How can you help?

1-  Donate: We appreciate every dollar, so contribute whatever you can. If 360 people donate just $10 each, we will reach our goal! All funding goes directly to the Mentorship Program in Vietnam 2015-2016 and we’ll be sure to update you on the project’s progress.

2-  Share: Help us reach our goal by sharing this fund raising message to any of your friends or sharing it on your Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, etc. with the hashtag #MentorshipProgramInVietnam.

***For any more information, please contact:

Email: apmpvietnam@gmail.com

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/apmpvietnam(Written in Vietnamese)

Phone No.: +84 166 372 2270 (Ms. Huong) or + 84 163 830 8385 (Ms. Cuong)

We'd like to sincerely thank you so much for scrolling all the way down!
story_txt:
We are Huong
Nguyen and Cuong Nguyen from Vietnam. We are currently second-year-students at
Asian University for Women (AUW), Chittagong, Bangladesh.
Last year, we
and other 5 students of AUW had come back Vietnam and did a summer project
named “Promoting
Well-being of Vietnamese Orphans: Changing Attitudes of Domestic Adoption and
Initiating Mentorship Program in Vietnam,” which is advised by Associate
Professor Dr. Sharon M. Flicker and sponsored by AUW. 
The mentorship program is one of the important parts of our
project. It has taken place on 12 blind children with 8 mentors at Huynh De Nhu Nghia Gratitude House from
August 2014 till now, and it is going to officially end in August 2015. On 29th
May, we had done an evaluation among all of our mentees to assess how the
program has benefited them, and the result is very positive, you may click on
this link: http://bit.ly/1UF8Q2u to see our summary from the
evaluation. 

P.1. Group
activity of our mentors and mentees
Receiving those very positive results, we are strongly motivated
to continue the mentorship program to help more disabled, abandoned and orphan
children in Vietnam. To know more about the details of our mentorship program (background,
aim, resources and training, activities and schedule), please click here: http://bit.ly/1Uk8y0E
This year, we are going to conduct our mentorship program at Ward 25 Binh Thanh District Gratitude Universal School at L3A, Lot J, Tan Cang
Residential, Ward 25, Binh Thanh District, Hochiminh City, Vietnam. After our
visit to the school and having a conversation with Mrs. Doan, who is the
founder of this school, we realized that most
of the students there are abandoned and orphan children. They are seriously
lack of love, concern, and support from their family. Due to the lack of
nurturing and educating, they have to frequently cope with many accumulative
difficulties, and also face many risks and abuses in their own community.
Therefore, we would like to continuously conduct the mentorship program this
year at this school in order to connect those so-called vulnerable children
with our mentors, who have positive perspectives and lifestyles, excellent
social skills and also are full of humanity. Through the program, we want to enhance
their psychosocial well-being, empower them, help to form their trust in
community and develop their capabilities. Moreover, conducting this program we aim
to raise awareness among the Vietnamese youth of effectively dealing with
social issue existing within their own community.P.2. Some
students at the Ward 25 Binh Thanh District Gratitude Universal School (From: http://tuoitre.vn/tin/giao-duc/20090114/ngoi-truong-tu-can-nha-bo-hoang/297516.html )

should you donate?

a volunteering program, your support will definitely help us to maintain the
program, which will benefit community in general and the children at Ward 25 Binh Thanh District Gratitude
Universal School in particular. Therefore, your donation will allow you to

story:
LA SITUACIÓN DE VIOLENCIA Y CAOS EN VENEZUELA  AFECTA A LOS NIÑOS ADOLESCENTES Y JÓVENES.

¿PORQUÉ PROTESTAN LOS ESTUDIANTES Y JÓVENES VENEZOLANOS?

 

Nuestro vídeo TU INDIFERENCIA NOS ESTÁ MATANDO, con más de 309.000 visitas, explica cual es la situación en Venezuela y cuales son las razones para que nuestra juventud, tome las calle y proteste.
El 12 de febrero de 2014, fue asesinado el estudiante venezolano Bassil Da Costa en una protesta estudiantil y eso fue el detonante para desatar una ola de violencia y criminalizar la protesta no solo de los estudiantes sino de cualquier ciudadano:
"Las manifestaciones y disturbios han dejado un saldo de 42 fallecidos (oficialistas, opositores, funcionarios de la Guardia Nacional Bolivariana entre otros), más de 486 heridos y 1854 detenidos, según informe de la Fiscalía General de la República,mientras el Foro Penal Venezolano (organización opositora al Gobierno de Maduro) denunció 33 supuestos casos de tortura". (Fuente Wikipedia)

THE SITUATION OF VIOLENCE AND CHAOS IN VENEZUELA AFFEECTS CHILDREAN AND TEENAGERS

WHY DO VENEZUELAN STUDENTS AND YOUNG PEOPLEPROTEST?


Our video YOUR INDIFFERENCE IS KILLING US, with over 309,000 visitors, which explains the situation in Venezuela and which are the reasons for our youth to take the street and protest.

On February 12, 2014, Bassil Da Costa a Venezuelan student waskilled in a student protest and that was the trigger to unleash a wave of violence and criminalize protest not only of students but of every citizen:

"Demonstrations and riots have left a toll of 42 deaths (ruling, opponents, officials of the National Guard and others), more than 486 injured and 1854 arrested, as reported by the Attorney General of the Republic, while the Venezuelan Penal Forum (opposition to the Government of Maduro organization) reported 33 suspected cases of torture. " (Source Wikipedia)

DE ACUERDO AL REPORTAJE DE NATALIA MATAMOROS, PUBLICADO EN EL DIARIO EL UNIVERSAL EL 13 % DE LOS ASESINATOS FUERON EJECUTADOS POR LAS FUERZAS POLICIALES.

jueves 26 de febrero de 2015 12:00 AM

"El asesinato de un estudiante de 14 años en Táchira a manos de un funcionario de la Policía Nacional Bolivariana durante una manifestación, además de conmocionar a la opinión pública, según directivos de Cecodap, pone en tela de juicio el uso proporcional de la fuerza policial con la utilización de armas letales en protestas callejeras.

De acuerdo con un informe estadístico que maneja la referida organización de los 912 niños y adolescentes asesinados en el país durante el año pasado, 126 de los homicidios fueron perpetrados por efectivos policiales y castrenses, lo que representa 13,8% del total de los asesinatos reportados.

El 80% de las muertes a manos de efectivos fueron producto enfrentamientos policiales, mientras que el 20% restante respondió a ajusticiamientos. 

Fernando Pereira, coordinador general de la referida organización, destacó que el número de casos de jóvenes muertos por esta causa experimentó un incremento 55,5%, respecto a 2013 cuando hubo 70. Estos datos se desprenden de una investigación hemerográfica que implicó la consulta de 43 medios impresos, tanto de circulación nacional y regional. 

"Urge someter a revisión la resolución del Ministerio de la Defensa sobre el uso de armas mortales en manifestaciones. Los funcionarios de seguridad deberían usar el diálogo para dirimir conflictos. Lo ocurrido en San Cristóbal con el joven de 14 años fue abuso de poder. El efectivo actuó con saña contra el muchacho", dijo el experto en materia de derechos de niños y adolescentes.

Por su parte, la investigadora Carla Villamedina indicó que en promedio se registran 76 muertes al mes de menores de edad en el país, un aproximado de dos asesinatos por día. 

La mayoría de las muertes violentas se producen en medio de discusiones, en enfrentamientos a mano armada sostenidos con otros grupos de jóvenes o policías, por resistencia al robo y en un menor grado en el aula de clases. 

También hay muchachos que fallecieron al quedar atrapados en la línea de fuego en tiroteos suscitados entre bandas rivales de una zona. 

El estado Anzoátegui es el que reporta el mayor número de decesos violentos de jóvenes al contabilizar el año pasado 411. Seguido por Miranda que sumó 377 y Carabobo con 295. El 89% de las víctimas de estos crímenes son varones con edades comprendidas entre 13 y 17 años. 

Pereira insistió en la necesidad de que se aplique un plan nacional de protección para los menores de 18 años. 

Además de reforzar el desarme de la población y la puesta en marcha de programas de atención destinados a víctimas y a sus familiares, así como a los agresores. 

También habló de formar a funcionarios policiales sobre el trato que le deben dar a los jóvenes" 

TO THE REPORT OF NATALIA MATAMOROS, published in the newspaper El Universal that 13% of the murders were executed by the police.

Thursday February 26, 2015 12:00 AM

"The murder of a 14 year old student in Tachira in the hands of an official of the Bolivarian National Police during a demonstration in addition to shock public opinion, according to executives Cecodap, puts into question the proportionate use of police force by the use of lethal weapons in street protests.

According to a statistical report that handles such organization of 912 children and adolescents murdered in the country last year, 126 homicides were committed by police and military personnel, which represents 13.8% of all murders reported.

80% of the killings were the result of effective police confrontations, while the remaining 20% ​​responded to executions.

Fernando Pereira, general coordinator of that organization, said that the number of cases of deaths of young people from this cause experienced a 55.5% increase, compared to 2013 when there were only 70. Data obtained from an investigation that involved hemerographic consulting 43 printed media, both national and regional newspapers.

“We have an urge for a review of the decision of the Ministry of Defense on the use of lethal weapons in demonstrations. Security officials should use dialogue to resolve conflicts. What happened in San Cristobal to the 14 year old student was abuse of power. The officer acted viciously against the boy, "said the expert on the rights of children and adolescents.

Theresearcher Carla Villamedinasays thatthere isan average of 76 deaths a month of minors in the country, an estimated two murders per day.

The majority of violent deaths occur in the middle of discussions, held at gunpoint confrontations with other youth groups or police, resistance to theft and a less amount in the classroom.

There are also boys who died when they were trapped in the line of fire in gunfights between rival gangs of different zones.

Anzoategui state is reporting the highest number of violent deaths of young people the last year 411 followed by Miranda who scored 377 and Carabobo 295.The 89% of the victims of these crimes are boys aged between 13 and 17 years.

Pereira called out for the need of a national plan of protection for children under 18.

In addition to strengthening the disarmament of the population and the implementation of care programs for victims and their families, as well as the aggressors.

He also spoke to train police officers on the treatment that must be given to young people "

¿QUE HACER? ¿CÓMO ORGANIZARNOS PARA CONSTRUIR LA PAZ?
Ante la gravedad de la situación planteada -tal como lo expresa la madre y estudiante venezolana en el vídeo - la indiferencia y apatía de una inmensa mayoría de los venezolanos, ante el temor de ser reprimidos de manera directa o indirecta como por ejemplo ser despedidos de un empleo público, las madres, abuelas y jóvenes que practicamos Yoga, nos organizamos para apoyar a los Estudiantes y jóvenes en defensa de los Derechos Humanos, mediante campañas a través de las Redes Sociales, pero además nos organizamos en un plataforma digital, para llevar la práctica de Yoga a las comunidades  en todos rincones de Venezuela mediante asociaciones estratégicas, con todos los instructores, profesores, maestros de Yoga, escuelas, promoviendo cualquier tipo de evento, como Talleres, Encuentros, Retiros, Conferencias y recientemente participamos en el Día Internacional del Yoga.

WHAT TO DO? HOW TO ORGANIZE TO BUILD PEACE?

Given the seriousness of the situation -such as expressed by the mother and Venezuelan student in the video - the indifference and apathy of the vast majority of Venezuelans, for fear of being repressed directly or indirectly such as being laid off public employment, mothers, grandmothers and young people who practice Yoga, we organize to support students and young people in defense of Human Rights, through campaigns through social networks, but also we organize on a digital platform to bring Yoga practice communities in all corners of Venezuela through strategic partnerships with all instructors, teachers, Yoga teachers, schools, promoting all kinds of events, including workshops, meetings, retreats, conferences and recently participated in the International Day Yoga.

¿QUE ES YogaLibre? 
UNA RESPUESTA HECHA EN FORMA DE PROPUESTA A LO EXPRESADO EN NUESTRO VÍDEO "TU INDIFERENCIA NOS ESTÁ MATANDO"
Así ante la indiferencia de la gente, hemos propuesto un Modelo de Organización Comunitaria presencial y Virtual que funciona como una Revista Virtual para la enseñanza y el aprendizaje del Yoga en Venezuela y de la FOTOGRAFÍA, como herramienta para investigación aplicada.
De allí que comenzamos a organizar y apoyar eventos en los lugares más bellos de Venezuela, tanto en la Montaña como en el la costa del Caribe comenzando por nuestro Cerro Ávila, Choriní, Chuao, Uricao, Mérida, Barquisimeto y la Gran Sabana.
En el mes de julio del 2015, nos robaron nuestro equipo de trabajo, cámaras, Memorias, celulares a mi persona y 3 compañeros más en el Cerro el Ávila a la altura de Piedra del Indio, en donde fuimos a realizar una sesión fotográfica  de Acro-Yoga y fue entonces cuando, elaborando IDEAS para avanzar en nuestro proyecto, decidimos contar nuestra historia y presentar nuestro PROYECTO, el cual de Revista Virtual queremos ademas hacer una edición de libros para la enseñanza de yoga con nuestros mejores maestros que nos han apoyado en todas nuestras actividades.
Nuestras campaña va dirigida a todos los venezolanos que viven exiliados en el exterior por razones políticas y económicas, así como a la comunidad de yoguines, yoguinas y activistas por La Paz. 

WHAT IS YogaLibre?

A PROPOSAL MADE IN THE FORM OF RESPONSE TO WHAT IS EXPRESSED IN OUR VIDEO "YOUR INDIFFERENCE IS KILLING US"

So to the indifference of the people, we have proposed a model and virtual community organization that functions as an online magazine for teaching and learning Yoga in Venezuela and of photography as a tool for applied research.

From there we began to organize and support events in the most beautiful places in Venezuela, both in the mountains and on the Caribbean coast starting from Cerro Avila, Chorini, Chuao, Uricao, Merida, Barquisimeto and the Gran Sabana.

In July 2015, they stole our teams work equipment, cameras, memories, my and 3 more other parthners  mobile telephone in the Cerro Avila atPiedra del Indio, where we went to do a photo session ofAcro -Yoga and that was when, developing ideas to advance our project, we decided to tell our story and present our project, which we would like to make as wellas a Virtual Magazine also  an edition of books for teaching yoga with our best teachers who have supported us in all our activities.

Our campaign is aimed at all Venezuelan exiles living abroad for political and economic reasons as well as to the community of yogis, yoguinas and peace activists.

YOGA Y ARTE COMO HERRAMIENTAS PARA CONSTRUIR LA PAZ
Para nosotros los venezolanos que resistimos día a día la situación de violencia, escasez de alimentos y medicinas, y pésima prestación de los servicios públicos básicos como transporte, salud y educación y que no podemos viajar al exterior a perfeccionar nuestros conocimientos para mejorar la calidad de la Práctica de Yoga en Venezuela, es necesario, difundir NUESTRO PROYECTO porque a pesar de todas las dificultades, somos capaces de encontrar en el camino del Yoga y el Arte extraordinarias herramientas, para organizar a la gente en función de construir la paz cada día de nuestra existencia, para que nunca más los niños, jóvenes y adolescentes sean asesinados salvajemente.

YOGA AND ART AS A TOOL TO BUILD PEACE

For us Venezuelans that have to resist every day the violence, shortages of food and medicine, and terrible public services such as transport, health and education and can not travel abroad to improve our knowledge and quality of Yoga practice in Venezuela, it is necessary to spread our project because despite all the difficulties, we are able to find in the way of Yoga and Artextraordinary tools to organize people in order to build peace every day of our existence, so never again  children, youth and adolescents are savagely murdered.


PORQUÉ ES IMPORTANTE TU PARTICIPACIÓN Y APOYO

Si cada uno de los venezolanos que vive en el exterior se activa y con tan solo un pequeño aporte, que le será debidamente retribuido mediante nuestras fotografías impresas, así como franelas y pop, sentirá que ese pequeño gesto, unido a miles de otros, se transformará en una gran acción que beneficiará a cientos de miles de niños que viven en las poblaciones mas empobrecidas de nuestra amada Venezuela y para ello éste es el segundo años en que a partir del 20 de Agosto de 2015  estaremos dictando los TALLERES DE fotografía y YOGA PARA NIÑOS EN LA COMUNIDAD DE MANA KRU EN LA GRAN SABANA.

WHY YOUR PARTICIPATION IS IMPORTANT AND SUPPORT

If individual Venezuelans living abroad are active and with only a small contribution, which will be duly paid through our printed photographs T-shirts and pop, you will feel that this small gesture, together with thousands of others,  will transform into a big action that will benefit hundreds of thousands of children living in the most impoverished populations of our beloved Venezuela and for that this is the second year that from August 20, 2015 will be dictating the photography workshops and YOGA FOR CHILDREN IN THE COMMUNITY OF MANA KRU IN THE GRAN SABANA

What we need and what you get

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

FINANCIAMIENTO:

EL PROYECTO TIENE UN COSTO DE 50.000 $ POR AÑO

- Ese dinero será invertido en:

1.- Compra de equipos de Fotografía y Vídeos sus accesorios, juego de luces por cuanto nos robaron nuestros equipos.

2.- Equipos de de computación para la edición , almacenamiento,  proyección de vídeos y pantalla.

3.-  Adquisición de equipos de montañismo: Carpas, aislantes, sliping bag, bastones, linternas, equipos de primeros auxilios, equipos de comunicación.

4.-Un vehículo rústico para movilizarnos hacia las zonas indígenas, de la Guajira, Gran Sabana, Delta Amacuro.

FINANCING:

The project cost $ 50,000 per year

- That money will be invested in:

1. Purchase of Photography, video equipmentand a set of professional lights because our equipment was stolen.

2. Computer editing equipment, storage, video and projection screen.

3. Acquisition of mountaineering equipment: tents, insulating, slipping bag, walking sticks, flashlights, first aid kits, communication equipment.

4. A jeep to mobilize us to the indigenous areas of Guajira, Gran Sabana and Delta Amacuro.


RECOMPENSAS:

DE ACUERDO AL APORTE LE ENVIAMOS FOTOGRAFÍAS SOBRE PAISAJES DE DE VENEZUELA

1.- Pequeño formato

2.- Mediano Formato

3.- Gran formato

TODOS LOS FONDOS SERÁN PARA YogaLibre, si no logramos la meta total, compraremos los equipos hasta donde nos alcance y si no alcanza realizaremos otras actividades y eventos para completar ese monto.


El impacto

Nuestro proyecto está dirigido a los niños, adolescentes y jóvenes, porque en la medida que ellos aprendan, van a ser multiplicadores y llevaran la Practica a sus hogares y a la comunidad, lo cual nos permitirá en mucho poco tiempo por el efecto mariposa, organizar rápidamente cientos de miles de comunidades y crear mayores espacios para la Paz en Venezuela.

Consideramos que el proyecto es de suma importancia para crear modelos de organización social tanto virtuales, a través de las Redes Sociales, como presenciales en donde cada ciudadano se sienta que está siendo un agente , un líder, un protagonista del cambio social en su país, porque esa es su responsabilidad, crear mejores condiciones, para que sus hijos y nietos puedan crecer en Paz.

Nosotros hemos realizados y participado en varios proyectos:

1.- Los Niños descubren los senderos del Ávila, sobre montañismo.

2.- Enseñanza del Juego de Go en escuela para niños sordos.

3.- Todas nuestras actividades de Yoga y otros deportes al aire libre son registradas mediante fotografías y vídeos.


REWARDS:

FOR YOUR CONTRIBUTION WE WILL SEND YOU PHOTOGRAPHS OF LANDSCAPES ON VENEZUELA

1. Small Format

2. Medium Format

3. Large Format

ALL FUNDS WILL BE FOR YOGA LIBRE, if we fail to achieve our final goal for buying the necessary equipment, we will purchase as much as possible,  if it is not enough then we will organize other activities and events to complete that amount.

The impact

Our project is aimed at children and young people, because as they learn, they will be multipliers and carry the Practice to their homes and to their communities, which will allow us in a short time by the butterfly effect, organize quickly hundreds of thousands of communities and create more space for Peace in Venezuela.

We believe that the project is of utmost importance to create virtual models of both social organization, through social networks, and face where every citizen feels that they are an agent, a leader, a hero of a social change in their country, because that is their responsibility, creating better conditions so their children and grandchildren can grow up in peace.

We have made and participated in several projects:

1. Children discover the paths of Avila, on mountaineering.

2. Teaching GO GAME in schools for deaf children.

3. All our activities of Yoga and other outdoor sports are registered by photography and vídeos

Riesgos y desafíos

Si te cansas, descansas. Si te caes te levantas. Si dejas de existir, tus alumnos siguen... !Juntos nada es imposible! Los obstáculos están para enfrentarlos y continuar, hasta ver a nuestro país Libre y en Paz

El Proyecto se desarrolla en 3 etapas: 1) Adquisición de equipos de Fotografía 2) Adquisición de equipos de Montañismo 3) La Adquisición del vehículo, para el traslado de insumos, materiales, equipos, organizadores; los participantes se trasladan en vehículo propio o transporte Público, por ello todo los aportes, serán dedicados a la compra de esos equipo, si no se recoge la totalidad.

Risks and Challenges

If you get tired, rest. If you fall you get up. If you stop existing then your students will continue...! Together, nothing is impossible! The obstacles are there to face them and continue until we see our country free and at peace.

The Project is developed in 3 stages: 1) Acquisition of Photography equipment 2) Acquisition of Mountaineering equipment 3) Acquisition of a vehicle to transport supplies, materials, equipment, organizers; Participants transport themselves in their own cars or public transport. So all contributions will be used to purchase such equipment, if all is not collected.


Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Algunas personas no pueden colaborar, pero eso no significa que no puedan ayudar:

Les agradecemos a todos nuestros amigos difundir nuestra campaña, porque sus contribuciones son muy importantes para que la enseñanza y el camino de Yoga llegue a los niños y adolescentes de toda Venezuela; así mismo invitar a sus amigos hacer eco de nuestro proyecto y les recordamos que pueden usar las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo.

!Mil gracias a todos por sus aportes y colaboración!

Other ways you can help:

Some people cannotcontribute but that does not mean they cannot help:

We thank all our friends to spread our campaign, because your contributions are very important for teaching the Path of Yoga and reaching children and adolescents of all over Venezuela; also invite your friends to make echo of our project and remind them that they can use the tools to share Indiegogo.

! Thank you all for your contributions and collaboration!

!Namaste! Union Love Peace and Fredom from Venezuela

!YOGA ES RESISTENCIA!

DE ACUERDO AL REPORTAJE DE NATALIA MATAMOROS, PUBLICADO EN EL DIARIO EL UNIVERSAL EL 13 % DE LOS ASESINATOS FUERON EJECUTADOS POR LAS FUERZAS POLICIALES.
jueves 26 de febrero de 2015 12:00 AM

"El asesinato de un estudiante de 14 años en Táchira a manos de un funcionario de la Policía Nacional Bolivariana durante una manifestación, además de conmocionar a la opinión pública, según directivos de Cecodap, pone en tela de juicio el uso proporcional de la fuerza policial con la utilización de armas letales en protestas callejeras.De acuerdo con un informe estadístico que maneja la referida organización de los 912 niños y adolescentes asesinados en el país durante el año pasado, 126 de los homicidios fueron perpetrados por efectivos policiales y castrenses, lo que representa 13,8% del total de los asesinatos reportados.El 80% de las muertes a manos de efectivos fueron producto enfrentamientos policiales, mientras que el 20% restante respondió a ajusticiamientos. Fernando Pereira, coordinador general de la referida organización, destacó que el número de casos de jóvenes muertos por esta causa experimentó un incremento 55,5%, respecto a 2013 cuando hubo 70. Estos datos se desprenden de una investigación hemerográfica que implicó la consulta de 43 medios impresos, tanto de circulación nacional y regional. "Urge someter a revisión la resolución del Ministerio de la Defensa sobre el uso de armas mortales en manifestaciones. Los funcionarios de seguridad deberían usar el diálogo para dirimir conflictos. Lo ocurrido en San Cristóbal con el joven de 14 años fue abuso de poder. El efectivo actuó con saña contra el muchacho", dijo el experto en materia de derechos de niños y adolescentes.Por su parte, la investigadora Carla Villamedina indicó que en promedio se registran 76 muertes al mes de menores de edad en el país, un aproximado de dos asesinatos por día. La mayoría de las muertes violentas se producen en medio de discusiones, en enfrentamientos a mano armada sostenidos con otros grupos de jóvenes o policías, por resistencia al robo y en un menor grado en el aula de clases. También hay muchachos que fallecieron al quedar atrapados en la línea de fuego en tiroteos suscitados entre bandas rivales de una zona. El estado Anzoátegui es el que reporta el mayor número de decesos violentos de jóvenes al contabilizar el año pasado 411. Seguido por Miranda que sumó 377 y Carabobo con 295. El 89% de las víctimas de estos crímenes son varones con edades comprendidas entre 13 y 17 años. Pereira insistió en la necesidad de que se aplique un plan nacional de protección para los menores de 18 años. Además de reforzar el desarme de la población y la puesta en marcha de programas de atención destinados a víctimas y a sus familiares, así como a los agresores. También habló de formar a funcionarios policiales sobre el trato que le deben dar a los jóvenes" 

TO THE
REPORT OF NATALIA MATAMOROS, published in the newspaper El Universal that 13%
of the murders were executed by the police.
Thursday
February 26, 2015 12:00 AM
"The
murder of a 14 year old student in Tachira in the hands of an official of the
Bolivarian National Police during a demonstration in addition to shock public
opinion, according to executives Cecodap, puts into question the proportionate
use of police force by the use of lethal weapons in street protests.
According
to a statistical report that handles such organization of 912 children and
adolescents murdered in the country last year, 126 homicides were committed by
police and military personnel, which represents 13.8% of all murders reported.
80% of the
killings were the result of effective police confrontations, while the
remaining 20% ​​responded to executions.
Fernando
Pereira, general coordinator of that organization, said that the number of
cases of deaths of young people from this cause experienced a 55.5% increase,
compared to 2013 when there were only 70. Data obtained from an investigation
that involved hemerographic consulting 43 printed media, both national and
regional newspapers.
“We have an
urge for a review of the decision of the Ministry of Defense on the use of
lethal weapons in demonstrations. Security officials should use dialogue to
resolve conflicts. What happened in San Cristobal to the 14 year old student
was abuse of power. The officer acted viciously against the boy, "said the
expert on the rights of children and adolescents.
Theresearcher
Carla Villamedinasays thatthere isan average of 76 deaths a month of minors in
the country, an estimated two murders per day.
The
majority of violent deaths occur in the middle of discussions, held at gunpoint
confrontations with other youth groups or police, resistance to theft and a
less amount in the classroom.
There are
also boys who died when they were trapped in the line of fire in gunfights
between rival gangs of different zones.
Anzoategui
state is reporting the highest number of violent deaths of young people the
last year 411 followed by Miranda who scored 377 and Carabobo 295.The 89% of
the victims of these crimes are boys aged between 13 and 17 years.
Pereira called
out for the need of a national plan of protection for children under 18.
In addition
to strengthening the disarmament of the population and the implementation of
care programs for victims and their families, as well as the aggressors.
He also
spoke to train police officers on the treatment that must be given to young
people "
¿QUE HACER? ¿CÓMO ORGANIZARNOS PARA CONSTRUIR LA PAZ?
Ante la gravedad de la situación planteada -tal como lo expresa la madre y estudiante venezolana en el vídeo - la indiferencia y apatía de una inmensa mayoría de los venezolanos, ante el temor de ser reprimidos de manera directa o indirecta como por ejemplo ser despedidos de un empleo público, las madres, abuelas y jóvenes que practicamos Yoga, nos organizamos para apoyar a los Estudiantes y jóvenes en defensa de los Derechos Humanos, mediante campañas a través de las Redes Sociales, pero además nos organizamos en un plataforma digital, para llevar la práctica de Yoga a las comunidades  en todos rincones de Venezuela mediante asociaciones estratégicas, con todos los instructores, profesores, maestros de Yoga, escuelas, promoviendo cualquier tipo de evento, como Talleres, Encuentros, Retiros, Conferencias y recientemente participamos en el Día Internacional del Yoga.

WHAT TO DO?
HOW TO ORGANIZE TO BUILD PEACE?
Given the
seriousness of the situation -such as expressed by the mother and Venezuelan
student in the video - the indifference and apathy of the vast majority of
Venezuelans, for fear of being repressed directly or indirectly such as being
laid off public employment, mothers, grandmothers and young people who practice
Yoga, we organize to support students and young people in defense of Human
Rights, through campaigns through social networks, but also we organize on a
digital platform to bring Yoga practice communities in all corners of Venezuela
through strategic partnerships with all instructors, teachers, Yoga teachers,
schools, promoting all kinds of events, including workshops, meetings,
retreats, conferences and recently participated in the International Day Yoga.

¿QUE ES YogaLibre? 
UNA RESPUESTA HECHA EN FORMA DE PROPUESTA A LO EXPRESADO EN NUESTRO VÍDEO "TU INDIFERENCIA NOS ESTÁ MATANDO"
Así ante la indiferencia de la gente, hemos propuesto un Modelo de Organización Comunitaria presencial y Virtual que funciona como una Revista Virtual para la enseñanza y el aprendizaje del Yoga en Venezuela y de la FOTOGRAFÍA, como herramienta para investigación aplicada.
De allí que comenzamos a organizar y apoyar eventos en los lugares más bellos de Venezuela, tanto en la Montaña como en el la costa del Caribe comenzando por nuestro Cerro Ávila, Choriní, Chuao, Uricao, Mérida, Barquisimeto y la Gran Sabana.
En el mes de julio del 2015, nos robaron nuestro equipo de trabajo, cámaras, Memorias, celulares a mi persona y 3 compañeros más en el Cerro el Ávila a la altura de Piedra del Indio, en donde fuimos a realizar una sesión fotográfica  de Acro-Yoga y fue entonces cuando, elaborando IDEAS para avanzar en nuestro proyecto, decidimos contar nuestra historia y presentar nuestro PROYECTO, el cual de Revista Virtual queremos ademas hacer una edición de libros para la enseñanza de yoga con nuestros mejores maestros que nos han apoyado en todas nuestras actividades.
Nuestras campaña va dirigida a todos los venezolanos que viven exiliados en el exterior por razones políticas y económicas, así como a la comunidad de yoguines, yoguinas y activistas por La Paz. 

WHAT IS
YogaLibre?
A PROPOSAL
MADE IN THE FORM OF RESPONSE TO WHAT IS EXPRESSED IN OUR VIDEO "YOUR
INDIFFERENCE IS KILLING US"
So to the
indifference of the people, we have proposed a model and virtual community
organization that functions as an online magazine for teaching and learning
Yoga in Venezuela and of photography as a tool for applied research.
From there
we began to organize and support events in the most beautiful places in
Venezuela, both in the mountains and on the Caribbean coast starting from Cerro
Avila, Chorini, Chuao, Uricao, Merida, Barquisimeto and the Gran Sabana.
In July
2015, they stole our teams work equipment, cameras, memories, my and 3 more
other parthners  mobile telephone in the
Cerro Avila atPiedra del Indio, where we went to do a photo session ofAcro
-Yoga and that was when, developing ideas to advance our project, we decided to
tell our story and present our project, which we would like to make as wellas a
Virtual Magazine also  an edition of books
for teaching yoga with our best teachers who have supported us in all our
activities.
Our
campaign is aimed at all Venezuelan exiles living abroad for political and
economic reasons as well as to the community of yogis, yoguinas and peace
activists.

YOGA Y ARTE COMO HERRAMIENTAS PARA CONSTRUIR LA PAZ
Para nosotros los venezolanos que resistimos día a día la situación de violencia, escasez de alimentos y medicinas, y pésima prestación de los servicios públicos básicos como transporte, salud y educación y que no podemos viajar al exterior a perfeccionar nuestros conocimientos para mejorar la calidad de la Práctica de Yoga en Venezuela, es necesario, difundir NUESTRO PROYECTO porque a pesar de todas las dificultades, somos capaces de encontrar en el camino del Yoga y el Arte extraordinarias herramientas, para organizar a la gente en función de construir la paz cada día de nuestra existencia, para que nunca más los niños, jóvenes y adolescentes sean asesinados salvajemente.

YOGA AND ART AS A TOOL TO BUILD PEACE
For us Venezuelans that have to resist every day the violence, shortages of food and medicine, and terrible public services such as transport, health and education and can not travel abroad to improve our knowledge and quality of Yoga practice in Venezuela, it is necessary to spread our project because despite all the difficulties, we are able to find in the way of Yoga and Artextraordinary tools to organize people in order to build peace every day of our existence, so never again  children, youth and adolescents are savagely murdered.


PORQUÉ ES IMPORTANTE TU PARTICIPACIÓN Y APOYO
Si cada uno de los venezolanos que vive en el exterior se activa y con tan solo un pequeño aporte, que le será debidamente retribuido mediante nuestras fotografías impresas, así como franelas y pop, sentirá que ese pequeño gesto, unido a miles de otros, se transformará en una gran acción que beneficiará a cientos de miles de niños que viven en las poblaciones mas empobrecidas de nuestra amada Venezuela y para ello éste es el segundo años en que a partir del 20 de Agosto de 2015  estaremos dictando los TALLERES DE fotografía y YOGA PARA NIÑOS EN LA COMUNIDAD DE MANA KRU EN LA GRAN SABANA.




WHY YOUR
PARTICIPATION IS IMPORTANT AND SUPPORT
If
individual Venezuelans living abroad are active and with only a small
contribution, which will be duly paid through our printed photographs T-shirts
and pop, you will feel that this small gesture, together with thousands of
others,  will transform into a big action
that will benefit hundreds of thousands of children living in the most
impoverished populations of our beloved Venezuela and for that this is the
second year that from August 20, 2015 will be dictating the photography
workshops and YOGA FOR CHILDREN IN THE COMMUNITY OF MANA KRU IN THE GRAN SABANA
What we
need and what you get
   Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes FINANCIAMIENTO:
EL PROYECTO TIENE UN COSTO DE 50.000 $ POR AÑO
- Ese dinero será invertido en:
1.- Compra de equipos de Fotografía y Vídeos sus accesorios, juego de luces por cuanto nos robaron nuestros equipos.
2.- Equipos de de computación para la edición , almacenamiento,  proyección de vídeos y pantalla.
3.-  Adquisición de equipos de montañismo: Carpas, aislantes, sliping bag, bastones, linternas, equipos de primeros auxilios, equipos de comunicación.
4.-Un vehículo rústico para movilizarnos hacia las zonas indígenas, de la Guajira, Gran Sabana, Delta Amacuro.


FINANCING:
The project
cost $ 50,000 per year
- That money
will be invested in:
1. Purchase
of Photography, video equipmentand a set of professional lights because our
equipment was stolen.
2. Computer
editing equipment, storage, video and projection screen.
3.
Acquisition of mountaineering equipment: tents, insulating, slipping bag,
walking sticks, flashlights, first aid kits, communication equipment.
4. A jeep
to mobilize us to the indigenous areas of Guajira, Gran Sabana and Delta
Amacuro.

RECOMPENSAS:
DE ACUERDO AL APORTE LE ENVIAMOS FOTOGRAFÍAS SOBRE PAISAJES DE DE VENEZUELA
1.- Pequeño formato
2.- Mediano Formato
3.- Gran formato
TODOS LOS FONDOS SERÁN PARA YogaLibre, si no logramos la meta total, compraremos los equipos hasta donde nos alcance y si no alcanza realizaremos otras actividades y eventos para completar ese monto.

    El impacto
Nuestro proyecto está dirigido a los niños, adolescentes y jóvenes, porque en la medida que ellos aprendan, van a ser multiplicadores y llevaran la Practica a sus hogares y a la comunidad, lo cual nos permitirá en mucho poco tiempo por el efecto mariposa, organizar rápidamente cientos de miles de comunidades y crear mayores espacios para la Paz en Venezuela.
Consideramos que el proyecto es de suma importancia para crear modelos de organización social tanto virtuales, a través de las Redes Sociales, como presenciales en donde cada ciudadano se sienta que está siendo un agente , un líder, un protagonista del cambio social en su país, porque esa es su responsabilidad, crear mejores condiciones, para que sus hijos y nietos puedan crecer en Paz.
Nosotros hemos realizados y participado en varios proyectos:
1.- Los Niños descubren los senderos del Ávila, sobre montañismo.
2.- Enseñanza del Juego de Go en escuela para niños sordos.
3.- Todas nuestras actividades de Yoga y otros deportes al aire libre son registradas mediante fotografías y vídeos.


REWARDS:

FOR YOUR
CONTRIBUTION WE WILL SEND YOU PHOTOGRAPHS OF LANDSCAPES ON VENEZUELA

1. Small
Format
2. Medium
Format
3. Large
Format
ALL FUNDS WILL
BE FOR YOGA LIBRE, if we fail to achieve our final goal for buying the
necessary equipment, we will purchase as much as possible,  if it is not enough then we will organize
other activities and events to complete that amount.
The impact
Our project
is aimed at children and young people, because as they learn, they will be
multipliers and carry the Practice to their homes and to their communities, which
will allow us in a short time by the butterfly effect, organize quickly
hundreds of thousands of communities and create more space for Peace in
Venezuela.
We believe
that the project is of utmost importance to create virtual models of both
social organization, through social networks, and face where every citizen
feels that they are an agent, a leader, a hero of a social change in their
country, because that is their responsibility, creating better conditions so
their children and grandchildren can grow up in peace.
We have
made and participated in several projects:
1. Children
discover the paths of Avila, on mountaineering.
2. Teaching
GO GAME in schools for deaf children.
3. All our
activities of Yoga and other outdoor sports are registered by photography and
vídeos
    Riesgos y desafíos
Si te cansas, descansas. Si te caes te levantas. Si dejas de existir, tus alumnos siguen... !Juntos nada es imposible! Los obstáculos están para enfrentarlos y continuar, hasta ver a nuestro país Libre y en Paz El Proyecto se desarrolla en 3 etapas: 1) Adquisición de equipos de Fotografía 2) Adquisición de equipos de Montañismo 3) La Adquisición del vehículo, para el traslado de insumos, materiales, equipos, organizadores; los participantes se trasladan en vehículo propio o transporte Público, por ello todo los aportes, serán dedicados a la compra de esos equipo, si no se recoge la totalidad.

Risks and
Challenges
If you get
tired, rest. If you fall you get up. If you stop existing then your students will
continue...! Together, nothing is impossible! The obstacles are there to face
them and continue until we see our country free and at peace.
The Project
is developed in 3 stages: 1) Acquisition of Photography equipment 2)
Acquisition of Mountaineering equipment 3) Acquisition of a vehicle to
transport supplies, materials, equipment, organizers; Participants transport
themselves in their own cars or public transport. So all contributions will be used
to purchase such equipment, if all is not collected.

    Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar  Algunas personas no pueden colaborar, pero eso no significa que no puedan ayudar: 
Les agradecemos a todos nuestros amigos difundir nuestra campaña, porque sus contribuciones son muy importantes para que la enseñanza y el camino de Yoga llegue a los niños y adolescentes de toda Venezuela; así mismo invitar a sus amigos hacer eco de nuestro proyecto y les recordamos que pueden usar las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo.
!Mil gracias a todos por sus aportes y colaboración!

Other ways
you can help:
Some people cannotcontribute
but that does not mean they cannot help:
We thank
all our friends to spread our campaign, because your contributions are very
important for teaching the Path of Yoga and reaching children and adolescents of
all over Venezuela; also invite your friends to make echo of our project and
remind them that they can use the tools to share Indiegogo.
! Thank you
all for your contributions and collaboration!
!Namaste! Union Love Peace and Fredom from Venezuela
!YOGA ES RESISTENCIA!

story:
Dear friends, supporters and donors,

My name is Lavinia Marin and at the end of June I took one of the best decisions of my life. I let myself out of the media as a journalist, in order to engage myself in teaching Yoga for Children. I consider this work the best way to take care of my community and the well-being of the future generations.

Last year, in October, with the support of a dear friend of mine, I succesfully followed a teacher training program in Yoga for Children. This made me give up the perspective of having a job in a stressful and unhealthy pressure at a tv broadcasting, with a very hardwork in late evenings. After my contract ended there at the end of June, I received 2 other offers to work in the same area - online massmedia. But I stood up to my decision of no longer working in this field and kindly refused those offers - because I sincerely feel that I should give my whole energy, time and soul to becoming a good teacher and increase awarness for a healthy way of living, starting with the little ones. This is my way to honour the discipline that trully saved my life.

Durin last years, in order to find balance in this very challanging environment, I was practising daily meditation and Hatha Yoga. That literally kept me alive and helped me succesfully manage my advanced fatigue and frequent migraines. It took me lot of courage to give up working in the media, but I know this is the most healthy decision I have ever made. And by gaining back my health and being able to blossom again after those hard 5 years, now I'm more than happy to share this knowledge and practice with children and adults in search for a healthy body and mind.

Teaching Yoga to Children is the most absolute fulfilling job I have ever done. It fills me with joy and happiness. And, deep in my heart, I know that this it the best way to help the new generation to find a way to a balanced and happy life, a starting point in building together a better world.

So, in order to make this huge shift, to give space and time to this practice and to participate in developing workshops for therapy with children, I need your financial support. I need more money to buy all kind of playing instruments (which I use in the various games during one hour of practice), for books and sometimes for yoga mats. 



Now, I'm teaching Yoga for Children as a volunteer in an open library, which has many wonderful programs for the little ones. In september I will have the opportunity to also teach in another library, also as a volunteer. And despite the perspective of being payed for this wonderful work is still faraway, I'm still willing to do this because is far more important for children to have free acces to this amazing beneficial discipline.

This is the reason I kindly ask you to stand by me and be part of this beautiful and useful initiative for children. Your support will help me to keep this education alive, to continue my progress in this journey and to sustain my living costs with rent, traveling expenses in educational purpuses, taking part in workshops and seminars, be able to provide good teaching in Yoga for Children.

I will be very happy to keep you update with the steps of my journey. You may find photos of my work here https://www.facebook.com/pages/Yoga-pentru-Copi...

May that more and more children and adults truly enjoy of a free, healthy and happy life through yoga and meditation! Please, feel free to share with your friend my call and my story.

I deeply thank you for your open heart and support! Namaste!

Sincerely,
Lavinia Marin
Certified Yoga for Children Instructor

story:
IN HET KORT

Een online leeromgeving om te leren wat gezondheid is en daarmee ZELFREGIE te nemen. Dit leer je van de beste probleemoplossers in Nederland die Matthijs heeft leren kennen. We trappen af met Ruud Elfers. Tijdens zijn curriculum deelt hij zijn visie omtrent 'het leven' en 'gezondheid'.

"De kern van het leven draait om de wetten van de natuur rond licht water en magnetisme."

Onderwerpen (o.a.):

  • kwantum biologie
  • Licht, water en magnetisme
  • Spiritualiteit
  • Genexpressie 
  • Ziekte en gezondheid

 

Wat willen wij & wat jij daar voor terug krijgt

 

  • Jouw euro's om het fundament van de ZELFREGIE leeromgeving te bouwen
  • Jouw euro's voor de productie van het complete curriculum met Ruud Elfers
  • Jij krijgt 1 jaar toegang toegang tot ZELFREGIE leeromgeving en 66% korting als funder op het curriculum van Ruud Elfers
     

Impact

Met jouw euro's kunnen wij een online leeromgeving bouwen en het fundament leggen voor 'de gezondheid' leeromgeving van Nederland. 

  • Wetten van de natuur als fundament
  • Holistische kennis & tools omtrent gezondheid
  • Van kwantumbiologie tot aan pijnvrij bewegen en voeding
     

 

Andere manieren om te helpen

  • Deel dit met je vrienden en familie

     

Licht, liefde en gezondheid!

 

Matthijs & Ruud

story:
Join us in our mission to empower and inspire the next generation of leaders to be part of building a peaceful and prosperous world!

Peace Academy Costa Rica (PACR) is a North American accredited educational centre for students and families who think outside the box!  Our school community embraces flexibility, innovation, and an inquiry-based approach to learning in the twenty-first century.  It is more than a school.  It is also a community coming together with shared values, whose aim is to foster regional peace through innovative leadership training and education programs for young leaders.   Peace Academy Costa Rica is unique in its focus on individual student strengths and dreams, collaborative service learning, open communication, and intentional community building. We pride ourselves on not having any political or religious affiliations, other than encouraging the politics of peace.

PACR has proven its success in empowering young leaders to take charge of their own lives, while developing skills and optimism about the real possibility to be part of creating the change we want to see.  We are now ready to both boost our impact on students internationally and ensure our long-term financial sustainability, as we are poised to incorporate new awareness projects and peace program initiatives.  We intend to launch a new suite of training programs and to award scholarships for students who show leadership promise.  We also intend to design a purpose-built school that becomes a hub, uniting those who embrace our mission.  With your support, we can make our dream a reality! 

Campaign Highlights

Outlined below you can read details regarding our mission, vision, and model, and learn about the story of Peace Academy Costa Rica.  In a nutshell, here are four reasons to join our movement:

  1. Your support will enable our students and school community to:
  • Welcome new students to the PACR community through scholarships 
  • Participate in exceptional quality peace programs and leadership training in Costa Rica and beyond
  • Complete awareness campaigns and share them with the world
  • Design a student-created documentary about the best ideas and programs from around the world, to inspire the genuine spread of peace that can begin right in our classrooms

     2.  We want to engage with you and hear your ideas.  

  • Do you have ideas? 
  • Can you connect us with a person or organization that may want to join our movement?  
  • Do you know an investor or philanthropist who would be invested in our cause? 
  • Are you able to offer a personal donation?

   3.  Our perks for our supporters are handmade by our students and community members, and reflect our vision and values. 

We pour our hearts into everything we do and this includes our lovely handmade perks designed especially for you.  Check out our perks!

   4.  We’re at a critical junction in our vision’s development, and your investment will enable us to achieve a key measure of financial sustainability. 

We realize peace takes time to build, and we’re committed to this cause in the long-term. Your investment today will continue to pay dividends for decades to come.

Read the rest of our campaign page below and visit our website, to learn more about joining our movement!

 

Our Plan: Help Us Spread World Peace and 

Train Young Leaders

We are asking for your support to allow us to bring the dream of a flexible, customized education plan to our world’s future leaders!  We will select scholarship recipients based on their financial need, but also on their desire to pursue a dream that they couldn’t otherwise reach, and their leadership promise to see these goals through.

We are implementing two strategies in our approach to fulfill the most potential for short and long-term growth.  An intersection of all three funding sources will bring us results that will feed our programs and bring the momentum needed to accomplish all our community is aiming for!

   1.  Crowdfunding Campaign – We are calling out to all who are interested in being part of our movement and investing in peace education.  We are getting the word out through social media and community involvement. 

   2.  Call for Philanthropist Contributions – We are asking all who encounter our campaign to connect us with those who have a personal interest in peace education and the potential to work with us towards our larger goals.

 

How Funds Will Be Used

Below is the sequential evolution we envision for PACR, and our plan to escalate our impact for youth in Costa Rica and beyond.

1. Sophisticated Leadership and Peace Education Programs ($10,000)

With your help we will be able to offer more programs, to even more youth! This is part of our journey to equip our students with the tools needed to develop skills and spread optimism about creating a peaceful world.  This means inserting more programs including ongoing workshops, teacher training, field trips, guest speakers, non-violent conflict resolution, and confidence building programs.

2. Scholarships for Peace Ambassadorship and Leadership ($24,000)

We are fully committed to our vision and peace ambassadorship, and want to attract like-minded, innovative, and driven youth who have caught the vision along with us.  With criteria that includes leadership skills, superior personal resolve, and a dream to pursue a lifelong journey that pushes the boundaries of traditional education, we will select students who embrace the possibility to create personal and regional change.

Potential students will engage in a meaningful application process, and can join us locally or internationally, gaining a rigorous North American diploma that is recognized worldwide.  By showing evidence of leadership promise through community projects and/or exceptional devotion to their personal pursuits, we will attract students and families who will put our teachings into practise, both immediately and lifelong.

3. Tools and Technology ($10,000)

We will acquire some of the tools and technology needed for the students to allow them to plan and create community outreach projects, student created documentaries and multimedia projects. 

4.  The remainder of funds will go towards covering the cost of the campaign including promotion, and Indiegogo fees. 

 

Our long-term goal is to have a Purpose-Built School With a Design Led by Our Mission

Conscious, Sustainable, and Peaceful Living

Taking our inspiration from other schools, organizations, and current design research, we will build a school that follows Costa Rica’s lead to become carbon neutral and self-sustaining.  With careful and conscious design, we will collaborate with both international experts and local knowledge to complete this project, drawing on the expertise, talent, and will of those who want to join our movement.

Our students dream of a mix of modern learning spaces and outdoor natural classrooms, increasing our ability to apply learning to the real world.  They envision a garden, a green kitchen, an indoor/outdoor science lab, safe spaces for physical activity, and areas that encourage both whole group activities and peaceful solitude.  Our teachers dream of a school that welcomes both thoughtful collaboration and strong individual focus, inspires their own creativity, and surrounds us with the natural beauty that teaches us better than anything else how precious our earth is.  

Inspiration for Unity

We want all who enter the grounds and facility of Peace Academy to be immediately immersed in our mission, with evidence of the inspiration and accomplishments of our current young leaders, our forerunners, and historical figures, with powerful messages that remind us of the journey we are committed to.

We will incorporate the making of a gathering spot in our school design – a place that claims our attention and commands our respect.  It will be a labyrinth of all those things that encourage unity and an entanglement of ideas borne out of our will to encourage peace. 

In following that, it is important to PACR to design a gathering place that encourages cooperation and innovative peace practices.  This congregative area will increase our ability to provide unique programs for our students, families, and community members.  It will also serve as a unique gathering space for other organizations and groups whose work aligns well with ours.

Opportunities for Community Contribution

A key component of our model includes service to others. All of our students engage in volunteer work and community outreach.  With a purpose-built school we will be able to increase our community impact and implement partnership programs that allow us to more readily meet the needs of our community.

Our students dream of having our garden sustain a restaurant, in which we feed the less fortunate, and of bringing in children from all over Costa Rica to participate in non-violent, student-led programs.  Our teachers dream of being able to offer adult training programs and retreats, as well as utilizing our growth to spearhead far-reaching campaigns that will contribute to both our local and global community.

Students can join us from all international locations!

PACR has established a virtual school partnership that allows young leaders from around the world to join in our vision.  Our virtual school is unique in that it involves collaboration, group work, and opportunities to participate in both on-campus and off-campus leadership programs.

To learn more about our Virtual School, view our video. 

Click here!

 

More About PACR

Our Beginnings

Just over a year and half ago, a single family left the familiar comforts and security of their home in Canada to pursue a dream: the dream of starting a school in Central America that would provide an alternative to the “textbook and test” approach that is typical in this region.  They envisioned a school where students achieve success through individualized learning programs.   They’d also have the flexibility and support to pursue their personal passions while developing the character and awareness needed to understand the significance of their role in our world.

Combining their skills as an experienced, certified teacher, an artist with a background in fine art and photography, and the boundless energy of two young brothers eager to embrace adventure, they pursued this vision together and founded Peace Academy Costa Rica.

Our school officially opened with six students in December 2015.  We are so proud to share that we have grown tremendously and now have 32 students from around the globe who are embracing the learning process through customized learning programs, unique to each of them.  We have developed exciting elective options, with a strong emphasis on leadership and world awareness.  Our families are following their dreams and pursuits along with us!  And we now have a group of talented and experienced teachers from all over the world who also believe in our vision.

Why Costa Rica?

Costa Rica a hub for those coming together with a view towards peace, making it the ideal place to begin training leaders and change agents, who will go out into the world to spearhead future initiatives that are so very much needed in today’s global society.

Why is Costa Rica the perfect place for this?  Costa Rica embraces peace practices with a multi-dimensional approach, including things such as housing the United Nations University for Peace headquarters, by having hosted the Central American Peace Conference and the P3 (Planet, People, and Peace) Conference, and through setting an example to the world regarding ecotourism and sustainable practices.  Costa Rica is gaining a lot of attention and is on the radar worldwide for those paying attention to initiatives aimed at creating change worldwide.

The previous leader of Costa Rica, Oscar Arias Sanchez, won the Nobel Peace Prize for his leadership in ending the Central American crisis.  He guided the people of Costa Rica until 2010, also receiving the Albert Schweitzer Prize for Humanitarianism and served as a trustee with Economists for Peace and Security. 

Going back even further, Costa Rica permanently abolished its army over sixty-five years ago, to reallocate funds to education and political stability.  Talk about progression! 

“To this day, Costa Rica has no army, navy or air force, no heavy weapons of any kind. There are local police forces but no national defense force. When visiting dignitaries arrive in San Jose, they are never met by bands in military-style uniforms or uniformed national officials of any kind, because by law there are none; rather, foreign VIPs are met by schoolchildren wearing the visitor's national colors.

If you walk along a beach in Costa Rica and see lines of pelicans flying in perfect formation, consider it the Tico air force, out on maneuvers.”

http://articles.latimes.com/2013/dec/15/opinion... 

And most recently, Costa Rica set a world record for the number of days in which it relied only on renewable resources and is committed to being the first country in the world to become carbon neutral!

http://www.ticotimes.net/2015/11/30/costa-rica-... 

Peace Academy Costa Rica supplements these accomplishments through our purposefully-designed program.  Read below to learn more about our:

  • Mission
  • Values
  • Model

Our Mission

We envision a future in which our alumni and greater community remain deeply connected to each other and committed to our mission, vision, and values for the rest of their lives. 

As our community members becomes leaders in their workplaces and communities, internationally, they will inspire others to join their pursuit towards peace, encouraging collaboration and innovation, and thereby building sustainable peace and prosperity for generations to come.

We will accomplish this through caring, encouraging facilitators who develop flexible, integrated curriculums.  These, in turn, create opportunities for investigation, critical thought, discovery, problem solving, and self-expression. 

Our unified effort between school, student, family, and community is to prepare the next generation to challenge themselves in the pursuit of new knowledge, personal growth, and social contribution.

Our Values

With greater ownership of the education process, students more readily understand and adhere to concepts like respect, honesty, efficiency, and personal growth. Over time they can learn to confidently make good decisions in all areas of their lives as opposed to being afraid of making bad ones.  Detailed below are the five characteristics that PACR strives to nurture and inspire in each of our students: 

Divergent Thinker – There are often multiple solutions to the same problem.  Studies show expert potential in this regard in young children, which declines over time as they are processed through schools with standardized curriculums.  This trait is paramount to a generation of new and unique ideas which serve as inspiration to others; the effect is cyclical and enormously beneficial to human creativity and innovation.   

Conscious Consumer – Every product and service we purchase has a “footprint” which is the sum of all the energy, resources and waste required to provide it, to use it and to dispose of it.  Making intelligent decisions here is a responsibility we all share on a global level, and another way we can look beyond our self-interest and live in a manner that best serves the health and quality of life for all living things.  

Self-Educator – An effective school is one that can instill in kids a love for the learning process.  Children are then equipped and inspired to pursue new knowledge and greater challenges long after their formalized schooling has ended.  Both failures and successes are further motivation, for the broader perspective of the world they bring along with deep, internal reward.

Collaborator – Competition breeds distrust, greed, secrecy, and conflict which inhibits real scientific and human progress.  When collaboration becomes the central principle in our social order, our most critical problems will get solved.  Global collaboration will put mankind on course to achieve its highest potential - for individual growth and human progress – and the opportunity to finally become “civilized”.   

Change Agent – Change agents are the valued problem solvers of the world, always asking: “is there a better way?” An effective educational experience will push students to look beyond conformity and seek out solutions to the most  challenging human problems as those represent the greatest reward – not monetary gain or personal status, but reward in the form of discovery and human benefit.

Our Model

Our model uses a four-pronged approach to instilling the values above, through careful program design that focuses on inquiry-based learning, community service, peace studies, and leadership programs:

Inquiry-Based Learning
We must be curious about others, learn to listen, and sharpen our minds through disciplined inquiry. Inquiry takes the form of research, assessments of programs and activities, field trips, and intense discussions about world conflict and resolution.  This leads to a more fundamental understanding of the root of social issues and the formation of real solutions.

Community Service
Service work shifts our focus from the self to others. Volunteerism is a dynamic, two-way process between two equal partners.  All students must complete the annual mandated service hours, and are encouraged to reach Internship Excellence.  Service projects have included community clean-up, job shadowing, teaching, supporting local businesses, working with children, and lifeguarding.

Peace and Diversity Curriculum

Our students engage in peace studies and our academy is continually developing new curriculum relevant to world issues and student interests.  In elementary and middle school, peace studies, and the values related to peace ambassadorship, are incorporated into most subject areas as they naturally relate to the world.  At the secondary school level, all graduates must earn two or more Peace and Diversity credits, that require them to explore their own place in our global society and the strategies we can use to create change.

Leadership Programs
Our programs are structured so that participants take ownership of the design and implementation of program activities, as well as develop the confidence to be the gracious leaders we encourage them to be.  Our youth have developed leadership skills through programs we have designed or by participating in community programs that we support.  These include lifeguarding, public speaking, team-building, theatre, and awareness projects/campaigns.

How to Join Our Movement

  • Contribute today and become an owner of our cause!
  • Spread the word! Share our campaign page, videos, and social media updates on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.
  • Send personalized emails to friends, family, colleagues, neighbors, etc. about our campaign,  telling why you support Peace Academy Costa Rica and why they should too.
  • Engage on social media. Like our posts on Facebook and Instagram, and retweet our posts on Twitter!
  • Become a team member of our campaign. Contact us for more information on joining our team!

 

Contact us for more information or to discuss your interest:

info@peaceacademycostarica.com

https://www.facebook.com/PeaceAcademycostarica/ 

http://www.peaceacademycostarica.com/
