story:
Short Summary

My educational journey began in my early 20's. In the midst of that journey, I became pregnant with twins and decided to postpone my journey to raise my children. Once they had reached a certain age and were in child care, I decided to return to school and scheduled an education plan meeting with a college counselor. Upon meeting with the counselor, one of the challenges that stood out during my meeting was that they were having a difficult time trying to figure out what classes I took at my previous school that aligned with the classes I needed to take at their school in order to achieve my goals.  After almost an hour of searching through possible class options, going back and forth between both colleges class descriptions, making phone calls, searching through documents and transcripts, to try to peace everything together,  we eventually came to a resolution that worked for my individual circumstance. I was able to complete a full semester before I had to take another break because over time, handling all of those responsibilities was too much for me as a single parent of two amazing children.

Fast-forward to 2018. My twins were now starting high school and I could allow myself the time to focus on me and be a role model to them by finishing what I started years ago. Naturally one would think that after 10 years there would have to have been some advances in technology and better programs for education for people like me, unfortunately this was not the case. The same challenges I ran into 10 years prior were the same challenges I was running into now, 10 years later. That's when I said there has to be a better way. Shortly thereafter I went to work on what I felt could benefit students, past, present and future. and I came up with the idea for my 2 A Degree App,,. because everyone should have the same equal access to education.

What We Need & What You Get

I am no stranger to fundraising. As the President of a Nonprofit 501 c3 organization for several years, I raised the funds to fund the field trips and supplies for an entire Pre K to 6 grade elementary school, and that was no easy task.

The App is in it's early developmental phase and I am a resilient person who likes to be proactive, so I'm getting an early start and hitting the ground running. I need to raise an additional 40K to fund the functionality and cost for development portion of the App. Not only will the app  make it simple and easy to track your progress, it will work for anyone, whether you are starting, continuing or completing your path to higher learning. 

The Impact

Navigating through information to take college courses should not be more challenging than the classes you will have to take. Now, the key to your success is in your hand and it's an app on your phone.

This has the potential to be much more than just an app. My goal is to make this a program that is used in every high school and college all over the world. 

This app will be life changing, as we all know, life can get in the way sometimes so imagine being able to go back to school to finish out that degree you had to put off. It would also be beneficial to new students who are entering into the college level, by providing an easier and more fun way to follow their individual educational plan process, with much less confusion. 

Risks & Challenges

With any venture there will always be unforeseeable challenges. I have surrounded myself with a team of people that include but are not limited to, educators, accountants, marketing strategist, and content developers, to name a few. in addition to using my resources, for any issues that may arise, know that I think quick on my feet and am confident in my ability to get them resolved with little to no issues. 

The biggest challenge that I foresee is reaching the amount needed to complete the app. However, I am not worried because as an accomplished fund raiser, I know what it takes to successfully raise funds by continuing to have as many fundraising campaign as needed to reach the goal, in addition to other things outside of the campaigns such as sales and using the proceeds from my small business.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

With the understanding that we are facing a life changing pandemic and that not everyone is in the position to contribute financially that is perfectly okay, but keep in mind that every little bit helps and there is no such thing as too little. One of the things that people will tell you about me is that I am one of their biggest supporters. If I don't have the money I will either share the information about their business via social media and word of mouth, send recommendations to others looking for their type of services, share my resources and even reach out to my extensive network of people that I am connected to through clubs, Boards and Communities I am involved in. So, if you are not in a position to make a monitory contribution, maybe you know someone who can, maybe you believe enough in the mission to share my vision with your collogues, whichever way you choose to contribute, every little bit helps, you never know how something has simple as sharing an idea can have a big impact on the success of 2 A Degree. In the meantime,  I will be praying that your situation improves so that you can be in a better place financially and thank you in advance for any support you give, It is very much appreciated.

story:
Magical I Am is a reading adventure game that offers a fun and affordable path to success for young dyslexic and struggling readers. This mobile solution addresses the key challenge for struggling readers, grades K through fifth – the mastery of abstract words and symbols. 

Created by a top dyslexia coach, Bill Allen (with over 25 years of working with dyslexic readers) and world-renowned game designer, Sunil Thankamushy, and grounded in years of research on the benefits of play in learning, Magical I Am offers a powerful and affordable resource for families tired of the stress and shortcomings of rote memorization and traditional classroom techniques. Using our patent-pending Bindu M.E. Tech™ and Adaptive Content Casting™, children are introduced to hundreds of abstract words  and symbols while navigating the adventure and mysteries that await them in Magical I Am- Sky Village.​

What others are saying...

“Learning a language requires repetition which students naturally gravitate towards in digital gaming. Teaching in this environment has made me think more profoundly about the various learning disabilities such as dyslexia among student populations. This is where Magical I Am is such an invaluable platform.”  - (Nathalie Ettzvoglou, award-winning language educator)

“My daughter loved the fact that it was a digital platform, which kids today respond to” - (Rachel Galotti, parent)

Trusted dyslexia learning methods + first of its kind technology...

  • Created by noted game developer, and professor of animation, Sunil Thankamushy (Lead Animator, Lost World: Jurassic Park,  Medal of Honor, Medal of Honor Frontline, at Dreamworks Interactive; Animation Director, Call of Duty Finest Hour)

  • Magical I Am™ is the first digital game to master learning to read abstract words and symbols, using the 3-D senses of sight, sound, touch, kinesthetics, and the imagination of possibilities and solutions that the senses evoke.

  • Our game represents a reading intervention that is built on a growing collection of research showing that play activates the brain in meaningful ways that rote memorization, testing, worksheets, and traditional classroom techniques do not. 

  • While the learning mechanisms in Magical I Am are trusted dyslexia teaching methods, our team of developers and education experts have interpreted these methods into a first of its kind technology - Bindu M.E. Tech™. 

  • Featuring Adaptive Content Casting™ - a responsive system embedded within Magical I Am that continuously evaluates player competence and engagement.  The system continuously updates the content presented to the player based on the progress of the player, so the your child can learn comfortably at their own pace.

  • Monitor your child’s progress. Reporting available for parents/teachers that offers data on your child's progress - measuring accuracy, speed, comprehension, and more.

Rounds of testing have shown children of all reading abilities connect with the adventures of Knight and his loyal pup, Lance as they make their way through the magical land of Sky Village, solving exciting challenges and learning to visualize abstract words by mastering enchanting spells. 

​A paradigm shift in the way dyslexia is treated...

  • Dyslexia affects approximately 20 percent of the population and represents 80–90 percent of all those with "learning disabilities". It is the most common of all neuro-diverse labels.

  • Many school systems, especially those in lower income areas, often do not offer the appropriate level of programs to address dyslexia and reading challenged students.

  • Magical I Am represents an affordable reading intervention compared to the average annual costs of 21-40k for more traditional dyslexia interventions. 

  • Our team recognizes Magical I Am is only one piece of the puzzle in reaching and better supporting young dyslexic readers, so our Founder & CEO, Bill Allen, has committed that 10 percent of all gross revenue of Magical I Am will go to dyslexic-focused charities.

Help a dyslexic child realize the magic of reading...

Magical I Am – Sky Village is almost complete. Our founder, Bill Allen, and the Magical I Am team have invested millions of their own dollars and thousands of hours creating this dynamic new tool for dyslexic readers. We are targeting a general launch in Summer 2021, but we need your help to get there! 

This round of crowdfunding will ensure we can get Magical I Am to the general public, and your contribution, no matter how small, can push us over the top. Whether you give $5 or $500, by backing our Indiegogo campaign, you're helping to get Magical I Am in front of children who have so far been unable get the support they need. 

Join us and be part of something that could change the lives of millions of dyslexic and struggling readers.

    Learn more and subscribe for updates at www.magicaliam.com.

story:
About the Author | Jim Flannery

I struggle with talking about myself without doing comedy, so I'm going to use the same bio I just submitted for a conference in Ottawa, where my role was to discuss self-directed education and its role in building child-friendly communities.

>>> BEGIN COPY/PASTE >>>

Jim attended public school in the United States in a suburb in Connecticut.  He got top grades that allowed him to go on to obtain a biomedical engineering degree from a top University where he graduated magna cum laude.  By all conventional metrics, 22-year old Jim appeared to be the poster child for a successful public education system.

As a surprising twist, at 27 years of age, Jim left the tech startup world and took a job as a physics teacher at a public high school.  Within a year, Jim left teaching high school to create an alternative to the conventional school system. 

Why the change of heart?

Find out in this exciting discussion, where Jim hosts a group of teens from the Peer Unschooling Network (PUN) to discuss the amplification of youth voice in the public education system.

If you want to prepare for the session, please read The Academia Manifesto.  This landmark document, featured on the National Youth Rights Association (NYRA) website, was drafted by PUN members Katherine Farr & Walker Meyn as part of NYRA’s Age of Youth campaign.

[LEARN MORE ABOUT THE Uniting for Children and Youth CONFERENCE]

>>> END COPY/PASTE >>>
 

 


About the Book | LEAVE SCHOOL

Some of you reading this may know I released an app called LEAVE SCHOOL: what teachers can't tell you, that helps young people who are frustrated by school to lead fulfilling lives without it.

Well, now I am publishing LEAVE SCHOOL as a physical book!  So, go crush those trees and grind 'em up papa bear, Jimbo's ego's larger than life itself!

All jokes aside, I was honestly expecting the LEAVE SCHOOL app to be sufficient... hence why I went straight to making the app rather than creating a printed.  But I realize now that an audio-only product limits these ideas about self-directed education only to people who can hear - and self-directed education should be accessible to EVERYONE!
 

So, like I said, it's time to crush them trees and grind 'em up to drip some ink on 'em! (#plucktrees!)

I'm using IndieGoGo to promote the "ZEROth Edition" of LEAVE SCHOOL, which is the exact same version of LEAVE SCHOOL that I sent to the copy editor last week.  Once the copy editor has it, they'll move forward with the process of getting it "perfect", finding a literary agent, negotiating with a publisher, planning a promotional thing, and eventually something something. 

That means this version, the ZEROth edition, is 100% my words.  For those of you who've already listened to the LEAVE SCHOOL mobile app, you'll notice this print version is essentially a manuscript for the app (plus some notes to the copy editor in the margins), so please don't be disappointed!

After the book goes to a 'real publisher', I won't be able to sell any more ZEROth edition copies of the book - EVER.  After this, you'll only be able to get LEAVE SCHOOL by purchasing a copy from an actual publisher and, honestly, who knows what they're going to do with my words. 

P.S. And hey - wouldn't it be better for ME to get all the money and not the publisher?

 

What I Need & What You Get

  • It costs me about $25 to print one each copy of LEAVE SCHOOL (nice shiny covers included!).  To cover shipping and packaging, I'm adding another $25.  It's a flat rate, so you so don't have to worry about calculating it or being surprised by any fees.  (US and International!!!).  I'm selling LEAVE SCHOOL for $50, which feels fair all things considered in the process (and the value the reader will get!).
  • If there are any profits from this campaign, I'll likely dump them into more SnapChat ads to promote the LEAVE SCHOOL app and to organize a book/comedy tour for 2021 to promote the printed book.
     

The Impact of LEAVE SCHOOL

If I'm honest about the impact I imagine LEAVE SCHOOL book making, people will lock me up for having delusions of grandeur. 

So let's just say this: I'd like to take the impact the LEAVE SCHOOL app is already having (see reviews below) and dump as much fertilizer as the trees we're going to kill to print this book can handle, and grow that impact through the LEAVE SCHOOL (share lnik) book. 

Not to worry, there is no poetry in the LEAVE SCHOOL book (you can check the app to verify).

As far as that big question of "how many copies of LEAVE SCHOOL do I want to sell?" - I'm not sure...  but it'd be cool if I sold so many that we had to resort to chopping down trees in the Amazon rain forest to print all the copies... I'm really curious what's under there!!!!

For the record, I did tell the copy editor my goal is 50 books by New Years... which would make sure they still have a job ;)
 

REVIEWS:

I'll let the people who've listened to this via Google Play Store and the Apple App Store tell you what they think about LEAVE SCHOOL:

 

LEAVE SCHOOL for iPhone | 4.9 / 5.0 • 29 Ratings


Review by skskksskhelp, 07/16/2020

"I have been in disagreement with the school system for awhile now, i've even wrote my school papers about it and how they should change it. I heard about this app from a guy on tik tok also disagreeing with schools and giving alternatives so i thought why not try it? i agreed so much with this and i'm so inspired, my head flooded with ideas to learn and start working on, but first i'm writing a essay to my parents and i'm doing research on more articles right now. i'm very excited and i wished i knew about this sooner. If i'm ever successful as i'm aiming to be, i'll try a great deal to shoot an email giving my thanks and respect. :) i'll definitely recommend this to a few of my friends who might be interested. thank you so much for helping me start on my path."

 

 

LEAVE SCHOOL for Android | 4.7 / 5.0 • 23 Ratings


Review by Marsha Shack​, August 25, 2020

"I love this book! It is full of personal insights and practical tools for teens to help them take responsibility for their own education. Anyone (parents & students) homeschooling, attending conventional public education or alternative programs will benefit from listening to Jim's funny and engaging story. Thank you for writing this!"

 

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risks at this stage is how long it will take for the book to get from the print shop to your mailbox. 

My local print shop can run copies off on 24-hours notice, and then obviously I've got to ship it to you.  Expect a week for domestic shipping in the continental United States of America, and two weeks for all other shipping.  Obviously shipping risks always exist of the package being lost or stolen, so please let me know if anything happens.

The other risk is that you'll get the book and hate it. 

I would say... I've taken a risk also in putting my self out there in this highly unusual way.  So I hope you can at least appreciate we share in the risk here... because ultimately the risk is that feeling of making a mistake! I am quite afraid you're going to get LEAVE SCHOOL and hate it.  However... if I'm being 100% honest, if you truly do hate LEAVE SCHOOL, I hope you really hate it... so much that you tell people you hate it.  I hope there's only 1% of you who feel this way, and that the other 99% of you LOVE the book!  But I know I can't please everyone... and it's terrifying to know some of you will be disappointed.... or worse yet, BORED. 

If reading this book is boring, please try listening to it in audio format via the app.  If that is also boring, then try some of the authors mentioned in the first chapter of the book.  They inspired me... they can probably guide you as well.

 

Other Ways You Can Help Support LEAVE SCHOOL

 

  • Share this link on your social media.  I'm no longer welcome on Instagram and Facebook, so any and all promotion on those platforms is huge.
  • Send this link out to your discussion and email lists!
  • Punch a neighbor in the face and tell their dog, "It's okay to LEAVE SCHOOL!"
  • Tell any young person about "LEAVE SCHOOL" who is either:
    - bored at school,
    - not excited to wake up everyday,
    - could excel better if they could follow their passion, or
    - doesn't even have enough freedom to figure out what their passion is!!
  • Find any email address you can and send this message:
    Subject:   FYI - immediate
    Content: Need a last-minute physical gift for a young person in your life who is frustrated with school?  (or just too smart/dumb for it?)

    You're welcome ;)

Review by skskksskhelp, 07/16/2020
"I have been in disagreement with the school system for awhile now, i've even wrote my school papers about it and how they should change it. I heard about this app from a guy on tik tok also disagreeing with schools and giving alternatives so i thought why not try it? i agreed so much with this and i'm so inspired, my head flooded with ideas to learn and start working on, but first i'm writing a essay to my parents and i'm doing research on more articles right now. i'm very excited and i wished i knew about this sooner. If i'm ever successful as i'm aiming to be, i'll try a great deal to shoot an email giving my thanks and respect. :) i'll definitely recommend this to a few of my friends who might be interested. thank you so much for helping me start on my path."
 
 
LEAVE SCHOOL for Android | 4.7 / 5.0 • 23 Ratings
Review by Marsha Shack​, August 25, 2020
"I love this book! It is full of personal insights and practical tools for teens to help them take responsibility for their own education. Anyone (parents & students) homeschooling, attending conventional public education or alternative programs will benefit from listening to Jim's funny and engaging story. Thank you for writing this!"
 
 

Risks & Challenges
The biggest risks at this stage is how long it will take for the book to get from the print shop to your mailbox. 
My local print shop can run copies off on 24-hours notice, and then obviously I've got to ship it to you.  Expect a week for domestic shipping in the continental United States of America, and two weeks for all other shipping.  Obviously shipping risks always exist of the package being lost or stolen, so please let me know if anything happens.
The other risk is that you'll get the book and hate it. 
I would say... I've taken a risk also in putting my self out there in this highly unusual way.  So I hope you can at least appreciate we share in the risk here... because ultimately the risk is that feeling of making a mistake! I am quite afraid you're going to get LEAVE SCHOOL and hate it.  However... if I'm being 100% honest, if you truly do hate LEAVE SCHOOL, I hope you really hate it... so much that you tell people you hate it.  I hope there's only 1% of you who feel this way, and that the other 99% of you LOVE the book!  But I know I can't please everyone... and it's terrifying to know some of you will be disappointed.... or worse yet, BORED. 
If reading this book is boring, please try listening to it in audio format via the app.  If that is also boring, then try some of the authors mentioned in the first chapter of the book.  They inspired me... they can probably guide you as well.
 

Other Ways You Can Help Support LEAVE SCHOOL
 

Share this link on your social media.  I'm no longer welcome on Instagram and Facebook, so any and all promotion on those platforms is huge.
Send this link out to your discussion and email lists!
Punch a neighbor in the face and tell their dog, "It's okay to LEAVE SCHOOL!"
Tell any young person about "LEAVE SCHOOL" who is either:- bored at school,- not excited to wake up everyday,- could excel better if they could follow their passion, or- doesn't even have enough freedom to figure out what their passion is!!
Find any email address you can and send this message:Subject:   FYI - immediateContent: Need a last-minute physical gift for a young person in your life who is frustrated with school?  (or just too smart/dumb for it?)You're welcome ;)

story:
EdBoard is a magnetic circuit-building kit made for kids, inspired by real tools used by real engineers. We use stories to make learning super fun and super playful, and we need your help to make it happen!  

 

The EdBoard was created with one goal in mind: helping the next generation of engineers find their confidence. Using a combination of story-based learning and large, magnetic components designed for children, the EdBoard represents the cutting edge of at-home STEM learning.

 Created by a passionate group of educators and engineers, our story-based curriculum is designed using the latest in child developmental research. Our approach has been validated by academic research from the University of Colorado Boulder, which showed that the EdBoard limited frustration while helping develop a stronger understanding of circuitry.

EdBoard sparks kids' imaginations by introducing them to the lovable town of Sparkdale. Though a great place to live, the EdBugs who live there need help solving the circuit mysteries and puzzles that are troubling the town. Lizzy the Lightning Bug and her friends will guide young learners through the real-world engineering process of ‘debugging’, designing, and building circuits as they work together to untangle the secrets of Sparkdale.

 We plan to develop and release expansion kits that can be purchased individually or through our subscription service. 

 

 

Every kit comes with lesson plans that are carefully crafted to work for children in any learning environment. For educators, we will have free access to additional online guides and lesson plans. At home, new expansion kits ensure new concepts to explore. Your EdBoard will never collect dust on the shelf!

Welcome to the town of Sparkdale, where all the learning takes place! As the newest city engineer of Sparkdale, you and your child will work hand-in-hand with Lizzy the Lightning Bug, using real-world engineering to solve the technical puzzles that have been befuddling the lovable EdBugs. Critters all over the city are wiggling with anticipation to meet their newest engineer! Explore Sparkdale through our circuit stories. Go on an adventure with the EdBugs as they introduce your child to all the awesome applications of circuitry.  

Work through Circuit Stories to help the EdBugs of Sparkdale! As you read through your story, you will encounter and discover the befuddling problems facing the EdBugs. Then, by building circuits on your EdBoard, you will engineer solutions to help the town!

Expand Sparkdale and meet new friends in our future expansion kits! Keep an eye out for our upcoming subscription service, which is the easiest way to stay up to date on all the most recent Sparkdale adventures!

The EdBoard is designed so that you don't need any previous circuitry experience to work with your kid. Any parent can easily use the EdBoard!

 

In our first three kits, your child will learn about...  

 

There's a lot more than circuitry that children need to succeed in STEM. That's why we use our kits to teach about more than just circuitry. EdBoards help prepare children to succeed in a variety of different academic subjects.

This is only the beginning of Sparkdale and more importantly your child's journey towards becoming an engineer and inventor. Here are just a few examples of the next three year's worth of Circuit Stories we have planned out.

  

 

Work with Lizzie the Lightning Bug to learn the first steps in circuitry. Here you will learn about the basics of electrical flow and the foundations of circuitry. Help the lightning bug engineers install a traffic light in time for Sparkdale’s Festival of Colors! The Main Street Base Kit is included in the FUN-Damentals Kit, The STEP Up Pack, The Ultimate Pack, and both STEM Program Kit.

What’s included:

1 EdBoard

The Main Street Traffic Light Circuit Story

Insertable Story Cards

35 Magnetic Electronic Components Including: LEDs, Wires, Resistors, Power Supply, and Buttons

 

Assist Maya the Moth in investigating why her hotel is haunted (hint: it isn't!). Learn about inputs and outputs, and be amazed as your circuit begins to move and make noise! The Haunted Hotel Expansion Kit is included in The STEP Up Pack, The Ultimate Pack, and the STEM Program Ultimate  Kit.

What’s included:

The Haunted Hotel Circuit Story

Insertable Story Cards

25 Additional Magnetic Electronic Components Including: Motor, Phototransistor, Resistors, Wires, LEDs, and Power Supply

 Join Chidi the Cricket on his conservation adventure to the tropical islands off the coast of Sparkdale. Learn not only about digital logic, but also the natural electricity created in thunderstorms. The Tropical Island Expansion Kit is included in The Ultimate Pack and the STEM Program Ultimate  Kit.

What’s included:

The Tropical Island Circuit Story

Insertable Story Cards

25 Additional Magnetic Electronic Components Including: Transistors, Capacitors, Resistors, Wires, LEDs, and Power Supply

Let your child’s imagination run wild as they add their own touches to Sparkdale. An opportunity to revisit their past projects and add an awesome new twist: use special magnetic components to build 3D structures with built-in circuits. The Construction Expansion Kit is included in The Ultimate Pack and the STEM Program Ultimate  Kit.

What’s included:

The Construction Kit Circuit Story

Insertable Story Cards

30 Additional Magnetic Building Components Including: Ladder Wires, Square Connectors, “L” Wire, Additional Classic Wires, and other special connectors


As an engineer, there is no better feeling than seeing your designs go from an idea into a real product. With our Cardboard Builders, you get to do exactly that!

Put together your cardboard product and build your circuit inside. Every time you assemble a cardboard builder, you learn a little more about prototyping and different ways to wire your projects. If you like building with your hands, this is the perfect place to start your circuitry journey!

Cardboard Builders are add-ons and can be selected at checkout. All of our tiers with "Creator Kit" in their name come with cardboard builders. 

Add the traffic light Cardboard Builder to the Main Street circuit story, the haunted elevator Cardboard Builder to the Haunted Hotel Circuit Story, and the tropical storm cloud Cardboard Builder to the Tropical Island Circuit Story.

From the ages of 5-11, children are learning about the world around them at an incredible pace. Perhaps more importantly, they are discovering who they are. This is the age at which children are developing their sense of confidence based on their accomplishments. Because of this, frustrating and ineffective learning tools can discourage children from feeling like they can succeed and belong. In the case of electrical engineering, a lack of effective child-friendly tools can prevent children from wanting to enter the electrical engineering field altogether. The EdBoard was created with education theory in mind to encourage young learners to fix this issue.

 EdBoard is backed by research; a study from the University of Colorado that was published in ACM Interaction Design and Children (IDC) 2020 found that children using EdBoards experience less frustration and are able to build circuits four times faster than children using traditional circuitry tools. The study also found that children who are taught how to create a circuit on an EdBoard are able to create the same circuit on industry-standard tools. This means that by using an EdBoard, children learn real-world skills that they can actually apply to a career in electrical engineering.

$50,000 - Online Educational Materials/instructional Videos for teaching at home

$75,000 - Choice of advanced or beginner curriculum

$100,000 - Choose your EdBoard Base Color in our survey following the Kickstarter

$200,000 - We include an additional 5 extra EdBoard connector components that allow you to connect your EdBoard to a Micro:bit or any other alligator clip interface.

At EdBoard, we believe that learning about STEM is fun, not scary. We understand that traditional STEM education can be intimidating. Education through play makes STEM approachable and boosts children’s confidence, comprehension, and retention. Through this, we aim to inspire young learners and make STEM accessible for any child regardless of their background. We are commited to providing the best STEM tools for teachers, parents, and children.

 Our mission is to create a diverse toolset that inspires future problem solvers. With our Circuit Stories and Cardboard Builders, we hope your children are inspired to confidently build their skillset as they prepare for a lifetime of impactful work in the STEM fields.

Our story began in 2017, in a small classroom at CU Boulder, with a group of students brought together by a common goal, increasing the accessibility of world-class STEM education for all children. From that moment to the present day, our team has been driven to realize the dream of the EdBoard: circuit education designed specifically for kids. Refined through countless iterations over the next three years, the EdBoard was perfected by feedback from our most important users: the children themselves. Our philosophy of putting children first was validated in the spring of 2020 when we competed in the New Venture Challenge, where out of 146 other startups EdBoard went on to become one of six finalists. Now, we are pleased to present the result of these efforts: the EdBoard v.1.0, designed specifically to reach children where they are. Fundamentally, our team believes in children: we believe they are intelligent, curious, and eager to learn about their world. Our goal with this product is to not only make that possible but to make it fun. We hope your child loves their EdBoard, and we can’t wait to see what they create!

 

Website: https://www.edboardtechnologies.com/

Research: https://www.colorado.edu/atlas/edboard-technolo...

 You can reach us at: hello@edboardtechnologies.com

story:
Help us increase access to education with innovative, humanitarian-driven technology solutions

 

100% of your donation will fund our first 3D printed school in Fianarantsoa, Madagascar. Help us stay on track to build this Autumn.

 

We envision a future where quality education is accessible via 3D printed schools.

story:
If you have any questions or feedback please feel free to comment or send us an e-mail at wdhsmuseum@gmail.com

The Spark

Hi, my name is Gareth Finnigan. I'm a grade 11 student at Waterdown District High School and I need your help. I'm raising funds to make my teacher's history museum the best museum that's ever been in a high school! The idea for this campaign came about when Mr. Flosman assigned my Genocide class (for learning about Genocide not learning how to do it) our culminating task: The Hope Project. This project has students strive to make Canada a better place and Canadians more tolerant by understanding their History.

I decided that for my project I would create this Indiegogo campaign for Mr. Flosman's museum to provide an exceptional learning experience for students. This is the main goal of the museum and this campaign. But a personal goal for me is to help my teacher, who has helped countless others in the school community for no reason other than to help. And I believe it's time to give back.

The Museum

In 2013, Mr. Flosman created the Waterdown Museum of History to give his students a new way to learn about their history. We've got a plethora of artifacts and items from all throughout history.

Display Cases



Military Swords


SA Dagger


A Real Jewish Star


A Nazi Flag


Gas Masks


HATS!

The Dream

Mr. Flosman's idea for the museum is pretty ambitious. 2016 is the 100th anniversary of the Battle of the Somme and to commemorate that, Mr. Flosman came up with the idea to build a life-sized trench using actual materials that were used like plywood and sandbags. This would provide an interactive experience for students all across the Flamborough-Waterdown area.

This isn't the only thing he'll do with this set however. Another part of Mr. Flosman's plan is create a new interactive exhibit every year for his museum. Next year is the anniversary of the battle of Vimy Ridge.

Bringing the Dream to Reality

To cover the costs of the trench we need about $2000 dollars. This will allow us to buy materials to make the trench as accurate as possible.

InDemand

After our campaign ends, it will convert to an InDemand project. This means that we can still collect money after the end of the campaign! This is a great opportunity to further improve the museum with the help of our generous supporters. At the end of 2016, we will opt out of InDemand and that will mark the definite end to the campaign.

The Waterdown Museum of History thanks YOU!

At the end of our campaign, we will be creating a plaque to thank all of the backers who supported this campaign. Because it is for all of our backers, you only need to donate $1 dollar to be on the plaque!

WMH: Case Files

Every month for our entire campaign (including the InDemand run) we will release a video showcasing one of our display cases and the artifacts in them. But if you donate $50, you don't have to wait! You'll receive the entire series within the first 30 days of the campaign! After then, you'll receive it instantly.

You Can be in the Trench!

Any backer who donates $300 gets their picture and name posted inside the replica trench. The most prestigious memorial for our most prestigious backers.

How Else Can You Help?

Donating funds to our campaign isn't the only way you can help us. Share our story with your friends and followers on your Facebooks, Twitters, Tumblrs, Vines, Myspaces, whatever you can to help us get the word out about the Waterdown Museum of History. 

If you live near Waterdown (or if you're willing to drive a bit) you can bring in something that you have that you think belongs on our museum. If you're not sure, feel free to e-mail us at wdhsmuseum@gmail.com

story:
A New Kind of Politics

I have stepped forward to help shape a future that Jamaican can be proud of and have been officially nominated as the Jamaica Labour Party's candidate for St. Elizabeth South West. I am proud and humbled to be given the opportunity to serve my country and St. Elizabeth where I was raised but it’s no easy task and I need your support.

The Work Has Already Begun

I am excited about the work that lies ahead and in fact the work has already begun. While I have been caretaker, I have embarked on programmes that have impacted the constituency, including the provision of 12 water tanks to Primary and Basic schools; the launch of the Right From Start programme, which helped to refurbish 8 basic schools; and the provision of educational grants and assistance for sporting programmes. The people of South West are industrious. They want opportunity and education and we have to invest in our greatest resources, our people. As a proud product of St Elizabeth, and a past student of Munro College, I share the values of honesty and hard work which encompass the constituency. 

Victory Is Within Reach

Together with my Constituency Executive and management team, we have spent the last year focused on organization and registering new voters to participate in the electoral process.  From an organizational stand point, we have confirmed our workers and can ascribe a significant majority of the new voters since 2011 to our enumeration drives. As such, we are in an excellent position to erase the 13 vote margin by which we were defeated in 2011.

Over the years we have known each other, many times we would have shared our hopes, ideas and aspirations for Jamaica and the Caribbean. Now it is time to turn our words to action. It is now 15 days until Election Day and I am asking for your support.

Making It Happen

Running a political campaign, particularly in a large, rural constituency like South West, takes a lot, including

•Transportation across the parish so that I can see and hear from constituents

•Support for our tireless volunteers with meals, transportation and communication needs

•Running a campaign office including rent, utilities and staff

•Printing and distributing campaign material - flyers, billboards

It's Worth It

With your help, I know we can realise the dreams we have for Jamaica. A lot of our problems have been caused by misguided leadership that lacks the  vision and political will to do the right thing. As a young Jamaican who believes that Jamaica can be so much more, I am convinced it is time for more of us who are willing to put our country first to step forward. Our people deserve competent, honest, and committed leadership. I know that if given that opportunity, I will provide the leadership that will lead to positive change, starting in South West, St. Elizabeth and spreading across the entire country.

It is time to build our future ourselves and not wait for others to do it for us. I ask you to join me.

Remember To Share and Spread the Word

Anything that you can contribute will help in our campaign. We are also asking you to get the word out there. Use the indiegogo search tools and ask your friends and family to contribute.

provision of educational grants and assistance for sporting programmes. The
people of South West are industrious. They want opportunity and education and
we have to invest in our greatest resources, our people. As a proud product of
St Elizabeth, and a past student of Munro College, I share the values of
honesty and hard work which encompass the constituency.  Victory Is Within Reach
Together with my Constituency Executive and
management team, we have spent the last
year focused on organization and registering new voters to participate in the
electoral process.  From an
organizational stand point, we have confirmed our workers and can ascribe a
significant majority of the new voters since 2011 to our enumeration drives. As
such, we are in an excellent position to erase the 13 vote margin by which we
were defeated in 2011.
Over the years we have known each other,
many times we would have shared our hopes, ideas and aspirations for Jamaica
and the Caribbean. Now it is time to turn our words to action. It is now 15
days until Election Day and I am asking for your support. 
Making It Happen
Running a political campaign, particularly
in a large, rural constituency like South West, takes a lot, including
•Transportation across the parish so that I
can see and hear from constituents
•Support for our tireless volunteers with
meals, transportation and communication needs 
•Running a campaign office including rent,
utilities and staff
•Printing and distributing campaign
material - flyers, billboards
It's Worth It
With your help, I know we can realise the
dreams we have for Jamaica. A lot of our problems have been caused by
misguided leadership that lacks the  vision and political will to do the
right thing. As a young Jamaican who believes that Jamaica can be so much more,
I am convinced it is time for more of us who are willing to put our country
first to step forward. Our people deserve competent, honest, and committed
leadership. I know that if given that opportunity, I will provide the
leadership that will lead to positive change, starting in South West, St.
Elizabeth and spreading across the entire country.
It is time to build our future ourselves
and not wait for others to do it for us. I ask you to join me. 
Remember To Share and Spread the Word
Anything that you can contribute will help in our campaign. We are also asking you to get the word out there. Use the indiegogo search tools and
ask your friends and family to contribute.

story:
help our poor children's education

Iam Bairaboina venkateshwarlu and Iam operating "child rights social organization" and we are working about poor children and orphan child education develop. we are supporting child education and progress child happy lives. we are wanting social and economical develop to the poor children with our organization's support.

The birth of child is one of the most amazing creations by mother. The way a new life takes birth is again one of the many magic by mother. Every parent wants to give their child best life. A life which they dreamed of having but could not have. A life full of facilities and ease. A life with less or no struggle.

They make every possible mother and father's respect so that their child is never devoid of anything. They struggle to make the life of their child easy. When their child is sick they spend sleepless nights to just see their child sleeping.

According to Wikipedia, Child labour is the practice of having children engage in economic activity, on part time or full time basis. India has ranged children under the age of 14 as child labours. The person who appoints this children under work is punishable according to law.

The sight of children working is not new to us. We all have witnessed children working at various places, but ever gave thought , what is the reason behind this?  Are these children working on their own wish? Does working make them happy? Don’t they feel like enjoying their life? Are their parents happy when they see their children working? Do they never feel like giving their children best of everything just like other parents? Doesn’t the sight of watching their child working gives pain to them?

In order to stop child labour Government has made various laws. Basic education upto 14 years of age has been made free. Midday meals is also served in government schools. Children are provided with books, bags, shoes, uniform and other items which are needed in school by the government so that the financial pressure on the parents doesn’t increases.

Despite the steps taken by the government, child labours are still there. Various NGO’s run thoroughout India to help the child labours but still child practice has still not completely stopped. What is the main reason behind this?

At times the child labours are bonded labourers who are forced to work because of a bond which their parents made. Or at other times family’s poverty drags them to work. The child becomes another source of income to the parents. Hence instead of sending the children to the Government school parents prefer to send them to job for the need of money. They fail to understand the fact that they are not only depriving their child of education but are also snatching away the possibility of having a bright future from their child. Education is the only secure path which can lead their child to success.

The practice of child labours is one of the major reason of over population in India. The greed of money forces the parents to have more children, as even they act as a source of money.

This practice deprives the child from his childhood and puts the child under physical and mental stresses. It is also not sure that the conditions under which the child work are hazardous or not. Many a times it can happen that the child is working under extremely hazardous conditions.

The practice of child labour should be stopped. Parents should be made to under the consequence of this ill-practice. Awareness programmes should be run. Even the child should be made to understand the effect of working as a labour.

The gap between the poor and rich will only decrease when this practice will be completely stopped.

child child labour are working in hotels, cinema halls, small business shops, mechanical works, Industriel works and Agriculture works for food. they are becoming very poor, they are lossing valued lives. 

A child is indeed the biggest responsibility of our organization of children rights social organization.

So In order to do this, we need help raising money for them. this money will be used to pay for their food, books, school uniforms and other basic needs.

It is frustrating to watch what is happening in our organization and feel powerless to do any thing to bring change by contributing to this crow-funding campaign, you ARE making to difference.

THANK YOU for whatever donation you are able to give to help change to the poor and orphan children lives.

sincerely,

Bairaboina venkateshwarlu 

President of CRSO.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also support us by promoting our campaign on Social media, spreading the word around and encouraging Children's education to contribute to the campaign.

story:
learningbros is a community of people who love to discover new things and share their knowledge. The bromunity started with the idea that the most efficient way to learn anything is by making it easily accessible. We’re committed to make your life easier: learn or teach what you want, where you want, with whom you want!


During the slavering period, "each one teach one" was an African proverb when slaves didn’t have access to any education. As soon as one slave learned to read or to write, he had the mission to teach someone else.

Learningbros started with the idea that

We think that anyone owns a knowledge or a passion, whatever it is. This passion can be shared and monetized.

Courses or lessons you can find so far aren’t flexible and customised. Learningbros targets to create interaction between individuals, allows them to choose courses and professors at times and prices that suit them.

More than a simple additional revenue for the teacher, more than only being a normal student, learningbros is a community of people who love to discover new things and share their knowledge.


On learningbros.com, you can fill your Brofile to join the Bromunity. If you create a listing that you want to teach, you become a Bro-teacher ready to be contacted by Bromail by a Bro. 

Meet your Bro at your favorite Broffice and at the end of a nice Bro lesson, leave your Broviews on learningbros.com

To be paid the Bro-teacher enters the Bro-code on the system in learningbros.com and get the paiement on his bank account.


If you want to expand your skill set or discover a new passion, you can search on learningbros.com for the perfect Bro to teach you, contact him, book a lesson, pay online and meet him.

If you have a talent that you want to share, want to be your own boss and teach at your price…Just create your listing on learningbros.com and you could benefit from our many perks - like online scheduling, online payment, internal messaging, reviews and rating systems … Great stuff that makes your life so easy!


- Federate people around their passions 
- Create a platform to share knowledge
- Help people find a good teacher close by and learn more from each other
- Broaden horizons and connect people

Basically learn or teach what you want, where you want, when you want, with whom you want.


  Gary - Entrepreneur

  • Loves to create projects and organise events (ex: Learningbros, Learning Café, FHK, La terre vue d'la selle)
  • Polyglot, serial traveler and adventure addict (2 world tours: 1 on a bicycle, 1 by car)
  • Has been teaching around the world for many years and loves sharing
  • In charge of users experience, administration and finances


    Gaspard - Sales 

  • Loves to meet new people, learn new stories and discover new cultures
  • Sports addict as much on a field as in front of a TV
  • 10+ years head of sales in a big French football club
  • In charge of sales, marketing and communication

  Anthony - Website

  • Loves to learn and share his knowledge, multi-passionate (technology, diving, poker, cinema...)  
  • Has been travelling 3 years around the world
  • 10+ years IT Developer and Project Manager for Corporate & Investment banking
  • In charge of website development and all IT matters


  • To develop our website and improve users experience
  • To communicate effectively in order to succeed
  • To keep our starting dynamic
  • To hire new Bro-employees!
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

story:
Short Summary

Camp Yogaville has been bringing bringing the yogic principals to children for over 25 years. Not everyone can afford to send there children to camp and even fewer get the opportunity to send them to a camp where peace and harmony are the basis of every days activities.

For every $500 raised a child in need will be able to attend Camp Yogaville and learn Hatha, Meditation and more from teachers possessing over 200 years of combined knowledge.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

If we raise our goal of $2000 as many as 6 children will be able to attend!

For every $500 we raise over the goal an additional 1-3 children will be able to attend. Any funds not used this year will be available to those in need in future years of Camp Yogaville.

Every donation of $50 or more will receive a Camp Yogaville T-shirt!


The Impact

Camp Yogaville is based on and operated by the teachings of Swami Satchidananda, founder of Integral Yoga® and Yogaville.

Swami Satchidananda teaches "Truth is One, Paths are Many" a message that has been bringing people of all walks of life together in understanding and harmony for almost 50 years.

Imagine a child being exposed to the thought that we are all one at a young age! 
The effect that would have on the rest of there life can be truly profound. 
Our goal is to get this message to as many children as possible


Risks & Challenges

The Camp Yogaville Scholarship Fund will have it's own account that will only be used for the purpose of bringing children to Camp Yogaville who would otherwise miss out.

The challenge will be who gets a scholarship. Right now there is not an overwhelming number of children that cannot afford Camp Yogaville requesting assistance. By asking parents to pay what they can we hope to stretch this fund as far as is needed in the future.

 

The LOTUS (Light of Truth Universal Shrine) is just a short walk from Camp Yogaville. During camp this is where the children will learn about the religions and faiths of the world

Other Ways You Can Help

There are so many ways you can help:

  • Share this page on Facebook, Twitter, Pintrest and anywhere you can think of! Getting the word out can often be more beneficial than a monetary donation!
  • Use the share tools above next to the video to spread the word!
  • Message us and sign up to volunteer at Camp Yogaville! Help with crafts, teach classes and whatever else you might have up your sleeve. It's fun!

story:
Short Summary

In savage world far way., a creature known only as the icky-nikki was spawned by inbred gingers mating with the corpses of sewer rats. So unsightly  the icky-nikki could not be cleaned or burned well enough so it was sent into space, It crash landed in a landfill in 1972 to be raised by swarms of maggots that it attracts.  Feeding off of evil to give it strength the ikki was naturally drawn to government. Super Troll level 9999 with his disdain for the UN and mockery of government decided to make icky-nikki the UN ambassador. We cannot undo president Troll's trolling and so we are aiming instead to pay for brain surgery and replacement for the icky.

 

WHAT WE ARE DOING

A retarded hamster was donated from Sudan. It was found stuck in an elephants butt, the rodent was recused and donated to Manwel's "No degree needed garage kinda-medical clínica" to preform the brain transfer.

story:
Short Summary

When I was studying as a law student in Shenzhen, China, I met girls who lived a drastically different life from mine - 15-year-old Lucy working  at a construction site carrying bricks 10 hours per day for 10 dollars, 6 out of which she sent back home to a remote village; 23-year-old Daisy working in a garment factory  to raise her baby girl deserted by the father's family.  They share something in common - coming from remote areas in China looking for a better life, illiterate, no idea how to bargain for a fair pay or a fair chance in life. There are millions of girls like them in this town, building a modern city from scratch in China's urbanization process, yet neglected and left behind by this fast changing country.  


When I graduated last year from Harvard Law School, I decided to come back here and build an organization for these girls, women and children, Joy in Opportunity and Equality for Her (JOE). 

They can have a different life with just a little bit of care and help: books and lessons to learn good Mandarin (because most of them do not speak proper Mandarin without a proper education, rather they speak dialects or poor Mandarin), a seminar on knowing their legal rights (lots of them do not have any contracts with their landlords, employers, or are pregnant without marriage), legal assistance for their family or employment issues, or simply a walk-in counseling hour. 

For example, the twin sister below are 15 years old and have been blind since they were born.  Left behind by their parents, they grew up around a group of elderly in the village, who taught them Er Hu (the instrument they are playing in the picture). That is the only lifeline  for them, and as the grandma and grandpas are no longer able to support them, they have left home to the city, where they play music on the streets everyday for a living. They make 40 -  60 RMB per day, and the rent of an incredibly small room they live in is 1200 RMB monthly.  They are bright young girls that are neglected by the government, by charity, and by the society in general. They could do so much better with decent education. 


What We Need 

We are in need of an office space with computers and books.  In this space, we would like to provide innovative lessons and trainings that empower girls and women by improving their language and computer skills, survival skills in a big city, tailored professional skills based on their strengths and personality. Each of them has a talent, and they will shine and thrive given the chance. 


We are also gathering a team to work on cases of employment discrimination, domestic violence, unequal access to education for them or their children, all of which hold them back for starting a new life in this city. In China, there are double standards for people who were born in a city, and those who move in from villages as "migrants", in all aspects of life, including health benefits, education, housing, and employment.  These children and women lose the chance at the very starting point as village migrants, and they usually don't have any idea how to use the law to protect themselves. As a public interest lawyer, I am  working on projects for equal access to education for children, and I can see how that help change my clients, but also a bigger group by changing the law and system. 


What You Get 

I believe in empowering those in need rather than simply giving them what they need. So the plan is for those who have received Mandarin or English lessons to teach others how to speak; for those who learn computer skills, to give computer, or cooking, or other types lessons to people who are similarly situated. Whatever they get in JOE, they can multiple that in their community, and spread the impact.  We will help them become good teachers with proper trainings. 
Sponsors who donate to JOE will be the first batch to get these lessons! Learn more on the right hand of this page. 

How You Can Help 

Currently, we have a two-person team: me and Anthony.
I am working as a lecturer in a law school in Shenzhen, teaching a group of law students real practice in public interest advocacy, particularly on equal access to education. I devote 8 hours per day and all my income to JOE. 
Anthony is a law student with the same passion for education and equality. He works part time in JOE, and gathers a team of 6 student volunteers for JOE. 
We do not have an office yet, so most classes and meetings with the people we serve are held in my law school office. 
Our goal is to have JOE established as a social enterprise with a sustainable model of operation and growth. Right now, we are trying to raise funds for the first year so we can build that model. 
We need your help, and every bit of it means much! 
You can make a contribution to the campaign. 
You can introduce a friend who is willing to help, as an English teacher, or a legal volunteer. 
And, spread the word about the campaign! 

Thank you for pitching in! 

"Ultimately, the character of our society, who who are, is judged by how we treat the woman and child." - JOE

I am working as a lecturer in a law school in Shenzhen, teaching a group of law students real practice in public interest advocacy, particularly on equal access to education. I devote 8 hours per day and all my income to JOE. 
Anthony is a law student with the same passion for education and equality. He works part time in JOE, and gathers a team of 6 student volunteers for JOE. 
We do not have an office yet, so most classes and meetings with the people we serve are held in my law school office. 
Our goal is to have JOE established as a social enterprise with a sustainable model of operation and growth. Right now, we are trying to raise funds for the first year so we can build that model. 
We need your help, and every bit of it means much! 
You can make a contribution to the campaign. 
You can introduce a friend who is willing to help, as an English teacher, or a legal volunteer. 
And, spread the word about the campaign! 

Thank you for pitching in! 

"Ultimately, the character of our society, who who are, is judged by how we treat the woman and child." - JOE

story:
About this Project

We are frustrated with traditional healthcare communication because it is causing families everywhere to have avoidable, life-threatening and expensive mistakes. 

How can patients and their caregivers follow critical healthcare instructions when they don't understand them?

Imagine that your life depended on taking a bottle of pills properly. Now imagine how scary it would be if you were one of the 90 million people, who, for various reasons, cannot read, understand, or process the complexity of medical instructions. Now imagine that no one in your family can either! Medical care miscommunication can lead to crisis and even death. 

Patients and their caregivers should be able to receive their information in way that they can readily understand. That may mean that the patient needs their medication reminders and other information in Spanish or another language. It may mean that they need to hear it in English. In the case of English as a second language, many people learn to speak another language but they don’t read it well. And there are many others that find printed instructions very difficult to understand or inaccessible. And yet, the healthcare establishment continues to give us printed information designed for 14% of population that has high health literacy.


We are here with a solution for a new healthcare communication future! An easy to use multi-lingual tablet for patients and their caregivers that actually makes their lives safer and more organized.  With your help we can bring healthcare information to the rest of us.

Some of the SpeechMED+ Benefits For Patients and Their Caregivers.

Peace of mind with respect to healthcare because the patient and caregivers know exactly what to do and when.

Increased ability to make informed decisions about their healthcare because they understand the information given to them.

Help avoiding missed appointments, and medicine doses.

Ability to hear and understand lifesaving messages in their own language.

Assurance that caregivers, regardless of native language, can understand instructions.

Tactile keypad and audio information delivery to accommodate a person if visually challenged.

Keeps a list of allergies and medications for emergencies or the next medical appointment. 

Gives the ability to record notes and messages for patient, caregiver or health professional. 

Stores important documents in one place. Your documents can be uploaded to our secure cloud for easy access from the device or our secure cloud portal. 

Sends medication reminders with a picture of the pill. Generic medicines may look differently and the software allows you to take an actual picture from the device to show during the reminder. 

If the patient misses a medication reminder SpeechMED can send a lack of compliance text to the caregiver if there is one.

SpeechMED speaks in multiple languages for those that need it. 



What We Need & What You Get

What we are going to do with the money we raise?  We're almost there!

1. Finish our software development.

2. Tool a new case that is antibacterial and bump resistant.

3.  Mail you all of your goodies!


Features

Caregivers are frequently tired and worried about their patient.  They may work a job and still have children to manage. SpeechMED Caregiver is a simple to use tool to empower patients and their caregivers.  It allows them to upload a wide range of personalized care information including medications, reminders, emergency contacts, allergies and appointments. It also allows the Caretaker to monitor some of the patient’s activities remotely.  In addition instructions can be left in different language for other caretakers.



Risks & Challenges

Taylannas takes great pride and we have a passion for delivering the utmost quality in our products. We have had successful installations like our Menus That Talk and promise to deliver on what we promise.

Like every project there could be risks and challenges. 

* Product Manufacturing Delays- Taylannas has direct contact with all manufactures and will do the best in our power to make sure there are no delays. 
* Shipping Delays- When shipping out a project shipping delays could occur. If a product happens to get lost we will reship no questions asked.

COMMUNICATION IS OBVIOUSLY IMPORTANT TO US.  We promise to keep you informed about our progress and any delays.

story:
East West Eats: Recipes from the San Francisco Bay Area's Top Chefs

East West Eats began several years ago as an event featuring food from the Bay Area's top chefs. We've since asked more than 20 local chefs to contribute their favorite, mouth-watering recipes, from smoked salmon and strawberry salad rolls to fried mochi with red bean paste. We compiled them all into this one-of-a-kind cookbook, accompanied by gorgeous photographs taken by our award-winning photographers. 

A big thank you to our featured chefs: 

  • Charles Phan of Slanted Door 
  • Belinda Leong of B. Patisserie
  • Martin Yan of M.Y. China
  • Ronny and Willy Ng of M.Y. China
  • Chris Yeo of Straits
  • George Chen of China Live, opening in 2015
  • Francis Ang of Dirty Habit
  • Brian Beach of Strada Group and former executive chef of Le Colonial
  • Helen Mok Chan of Yank Sing
  • Eric Ehler of Seoul Patch, a popup restaurant
  • Remi Hayashi Girouard of Goody Goodie Cream & Sugar
  • Robert Lam of Butterfly
  • Tim Luym of Attic
  • Richie Nakano, former executive chef of Hapa Ramen
  • Alexander Ong, chef consultant and former owner of Betelnut Pejiu Wu Restaurants
  • Nathan Payo, formerly of Roy's
  • Vittal Shetty of Jalsa Catering and former executive chef of Amber India
  • Hiro Sone and Lissa Doumani of Ame and Terra
  • Philippe Striffeler of Restaurant ANZU at the Hotel Nikko 
  • Daniel Sudar of YSK Castro Inc. and Slurp Noodle Bar
  • Scott Whitman of soon-to-come Village Sake
  • Michael Yakura of Dobbs Ferry

... And support the Asian American Journalists Association's student scholarship program

East West Eats was conceived as a fundraiser for the Asian American Journalists Association's San Francisco Bay Area chapter, and has helped raised thousands of dollars for our student scholarship program. AAJA's mission is to: 

  • To provide a means of association and support among Asian American and Pacific Islander journalists, and to advance AAPI journalists as news managers and media executives.
  • To provide encouragement, information, advice and scholarship assistance to AAPI students who aspire to professional journalism careers.
  • To provide to the AAPI community an awareness of news media and an understanding of how to gain fair access.
  • To research and point out when news media organizations stray from accuracy and fairness in the coverage of Asian Americans and Pacific Islanders and AAPI issues.

The Impact

Your generous contribution will help us publish and distribute the cookbook. Proceeds will also support our student scholarship program.  

Risks & Challenges

We have already created the cookbook, but need funding to publish and distribute it. We need to receive at least 100 pre-orders to help bring down the cost of publishing the cookbook and to support our scholarship program. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Join AAJA or donate to AAJA. Please share this campaign widely!
